All Reviews

  1. I use it every week since I bought it and it was a very good (and cheap) investment! It's too bad I broke the plastic protection (that you put on top) but it was just an accessory. The best electric epilator I had so far :)
  2. I bought this epilator back in February 2011 and I STILL use it. I use it to remove my underarm hair and it works like a charm. I don't experience any hair breakage, it pulls the hair right out. I read some reviews of people complaining about ingrown hairs. I took care of that by exfoliating my underarms 2-3 times a week with a rough cloth while showering. It took care of the problem immediately, no more ingrown hairs! The little bag that it came in is now ripped down the middle, but I don't really care about that as long as the epilator works like it should! I honestly could not believe I bought it 4 years ago. I will definitely buy it again once my current one stops working, which I can't see happening any time soon. I highly recommend this!
  3. It's the best epilator I ever had! I really like it! It's fast, light, easy to clean. I never thought that i needed the light on the front but i do! It's so helpful. It helps to see the finest hairs. Trimmer works good. I has all necessary functions. I definitely recommend it to everybody!
  4. \\"My Wife's Review to this product.\\" I highly recommend this product. I am a regular waxer. I was incredulous to buy this product at first. But then after I read all of the reveiws, I decided to go ahead and order this epilator. The reveiws were correct, the pain is incredible. You'll get use to it though & each time you use it the pain diminishes. It removes the hair & makes your skin feel amazing!
  5. After using a little cheapsy one from Walmart to see if I liked it, I decided to upgrade to this one. I LOVE it! It is fast and efficient. One warning however.... I have never had a problem doing my underarms, but the \\"super-strong\\" head on this one is a bit too much. It did make me bleed a little, but it didn't hurt any more than normal. Also, don't even get close to a mole. OUCH! I still use that head on my legs, but have gone to the \\"beginner\\" head with rollers for underarms with no problems. I love the light on this. I am blonde, so it's hard to see hair sometimes until I get out in the sun. By then, it's too late. The light just shines on everything as I am using it. This is a great product and I think it is well worth the price.
  6. I'd never used an epilator before, nor had I ever waxed my legs or underarms. But I really got sick of shaving constantly and dealing with stubble and cutting my ankles, etc etc etc, so I thought I'd give this a try. I listened to the advice of other reviewers and it helped a lot! So I'm passing on their advice and a few tips of my own: 1) Use Veet or Nair for a good two or three weeks before your first epi use. I found it softened my hair and made it easier. I still use Veet every now and again to wipe away lighter thigh hair and thinner leg hairs. Can't believe how great it works after using the epi for two years! (Veet works much better if you first dampen your legs with a hot washcloth to open the hair follicles and soften the hair.) 2) Enjoy a glass of wine (or two) for the first epi. It does hurt, but just remember it will never hurt as bad again on your legs. 3) After two years, I barely even feel it on my legs. And the hair is WAY finer, comes in slower and lighter. Even with longish hair on my legs, you can barely see it or feel it...and I'm a brunette. I often do epi touch ups while watching tv. Remember, hair grows in cycles...a touchup every few days works great and goes faster than leaving it all for one hairy removal. 4) I use the epi on my underarms...it's a little less painful after two years, but it still hurts (especially near my period). For underarms, make sure you stay dry or you'll get a skin irritation! So apply deodorant or powder before using the epi on underarms. Much less irritation than shaving and hair comes in finer. 5) I tried to epi my bikini line and it was just too dang painful. Better luck to you! 6) For ingrown hairs on leg, I use a disinfected pin to lightly pop them out before using the epi. 7) I tried in grown hair serums and tea tree oil, etc., but eventually just stopped using them because they didn't work for me. After two years of using the epi, I barely get irritation anymore anyway. But a helpful hint to avoid exacerbating any irritation, avoid putting on lotions or cremes for a while after you epi.
  7. This is a great product...I use it as a supplement to waxing, for places that are harder to wax, and also for the little hairs that waxing sometimes misses. The first time I used it was pretty painful, as other reviewers have also said. After a couple times though, it is much more tolerable, less painful, less noticeable. I use it every few days to clean up little hairs that are growing in at different rates, and my legs are nice and smooth now most of the time with little effort! The only thing I would say against it is it is VERY noisy, so if you have housemates they will all know (or wonder) what you are doing. HArd to be private with it. Mostly I love it!
  8. 767 reviews and 4.5 stars. you automatically think it's an awesome product and put aside those reviews with one star or two star rating thinking those negatives happen to few unfortunate people. But then that unfortunate things happens to you and then you realize the importance of those bad reviews. This products is amazing. I have been shaving my legs for almost 10 years now and few weeks ago I thought \\"why not go for epilation which will leave me hairless for few weeks?\\" I googled the best epilator and read dozens of articles and zeroed in on braun silk epil x'elle. I tried the product. It was amazing. The pain which I dreaded so much after reading many reviews turned out to be bearable.I felt I truly loved this amazing product. It left my legs so smooth and hairless that I just loved it and thought I finally found the ultimate method of hair removal. For the next week and half I ended up admiring my \\"new\\" legs a whole bunch of times in a day. After a week and half, it all began... one red bump (with an ingrown hair in it) after the other erupted until in a few days my legs were covered with red bumps. I panicked and researched like crazy about remedies to ingrown hairs. After trying like crazy to tweeze the ingrown hair out with tweezers, I bought B & C skin tight ingrown hair solution and tried it for two days and ordered prince reigns solution online. I stopped using prince reigns (very expensive) as after two applications there was only 3/4 remaining in the bottle.Its been a week. Now although the red bumps have decreased in number, my legs have tiny hairs all growing right under the skin making it look like I haven't shaved. So it pretty much looks like I have some rash on my legs covered with hair. In my ten years of shaving I never had ingrown hairs. I just hope the hair frees out of the skin so I can happily go back to shaving. Am never using this epilator again! If anyone knows what to do about these ingrown hairs, please help me out.
  9. This epilator has a lot of features I like. Its sleek and comfortable to use with a light that shinning on the spot that you're removing hair. Also, the epilator has a powerful motor which its more powerful than the one I used before. But I found the cover for the head is very flimsy. It comes off very easily when the epilator is in use. I feel this shouldn't happen. therefor, I give the epilator 3 stars.

  11. This product is great. In the long run cheaper than waxxing and it last very long. I have built up an ability to use on my stomach, calves, and knees. Working myself up to thighs, bikini line and underarms. The good thing is that until I do --- there are various attachments that can be used so you can use as an electric shaver.
  12. This is my second Braun Epilator in the past 10 years. They are very reliable, and a great product. The one issue I have with this model is that the attachment you place over the blades will scratch your skin as it is pulling the hair. My skin is very sensitive, so I found this particularly irratating.
  13. It appears this product works extremely well for SOME hair/skin types. BUT, if you've never epilated before I strongly urge you to begin with a small test patch first. Thoroughly epilate one patch of one leg, perhaps just to the outside of the shin bone or wherever the hair grows thick. Then shave everywhere else. WAIT several weeks until you get re-growth on the test patch. I didn't think of doing this when I bought the Braun epilator. I followed the package instructions and other reviewers' recommendations carefully to epilate both legs completely. I did not find it at all painful, by the way. I exfoliated often, and waited. I encountered two problems. 1st, the machine did not successfully pull all the hair from the root. Some hairs were broken at or near the surface, so I had a fair bit of 'stubble' immediately. I kept epilating until eventually all the hairs were 'pulled'. But that wasn't the deal breaker. After a couple of weeks I noticed a strange, mildly unpleasant tingling sensation on my legs. After a few days of this I noticed that my legs were covered with hair. The re-growth had come in. The problem was that most of the hair was growing JUST UNDER a very thin layer of skin. The hairs were completely visible but impossible to shave OR epilate, protected as they were under that thin layer. I had to tweeze each hair (and there were many) out from under the skin. Once the hair was growing normally again, I decided to give the epilator another try. I thought the problem might improve over time. It didn't. After 3 full rounds with the same results,I stopped using the epilator several weeks ago and my legs still haven't recovered. I'm still struggling to get rid of the cycle of ingrowns, and the unsightly red bumps some of them caused. I think this problem probably occurs only for certain hair/skin types. I strongly caution all new users to test a small patch to see how the epilator works for your hair/skin.
  14. I'm a woman with very coarse leg hair and have never been able to get a smooth shave to last more than a few hours. I'm pleased to say that this epilator has done something no other device has been able to accomplish! I took the advice of others and shaved first, then I used the epilator. There were some areas around my ankles that I did not shave very well and OUCH! Take my advice and please get the hair as short as possible prior to epilating or it will hurt like hell! What really impresses me is that after four days, my legs are still soft and smooth. With shaving I would have to shave every day to keep the stubble away! I am prone to ingrown hairs, so I don't know how the new growth will be, but so far I have not had any problems. My very sensitive skin has not even turned red or hand one bump! I wish I had purchased this eplilator years ago! Bye bye stubble....Hello smooth legs! P.s. The underarm area is tricky. I attempted to epilate it, but the head kept falling off! I must be doing something wrong :(
  15. Good product! I have been use it for 2 years... and no problems! fast shipping!

  22. I absolutely love this product for my legs. I have very thick, coarse hair. It's not very painful, easy to use and is well worth the little bit of time it takes compared to shaving every other day. I also use it on my upper lip without much pain. But, I can't use it in the bikini area or underarms. Not only is it more painful but it produces redness - almost like scratches or a rash - from pulling at the skin or getting the skin caught in it. I have tried using it at different angles, etc, but haven't figured out how to use it without leaving marks. (If anyone has any solutions - I'd love to know)! Even so, I'm still happy with the product.
  23. This is a pretty handy epilator. It is easy to hold, removes hair well, and has a few heads that can be used. It is easy to clean. I've used it many times & have found it a worthwhile buy.
  24. Well as a guy I needed a way to remove hair, so I got this epilator; who really cares that this is marketed to women, as long as it works! I mostly needed this to remove my neck hair and a couple other places where I had unwanted hair. Worked VERY well. Just wish that the tweezers had a stronger grip, because having thick hair on my neck that's never been pulled out really hurts to have tugged over and over again until it finally gives. Was extremely painful and the tipple or quadruple tugs per hair didn't help much, but hey it works! and now my neck is hair free. Other areas were less painful and I imagine it to go much easier next time around. For a cheap product not marketed for men's hair it worked great. The clipper/razor attachment is pretty neat. The clippers work flawlessly for the most part, and the razor gets nice and close but leaves a lot of patching. Don't be fooled by the low price, get it!
  25. This epilator is just amazing. After hours of research, it is the answer to my prayers. My legs have very dense, very coarse blonde hair. When I shave, it only lasts for a few hours before it is rough and awful to touch. My British boyfriend started politely complaining about it. He said that European women seem to have the problem solved. So I did some research. I started with waxing. After letting my leg hair grow for two weeks, which I found almost unbearably itchy and annoying, I entered the nail salon, paid $35 and asked for a leg wax. Boy, was that painful! I have a really high tolerance for pain. I had a drug-free natural childbirth and I have been an avid bikini waxer for years. Still, leg waxing brought involuntary tears to my eyes. My two year old daughter was with me and she kept saying, \\"momma ouch.\\" Furthermore, my legs were not even smooth like I had hoped for in exchange for all of that pain. I decided there had to be a better way and I was determined to find it. I came across the epilator. Now, I am not saying it wasn't painful. But it was considerably better than waxing. I looked at several models before I bought the Braun Silk-Epil. Ultimately, because my hair is blonde, the built in light was key in my decision to buy that model. I have been very happy with my decision. The light is such an awesome part of the design. I took a hot shower, drank a glass of wine and then started epilating. It was fairly painful in areas with dense hair so I broke it down in to little steps and took my time. I changed areas if one became too sensitive. My very first use I was able to do both legs and part of my bikini line. That was three days ago and my legs are still way more smooth than they have ever been. My legs were slightly red the day after and it stung a bit when I took a shower but it was no worse than waxing. I plan on doing a touch-up in a few days. I seriously never ever want to use a razor again. The epilator is a bit expensive but notwhen you factor in the money that you save from not getting waxes and buying those stupid blades for disposable razors (which are bad for the environment). Three cheers for the Braun Silk Epil X'elle. There is no way I am letting those European girls have smoother legs than this American girl!
  26. I purchased this item awhile back because I was tired of shaving and waxing all the time so I research and looked at reviews for good epilators to put my money in since epilators don't come cheap. I ended up buying this one and I was planning on it to be painful because it is pulling from the hair but I am disappointed at the results I received from this product. It didn't take long before my hair grew back, within a week and I understand that there's different cycles that hair grows but this product is not efficient and wastes my time. It works well in the underarms better than my legs but to do my underarms, it takes five minutes each because I have to go over and over the same area for this epilator to pull my unwanted hair. On legs, I take up at least 45 minutes and I'm a very small girl and even when I go over and over making sure I get every part of my leg, the next day, I would notice a couple of hairs that the epilator did not get. Epilating in my opinion is the most painful thing I have ever done on my body, even getting a tattoo doesn't surpass. I bought this product expecting good results and less time spent on removing unwanted hair but it's only decent for my underarms and another thing is that it leaves ingrowns on my legs and underarms where I never had before epilating. This is the first epilator that I bought and I'm not sure if I plan on getting another epilator from another brand because this product let me down.
  27. its a great product i used it for the first time y'day, it was a lil painful yes, but the end result is awesome. I usually wax and shave too but this is so much more convenient. I'll tell you why Shaving - hair grows back really fast usually stand up is harder and darker Waxing- tme consuming/ get an appointment have to wait for a certain length expensive - 1 waxing session is one epilator this - do it at ur convenience, in your privacy free for sometime after doing it yes, i did have red patches but with some regular lotion they were gone. def recommend the product.   28. Review from the woman in the house that uses it: I've had a few of these silk-epil's over the years. What an improvement! Yes it does hurt the first time you use it, but after that it's pretty painless and there are no stubs and the hair grows back slowly and thinly. The light feature is an extra bonus. It's way better.
  29. I purchased this when I had an anniversary coming up, to avoid paying for what most salons refer to as a \\"pseudo-Brazilian\\" or \\"partial Brazilian\\" wax. It is not suitable for that kind of hair removal. But, I do still use it regularly. I use the epilator about twice a week, on my legs, underarms, and the part of the bikini area that actually shows when wearing a bikini. I do legs with the non-massaging epilator attachment, and underarms and bikini outskirts with the massaging head. It takes about half an hour. The epilator attachment cannot be used on the more sensitive areas of the bikini area. It's not a matter of pain--I have a high pain tolerance. It actually damages the skin, breaking blood vessels and leaving red marks. Plus, it doesn't effectively remove hair on such soft skin. The trimming/shaving attachment is better for this area, but for hairless skin it needs to be followed by a traditional shave with a razor. The epilator is great for legs and underarms, though. It's nice to not have to worry about whether I've shaved in the past day or two when wearing skirts and sleeveless tops. Just be sure you exfoliate regularly. You'll get a few ingrown hairs anyway, but not nearly as many as if you neglect to regularly exfoliate the areas you've epilated.
  30. This works like charm, its good product to buy. Most important its not made in China. Its a product made in Germany.
  31. Last time I tried epilating was ten years ago and it was a frightful experience with the EpiLady brand. I remember trying my underarms and the pain was unbearable, then to the legs and it wasn't any better. This year I decided to try again in hopes of some improvement with epilation through the years. The loud noise of the Braun Epilator is intimidating at first. I turned it on and placed the epilator on the palm of my hand just to get used to the sensation and amount of pressure needed. Then I started with my legs on the low setting. It was the same sensation of plucking your eyebrows. The rollers seem to stimulate your skin to make the sensation of hair plucking less intense. After doing my legs I had more confidence to go to my underarms. I used a little bit of baby powder to make sure the skin was dry. Now this was not a comfortable feeling but do-able. I did little sections at a time going different directions to catch every single hair possible. I spent about 30 mins. on each underarm taking little breaks to look at my work and telling myself the fear is all in your head. The underarm sensation is like the first time you pluck your eyebrows but just like your eyebrows the more you epilate the easier it gets. Since my first experience with Braun, I only epilate once a week to get stray hairs and use the higher setting, maybe like 5-7 under each arm. My mind is not scaring me anymore with the fear of the noise. I am even starting to do my bikini line! Oh and I've noticed I don't need to use underarm deodorant. I'm only using it when I go out somewhere important just in case it's too good to be true but so far I've worked around the house put up a sweat and there is no underarm odor. I guess since the hair gets pulled out at the root it doesn't give any bacteria a chance to grow. hahaha!
  32. I can't shave because my skin is super sensitive. Because of this, I've been a waxer since 16 (23, now). I was looking for a product to remove the hair on my legs when they're too short to wax, but necessary to remove because of summer time activities. I live in Southern CA- no time to wait for hair to grow to a waxable length! Because of the mess of waxing, gradually over summer I started using this epilator for everything- my legs, arms, back. I can't use it on my bikini line because it hurts too badly, but I just use the shaver attachment. I find that I have to epilate once a week. It takes me about an hour to do all of those areas. I dare not use this on my pubic area. Wax is what I swear by for that Also, my sister has thick hair growth on her face and neck that is so stubborn that sometimes it isn't fully removed for her. I told her about this epilator and it works well for her! This is a great buy! I can't compare it to shaving since I'm basically allergic to rasors, but compared to waxing it's definitely less of a mess. And pain factor? NONE for me. Then again, I've been waxing for 7 years.
  33. I can't believe I went forever without this amazing product. The need for me to shave every other day was getting me down. (Seems like the older I get the hairier I am!) I read all the reviews I could find and was a little apprehensive about hearing that it would hurt the first few times and it is very mildly uncomfortable at first.   34. I read a lot of the reviews of this item before purchasing this product from Amazon. After I received it, I was nervous to try it, but I was so disgusted at the electric shavers that I took a deep breath and started working on my legs. I learned that it's not bad if you take short strokes. It's now a week later and no stubble! I never want to go back to electric shavers or messy blades and shaving cream.
  35. I bought this product after reading through lots of reviews on Amazon of this and similar devices. This is the first epilator I have ever used. I made the decision to switch after years of razor burn and because the hair on my legs grows so quickly that if I shave in the morning, I often would have stubble before bedtime. Anyway, the first 2 times I used this it hurt A LOT, but as soon as I was finished I was fine and didnt have to do it again for almost a week. I also bought some after epilation cream that is supposed to help with soothing and prevention of ingrown hair. I have yet to decide it that or normal lotion is better. Then the pain got progressively better each time I used it for a few weeks then went on vacation and decided to shave normally for a week. The next time I used the Epilator it was almost as bad as the first time, so needless to say I will continue with the epilator vacation or not. I have been using it regularly for a couple of months now and love it. Pain in tolerable and mainly around sensitive areas like ankles, bikini area, and back of knee. My legs are very smooth, I do not have daily stubble, and best of all no painful razor burn. To prevent ingrown hairs, I have started using pumice stone lightly on legs in the shower every week or so. Sometimes I do find that I have missed spots or that hair grows more rapidly in one spot, so sometimes I just touch up with the epilator more often, but usually just use it every 4-7 days. Overall, I think the product is great, but have not used other epilators to compare it to. I would recommend it to anyone with fast hair growth or problems with traditional shaving.

It has a great grip and I like the plug because is not too big and I can have something else plugged in the bathroom. I have not used the shaver yet but I will update this review as time goes by. I thought the price was reasonable since I had paid about the same amount for my last epilator about 4 years ago.

  40. I really really wanted to like this product, and thought it would be the answer getting the smooth skin I would like to have...I was wrong. I am a MALE amateur bodybuilder, and I am fairly hairy which I try to keep under control.. usually with electric clippers and a razor shave. I saw this product, and after reading all the good reviews, it sounded great, no razor burn, no itchy re-growth, ect... I am not at all squeamish and I feel that I have a high tolerance for pain, but this device was epic in the amount of pain it causes. I literally almost vomited at one point from the pain, no I am not kidding, I also felt at one point that I might pass out. I am sure this device works very well on a womans fine and sparse body hair, but for guys with thick dense body hair like me, forget it. No amount of gritting your teeth will help. I want to stress that I am NOT exaggerating here, it hurts worse than any pain I have ever felt. I managed to do one full thigh and half of my abdomen before having to give up out of shear horrific agony. Now my skin feels rough and very sore like a bruise and a bad sunburn mixed together, it hurts to the touch. Awful.
  41. I never epilated before. I shaved, plucked and recently tried home waxing. Waxing caused a bad outbreak and it was very painful. So, I decided to check out the Braun epilator and all I can say is, \\"Where have you been all my life????!!!!\\" Did it hurt? Not if the hair was very short and I can't believe how it still removes super short hair! The trick is to do it on clean, dry skin. Also, do it in a circular motion since most hair (at least mine) grows in differently. Don't use it on the face (trust me, I tried and ended up buying a smaller one meant for more sensitive areas). Also, make sure your bikini area is very short and that you have no moisturizer or deodorant on when you do the underarm. Seriously, it doesn't hurt that much... waxing is a killer but epilating is just tweezing (and I've been tweezing all of my life so no biggee)! Sensitive areas are a bit more sensitive; legs are easy (just like shaving). I can't recommend this epilator enough. But one thing, Braun, WHERE IS THE BRUSH TO CLEAN IT WITH????? Even my little epilator came with one!!!! For the price, Braun should have included the brush!!!!

  45. I have used the epilator a few times now and the overall impression is very positive. I do not regret my purchase at all. If you are fed up with waxing, then this epilator is a very nice alternative. This epilator is better than my previous one (which was a good one, although I forgot which one it was). Are listed below my pros and cons. The pros definitively beat the cons. Pros: - It is fast (sooooo much faster and more convenient than wax). It is fast because it removes almost everything from the first run, you don't need to go through the same spot ten times. - It is efficient: it removes even small hair. - it is not particularly painful compared to other epilators. Note that if you have never used an epilator before, then it will hurt (not the device's fault, though). - The little bag that comes with the epilator is handy. Cons: - A little expensive (still much cheaper than wax) - I got maybe slightly more ingrowns than with my previous epilator. Nothing dramatic (5 or 6 per leg). But because of it, I did not give the epilator 5 stars. - It is a little noisy. Neutral: - I found the light useless.

  50. I am impressed with how well this thing works! I did feel some stubbliness after the first run, but I didn't follow directions and SLOWLY glide the epilator up my leg. I went kind of quickly. Plus my skin is on the dry side, and I did not exfoliate my legs first. After the second run a week later, and after exfoliating in the shower first, my skin is much smoother, much less stubbly. I am so happy. Brazilian bikini wax is a thing of the past for anyone who has this little tool! Some discomfort on first go round, and I learned I have to keep skin pulled flat to allow this to work well. Now the \\"hair-pulling\\" is very easy and painless. Definitely recommended!

  52. This is the best product in the world. Looks like a torture device? Yes. Feels like one the first time you use it? Absolutely. Continues to feel like one forever? NO WAY. I've been using this now for a couple of months and do not even FEEL it on my legs. I have to remind myself that it actually DID hurt the first time I used it. My legs are SO smooth. They stay smooth for so much longer, and the hairs are teeny and soft now. Also, I have fewer hairs growing back. My husband told me yesterday morning that my legs were \\"SO smooth!\\" (and he rarely comments on such things either way). The funny thing was that the hairs that WERE there had been allowed to grow out to 1/4 inch! I have the kind of hair that is SO DARK and THICK that even when my legs were freshly shaved and perfectly smooth you could see the dark little hairs through the skin. No longer! They are GONE! Follow the other reviewer's instructions pertaining to how to start epilating and you'll be golden. Also, it is possible to do you bikini area. Pop some Ibuprofen, give it an hour to settle in, and use Gigi's Numbing Spray (Amazon or Sally's) and give THAT a good three-five minutes to settle in. It will still hurt a lot, but be bearable. And it's WORTH IT! Best bikini line hair removal out of all the products I've tried (wax, shave, Nair, Magic Powder). LONG lasting. Same goes for my underarms (you could REALLY still see the hairs even on smooth skin there before the Epilator), but less painful than bikini lines. Yes, you will get ingrown hairs. As long as you use a strong exfoliating sponge (I found a great super-rough cloth one at Wal-Mart for cheap) you'll be fine. If you still have trouble do what I do and use an Acne Cleanser on the exfoliating scrubber. The medicine in the Acne Cleanser helps to remove dead skin cells. Keep your skin well moisturized too. Dry skin = dead skin which = ingrown hairs. Cost an issue? Just imagine how much you spend on razors, shaving cream,depilatory cream, waxing... and then think of spending sixty something dollars once and never having to buy that stuff again. This is the best model I've ever used. No need to spend more money. I recommended this product on my blog and got two of my friends using it regularly, and they got two of THEIR friends using it regularly. Stick with it and you will NEVER be sorry.

  59. I used to be a regular shaver, but had waxed a few times before, and clearly liked the benefits of waxing but I just can't afford the price tag. I bought this epilator after looking for tons of products and reviews online. I'm not going to lie, when I first tried it, it hurt. It really hurt. But after very few uses, it got a lot better. Now I do my entire legs, bikini line, and armpits in about 30 minutes, without a need for breaks in between. Here's what I found out that helped a lot: 1) For the first time, shave your legs first (or wax, if that's what you do). This will result in a lot fewer hairs, and will let you get used to the pain without actually hurting too much. In the beginning, I used the epilator every three days or so, so there never were too many hairs at one time to be epilated. This was the only time I shaved since getting the epilator. It just made things more bearable, and now I can deal with the number of hairs that grow, since your hairs just never grow all at once. 2) For your underarms, it'll really hurt if you just try with all the hairs grown. What I did was let the hair grow for a bit, a few days, then I actually tweezed them! Yes, I spent quite a bit of time on that. But then, the few hairs that I had left were much more bearable to epilate,and now I do my underarms really, really fast, and almost pain free, since there are never too many hairs at once. 3) I do my bikini line the same way I do my legs, but I haven't got up to doing a Brazilian yet. A normal bikini line is a no brainer though. 4) It's really important to pull the skin that is being epilated, that helps with the pain a lot. And, just so you can actually believe me, I am a very hairy, latina woman. I have black, thick hair EVERYWHERE. This is a lifesaver. It will hurt at first, but I promise that if you stick to it, it'll keep getting better and better.
  60. My sister bought this epilator and she said i should try it. okay, i admit i was terrified. I had only shaved for years, never waxed in my life because i don't know if i could tolerate the pain. But, i was tired of shaving my underarms and legs every other day and thought i needed to suck it up and go for it. I'm not going to lie, this this is so painful, i did my underarms and legs. After i did my legs, i got all red dots from where the hairs were removed, ( it looked like a rash), but eventually it all went away and i was left with smooth legs and underarms. I would recommend doing this in the evening when you don't plan on going out or on a day that you know you will be wearing pants the next day or so. I love it for the underarms because it last so much longer and grows less and less. it hurts soooo much, but it is completely worth it at least for the underarms alone and saving time and money on razors, shaving cream, and the cuts that come along with it. It hurts less and less as you do it more, and i'm so glad that i bought it and used it. i haven't gotten the courage to try bikini area, but I think i will eventually get there!

  68. Starting in 6th grade I got teased for having very thick, dark hair on my arms and legs and have been self conscious about it ever since and I am now in my mid-40's. For years I bleached the hair on my arms and two years ago I \\"splurged\\" on laser hair removal as I was standing up in a wedding. This epilator does as good of a job as the laser treatments and is MUCH less expensive. I am so sold on this product!! The first time you use it I would recommend using the shaving head that comes with it to get hair to the appropriate length. Yes, it's going to hurt (it's pulling your hair out by the root for heaven's sake, what do you expect?), but it is so worth it. I would also recommend applying some aloe after the first few uses to cool the skin. I have a pretty low tolerance for pain and didn't find it that unbearable especially after a few uses. I've been using it for about 6 weeks now and am having to use it less and less frequently because the hair isn't growing back and when it does it is much finer and lighter. The light is very helpful but if you can do it in the daylight or under flourescent lighting, that will help as well. You will be shocked to see how many hair follicles you really have -- I never knew there were so many on your kneecap! There is no way shaving can do justice to removing hair decently (or semi-permanently like the epilator does). Your skin will also feel amazingly soft as also gets rid of dead, dry skin cells as you're using it. I haven't been brave enough to try the underarm area and would be VERY hesitant to try it on facial hair. I have had a few ingrown hairs but knew to watch for them so was able to take care of them right away before they got too bad. I don't find the noise obnoxious -- when I used it the first time my family asked what I was doing and I just said \\"shaving my legs\\". They are used to hearing my husband's electric shaver and this is only slightly louder than that -- not a big deal. I only wish I would havefound this product years ago; would've saved a lot of aggravation, knicks and cuts and razor burn. Love this product and HIGHLY recommend it! Ladies, do yourself a favor and get this -- you deserve it!!

  72. I'm very happy with this product. I had an earlier version which was good, but this is even better. Initially I thought the light function was over the top, but actually it's useful to see short/fine hairs. It's pretty efficient, and hurts no more than any other epilator I've used before.
  73. I purchased this epilator purely based on the reviews here. It works really well, it's fast and clean. It's easy to take apart and clean it afterward. The LED light feature did not really help me since I shaved with lights on. HOWEVER, it definitely hurts! I got few bleeding spots each time I used it. If it is not this painful, I would give it 5 stars.
  74. No my wife is shaving her unwanted hair, specially on sensitive aria with no pain
  75. I got this because I was tired of paying all of that money for razor blades. So, my mom and I did a little research and chose this product. It hurt a little at first, but after a little time, it was no big deal. However, this cut my hair instead of pulling it out. I ended up with stubble all over the place and had to shave anyway. I also had a horrible time using this on my knees as it literally ate up and cut the skin on them. After using it for 4 months, I gave it to my mom and told her she was more than welcome to use it. And of course she does, with perfect results. (PARENTS!!!) So, I guess it really depends what you 'hair type' is. Mine grows back fast and is really thick. My moms grows back slower and is really fine. But for me, this was a waste of money.
  76. Rather than write a book here... click \\"see all my reviews\\" to get my reivew on the 20 tweezer model of Braun epilator. Everything there... applies here, except this one has 40 tweezers. Then... First of all, order this from Drugstore dot com, where the price is less. Second of all... the accessories that supposedly come with this, don't. I don't know why, this is not the first place I have seen the accessories wrong, Drugstore has it wrong, too. You will get the epilator with the massaging head... the EfficiencyPro clip (which I think is useless)... and a shaver head with the attachment to cut your hair to the best length for epilation (which I haven't used yet, so can't comment on...) You won't get the cooling glove or the gentle start head. Now... assuming you were a good girl (or boy) and followed my directions to go to my review on the other epilator... here is a continuation of that. Pretty short and sweet. This thing works GREAT, for pulling hair. It does in fact have twice the tweezers of the other Brauns so yes, it does work faster, and IMO does a more thorough job. The casing is a pretty sparkly blue which, while irrelevant to the performance of the product, is quite pleasing to the eye. But that's about all I can say that is good. The tweezers, rather than being two metal thingies that clamp together (as with the 20 tweezer silk epil), are actually just one metal hicky that clamps against the plastic of the epilator head. It works fine, but I have to wonder about the long term reliability of such a design and wonder why Braun would make it like this. Then, the epilator head is designed so that, if you don't have the massaging head on it (an attachment I find useless and cumbersome) the gears of the head are exposed, which is,of course, an aesthetic matter, but makes the quality of this product seem less than that of the other silk epils. The light, which seems like a good idea, is really just kind of... blinding.It does illuminate the area being epilated, but it does so at the cost of seeing anything else clearly. It has that effect where, you know, if you look at just a little bit of a picture, you can't figure out what the whole picture is? It would be easier to see all your legs in good light than try to see a small portion at a time in great light. Plus if you are moving the epilator in such a fashion that the light is on the other side... IE you are doing the back of your left calve, from the inside, sitting on the floor and moving the epilator sort of down and around to the back... you really can't figure out what you are looking at. It's hard to describe, but the light makes things harder to figure out, not easier - and there is no way to disable the light. I have actually taken the 40 tweezer head and use it on my other silk epil, because I really don't like the light. I use it in the broadest diaylight I can, finding early morning light as the sun comes in our patio door to be especially helpful/horrifying (you are always hairier than you think you are). I think if I had to use the light, if I didn't have the option to use the lightless unit, I would be a lot more unhappy with this product. Anyway it's great in ways but... I am left somehow thinking \\"Wow, Braun had a great idea here!\\" and \\"What the $@%! was Braun thinking here??\\" which is kind of odd. They should really just take the 20 tweezer unit and make it have 40 double-metal-thingied tweezers, don't change anything else. OK, the blue sparklies are nice. This is actually sort of a Eurpopean product - if you go to Braun's website, they only have the X'Elle on the European site. I wonder if this model of the X'Elle (there are several other models with various attachments) is a US - only model and is of lesser quality than the others. No way to know for sure but I find it odd that this is the only one for sale in the US (at this time) and the quality is so not in keeping with the other Silk Epils. I am really not sure of giving this 3 or 4 stars... so I will err on the side of generous here. It's not a bad product, but bear in mind its flaws.
  77. I started waxing a long time ago. After some time, when my hair growth was so much less, I switched to an epilator. At first I used the Epilady, which I liked. But recently I got a new Epilady, which was horrible. I decided to take a chance on the Braun, and I am thrilled with it. It's very fast and does a fabulous job. I don't find it painful to use; another reviewer indicated she had significant pain with it, but this was difinitely not my experience. I would highly recommend this product.
  78. After using this product for a year its a better time for a review. First, let me say how GD painful this thing is. I have a large tattoo on my ribs and this thing is painful. I get painkillers from my doctor to use it. Secondly, it does remove the dark hairs efficiently but the little blonder ones will break off and turn into ingrown hairs which I can squeeze like a pimple to which a hair half an inch long will come out. I wear pants to work made of a synthetic materials so that doesn't help. It seems that before I get through both of my legs, that it doesnt work as well; grabbing less hairs when I go over them. That also leads to broken hairs causing them to be ingrown. Maybe its that it hurts soo bad I try to hurry. This machine is literally pulling your hairs out one by one. It does great for bikini line but it can cause you to bleed as those hairs are coarser. OH. and it will snag skin there so be careful. The good thing was once those dark hairs are pulled they do take longer to come back and the little ones left behind weren't noticeable to the touch. Do NOt shave in between. Use a cream specifically for this to make the hairs grow back finer and slower. Emjoi makes a good one. The goal is for your hair to be less thick eventually or stop coming in all together. I touched it to my boyfriends arm so he could appreciate what it takes for soft legs every night and he screamed like a little girl.
  79. I owned an older version for a few years, was happy with it, and didn't really think the improvements to this new one could be major. I bought it only because it was time to replace the other. I love everyhting about it, but mainly the much higher speed (takes me about 25-30 min to do both legs) and the light (which makes life easier for my eyes). The design and travel bags are also very nice. I highly recommend the product for anyone who needs time efficiency & flexibility and does not have an unusually high pain threshold (if you ever waxed, you can certainely be friends with this one). Cheers
  80. This model is painful even compared to Philips epilators and Brown used to be better.
  81. I had an older version of this product, which I used for years, but the new one blows the old one away! Less pain, the light gives better visibility to the area I'm epilating, and it pulls even the tiniest hairs out. I did remove the outer piece which acts as a comfort guard, but I only recommend doing so if you have very short hairs or if you've used epilators for a long time. It's so easy to use that I just leave the X'elle plugged in all the time and when needed, I just whisk off the small hairs that have started to grow back. I've found that if I use a good exfoliating soap in the shower, I don't get any ingrown hairs or bumps, which are very common when epilating. With my old epilator, I always had nasty bumps that would leave marks. I'm so happy I tried this product!
  82. i have been using epilators for quite a few years and this is very different than any i have ever used. it really is alot gentler than what i have used. the best part of all is the light. i have found myself in some very uncomfortable positions trying not to miss any hairs anywhere and this simple switch for instant light lets me see every hair in the darkest room. i recommend this epilator for everyone who has ever used a depillatory and whomever is contemplating using one.
  83. I was skeptical about this product at first, but once I used it, I loved it. It does hurt a little when you first use it, but after that it's painless. I like the two speed settings and the light.
  84. Recently I had a foot injury and I knew that for many months to come I would not be able to do my own waxing as I could not stand nor twist my body around. So I bought myself this epilator after reading many reviews about this product and many similar ones. I have to say that I did not have high hopes that it would work for me. I have a lot of dark and strong hair even after more than 30 years of waxing. The first time I used my new epilator, the hair on my legs were quite long ( almost 8 weeks worth !)and I did not shave them to a shorter length. It was a bit uncomfortable, but certainly not what I would call \\"painful\\". I have to admit I was pleasantly surprised when my skin felt smooth afterward and stayed that way. After a week or so I did some touch-ups over parts that I had probably missed the first time. Now after a period of 3 weeks, I had to epilate again. Not all hair had grown. There was definitely no pain or discomfort at all, The skin remains soft as soft as when I wax. I have used the epilator only on the legs as I'm hesitant to use it for facial hair. As a first time user, I would definitely recommend it. It convenient and practical. Will I go back to waxing? At the moment I would say no. I will continue waxing the underarms though, as hair seem ingrown there. The reason I gave it 4 starts instead of 5, is the fact that in certain areas you have to go over the hair several times from different directions. I'm still trying to figure out if maybe I'm not holding it at the right angle, hence this problem. Last but not least, for the legs, I highly recommend it.
  85. This is the best epilator I have ever tried. Although it is not rechargeable (you have to stay plugged in) it works like a dream, missing very few hairs on the first pass and getting them on the second. Ladies, I will not lie. The first couple of times you use this it is rather unpleasant. However, after the third time, it becomes much less painful, more like running a boar-bristle hairbrush over your skin. The results are so worth the initial pain. If you are like me and have dark hair, even with shaving you can still see dark spots, especially on the ankles (the most painful area, by the way). This, though, takes care of that and leaves your skin soft, smooth, and hair-free. I would recommend 4 things: do not use this the day you need to be hair-free - do it two days before. Then the day before, use it again to catch any remaining hairs; the first couple of times you use this, take a couple of Advil or something a half hour before you use it - this will help take the edge off; and remain calm - don't tense up because that will make it hurt worse; and lastly, I find it better to start at the knee and work my way down - the rollers soothe the skin and it makes it less unpleasant than starting at the ankle and working your way up. Since hair grows in cycles, you will need to use this every couple of days for a couple of weeks to get all the hair. After that, though, you will just need to use it when necessary, which then makes the hair finer, and thus less painful. Overall, this is great - cheaper overall than waxing, lasts longer and gets skin smoother than shaving, and doesn't leave chemical burns like creams can. You are tough, ladies, and this is worth some discomfort if you want smooth legs.
  86. I quite like this product. I've had it for about a month now and I think the investment was worth it. The first time you use it it is a bit painful, but after it is a breeze. I actually don't allow the hair to grow too long, as they start to show I use the epilator again and it is almost pain free. It is so convenient, the little light is a must because it allows you too see the very tiny hairs even in the back of the legs, so I would highly recommend the epilator that comes with light. Pain wise I think that for women with medium to fine hair this is a great option, but if you have really thick hair I heard that this can be very painful. Hair grows after about 10 days, but that changes depending on the person. Overall I highly recommend it!
  87. I've been using this epilator for a few months and I can't say it is anything special. I only use it for my legs, and the hair grows back in 2 to 3 days, not 2 to 3 weeks. Maybe the Braun breaks most of the hairs instead of getting it down to the root. I don't know, but for my dark hair the Braun doen't work very well.

I have not yet tried it any where else on my body but I also don't mind shaving other areas that are more tender everyday (especially my arm pits). Maybe some numbing lotion and Tylenol and hey, we're all good! 5 stars for product's ability, but for my excessive pain, I'm taking one star away.

  97. I recommend doing your underarms first...(make sure you're sitting on the floor when you do this)...when you regain consciousness and go after the hair on your legs, the pain won't seem NEARLY as bad!! My armpits were swollen for two days! OUCH! Seriously, the jury is still out as to whether I'm going to keep on doing my underarm areas with this thing as I'm not sure I'll ever get used to the blinding pain. Not even with a glass of wine on board! But my legs are doing okay. Yes, the first time was a real ordeal, but subsequent maintenance (once a week) has been very quick and relatively painless. Overall, I don't think my legs are quite as smooth as they were with shaving...but, then again, I don't have stubble two days later, either so the pro outweighs the con. I suspect that some of my finer leg hairs are actually being broken off as opposed to pulled out as mentioned by an earlier reviewer. This is probably why my legs aren't quite as smooth as I wish. I do get bumps from ingrown hairs now and have to regularly exfoliate with a BufPuf sponge, but still, not a bad product. UPDATE - 8 June 2008 - I've been using this torture device for nearly a year now. I never did gather the courage to attempt to tackle my underarms again, but I did continue doing my legs on a regular basis. I was always plagued with ingrown hair bumps, especially around my ankles and knees and could never completely eliminate the problem even with exfoliation and regular sluffing with a BufPuf sponge. Also, I always had kind of a rough, stubbly feeling the entire length of my legs and I'm positive it was because my hairs were being broken off at skin level as opposed to being pulled out. So . . . I began to ask myself why on earth I was putting up with the pain of having my leg hairs pulled when I wasn't gaining the benefit of smooth, silky skin. I quit using the Silk-epil about six weeks ago and have resumed my regular shower dates with my razor. My ingrown hair bumps havedisappeared and my legs couldn't be smoother and silkier. I use the Gillette Venus razor two to three times a week and couldn't be happier. Oh . . . the Silk-epil? I sold it on an online auction site!
  98. I bought this after the tweezer head on my Emjoi started \\"grabbing\\" my skin after a couple of years. It worked great on my arms, but I used this to do a \\"Brazilian\\" wax too and it was horrible for the bikini area. I tried leaving the hair longer, I tried trimming it a bit, and the darn thing would just grab hair, pull it enough to be painful and then either break the hair off or leave it there. I breezed through my arms in about five minutes if that. The \\"Brazilian\\" wax if you will, took, no joke, four hours, and the area still felt stubbly! I'm either going to buy a replacement head for my Emjoi and just know I need to replace this part every couple of years, or upgrade to the latest Emjoi. I am going to use this unit on my arms, arm pits, and legs. It's tweezers are half metal and half plastic while the Emjoi's are metal, so I don't think this unit has the pulling power to 'pull' out strong willed hairs.
  99. The light is great and the power/strength is fine, but the placement of the two rollers is a problem and will not effectively epilate in some places (forced to go at certain angles sometimes to fit) --- only an almost direct/flat application on the face of the rollers will work. Trying to use an edge or one side will not work. Also, the interchangeable cover would not stay in place after a few months and I just ended up using it open top with the rollers fully exposed. Recommend the 1) Emjoi Optima or 2) Emjoi Emagine instead.
  100. Way back in the dark ages otherwise known as the 1980's, I tried the original epi-lady (not sure what it was called exactly) and found it to be a horrid device that was surely created for nothing more than torture. After 20 seconds, I gave up and vowed \\"never again!\\". Luckily, I changed my mind and decided to give this one a try.<br /><br />The X'elle really does work and the feeling is tolerable, if not exactly comfortable. In fact, in some areas it really doesn't hurt at all and the only sensation is that of a pulling. I know, that doesn't sound good but I find it quite satisfying because it lets me know that the thing is working. And as others have said, it does get easier to tolerate the more you do it. The first time was definatly the most difficult. Of course, after you do it a time or two, the amount of hair that you have that needs to be removed is actually less and therefore, the process takes far less time and is less painful.<br /><br />An interesting tidbit for those who really want something by which to judge the pain. I suffer from a condition called Fibromyalgia. The symptoms are numerous but one thing FMS causes is extreme hypersensitivity of the skin. There are days that even a slight touch feels like a blow torch on my skin. Granted, I avoid epilating on those days. ;) But even on \\"good\\" days, my skin is very sensitive. Because of this, I was even more hesitant to try this device but I hated shaving enough to give it a go. Surprisingly, I am able to tolerate the feeling. Now, if a person with FMS can use it....;)<br /><br />Also I'd like to refer to something another poster said. She claimed that all of the advertised accessories don't really come with the X'elle. I have to disagree with that.<br /><br />She said that the \\"gentle start head\\" is not included. Well, it is included. In fact, it's the only head for epilating included.<br /><br />\\"Gentle start\\" refers to a feature, not an entirely separate head as that reviewer apparently believes. There are two speeds on the X'elle. The first and slower one is what Braun calls the \\"gentle start mode\\". They claim that this mode is less painful and easier to start with until a person has grown accustomed to the sensation. Personally, I don't agree and find the slower speed to actually be harder to take the faster one. But it's there if you prefer it.<br /><br />The X'elle does come with a second head but that head is a shaving and trimming head. I have found the shaver to be quite effective as well. Obviously, there are parts that a woman just can't bring herself to use an epilator on. The shaver/trimmer takes care of these parts quite nicely.<br /><br />Second, the other reviewer says that the advertised \\"cooling glove\\" is absent. I don't see anything mentioned about a cooling glove. Perhaps the description has changed since she purchased it. (?)<br /><br />I've had the X'elle for at least a year and have had no problem with function at all. The cord could be a little longer but besides that, I've loved using this. The results are well worth the small amount of pain involved.n the X'elle. The first and slower one is what Braun calls the \\"gentle start mode\\". They claim that this mode is less painful and easier to start with until a person has grown accustomed to the sensation. Personally, I don't agree and find the slower speed to actually be harder to take the faster one. But it's there if you prefer it. The X'elle does come with a second head but that head is a shaving and trimming head. I have found the shaver to be quite effective as well. Obviously, there are parts that a woman just can't bring herself to use an epilator on. The shaver/trimmer takes care of these parts quite nicely. Second, the other reviewer says that the advertised \\"cooling glove\\" is absent. I don't see anything mentioned about a cooling glove. Perhaps the description has changed since she purchased it. (?) I've had the X'elle for at least a year and have had no problem with function at all. The cord could be a little longer but besides that, I've loved using this. The results are well worth the small amount of pain involved.

  110. First I thought that this thing is great because of the good reviews, but it was not (for me). Maybe it is good for the technology not for the \\"performance\\", that's why I gave it a 2. This thing hurts! a lot! A lot more than waxing. You can feel your hairs being tweezzed one by one, not like waxing. WHen I first used this on my legs, the hairs got cut instead of pulled off. I thought I did something wrong, so I did it on my other leg and still the same result. Maybe for the other people who rated this with a 4-5 stars, maybe they are just comfortable with it. I have been waxing since I can remember having my first armpit hair, and using this product is not like that. For those who have been waxing, I suggest that you try this first or other cheap products like this epilator, so that you would know if this one is right for you. For me, I will stick with waxing because it is less painful and I'm not scared to use it. I will be sending this back. I hope this review would help anyone who would want to shift from waxing to an electronic epilator. The pain factor for this is very high, maybe higher than that of waxing for those who have not yet tried it. Ouch! really.
  111. I've used it twice and I still have a lot of hair. It seems to break off a lot of the hair instead of pulling it. I know it pulls some though because I feel it. I am squeamish and I don't think this hurts. I actually kind of like the sensation. I hear that if you keep using it it work better and better....I shaved after the last use because I had stubble after using it.
  112. I use to have to shave everyday and i would still have prickly hair. I'm blessed with dark hair that never leaves. I've tried waxing but it is way to messy and i believe the pain is about the same! I've used it EVERYWHERE, my bikini line, underarms and a little on my chest and arms. Again i'm super hairy! Well the pain is pretty intense at first, but i just keep thinking about how nice my legs are going to be afterward. For me they still aren't SILKY smooth, but i've only been using it for about 2 weeks, but you can't see the black hairs under the skin anymore which is a plus. I used it on my underarms and it was AMAZING! i did have to stop every few seconds to breathe off the pain but it feels the same as waxing with better results. My underarms are now really soft and there are no signs of Black forest hair anymore. My husband loves it, i used to have to wait a couple days to shave my underarms so they would be really smooth, now i can actually wear tank tops anytime i want. I recommend epilating while watching tv, something to take your mind off of it. Negatives- My skin was a little splotchy after my first time using it, so i put on a lot of lotion and they were gone afterawhile, my underarms were a little tender after using it, but i didn't break out. I recommend holding your skin really tight. My bikini line had a lot of pain and i broke out a little but it also went away and is soft now. Also my legs and arms get a lot of dry skin afterwards, so i recommend putting on a nice bit of lotion, and exfoliating, which is good for you anyway! I love this product and i'll probably be buying it for friends. It's great, if your worried about the pain atleast try it. you can buy it at target and a few other places, and they have a nice return policy. you will get ingrown hairs, but you got them when you were shaving also, just not as bad. TIPS: If you can't stand the pain wax first, it makes the hair thinner. Second I wouldn't use this on my face, my hair is already thin so i use a shaver, not a razor or an electric razor but a trimmer, my hair doesn't grow back black and it's easier then going to get waxed all of the time. UPDATE: So i've had this thing for a couple months now. I still like it but i have to shave after i epilate, except under the arms, which i must say my underarms have never looked better. No more five oclock shadow, and they are baby butt smooth. I waxed the other day and it actually tickled. my underarm hair is sooo thin now, if anything i will just keep it for my underarms. Or my bikini line, but everytime i go to try it there again, i quit breathing. lol. Just like waxing before the \\"big pull\\". But if you are a brave soldier and a mild alchoholic, i totally recommend it for the bikini line also. I could count the hair's on my legs now, because they are spread out, which is better, but i'm sad that i still have to shave. I'll just wait until they come out with a wonder product, that gets rid of hair to the root.

I got really sick of going to expensive waxing salons etc. I am a little worried about trying this on my bikini but who knows maybe after a few drinks it will not hurt as much.

  118. I really like this product; I like that it has 2 speeds, to ease you into things, and that it has a shaver head attachment which you can use to get your hair to the optimum epilating height (perfect for the first shave of the spring! ;-) ).<br /><br />BUT, don't expect it to be painless. Don't expect ANY epilator to be painless, and if it claims to be, it's lying. The thing pulls your hair out by its root, for goodness sake! It will hurt. So don't buy this if you're the kind who tears up while plucking your eyebrows. Epilators won't be for you. On the other hand, if you detest shaving every day, can't afford to have laser hair removal, and are frustrated by waxing or don't feel comfy having a stranger view your shaggy legs, then this may be for you. I trade the pain for the fact that I don't have to shave every day (I use it 2-3 times per month), cuz let's face it, I'm lazy, and I won't shave every day, and I also won't go through the summer in long pants. So, either show my devil-may-care fuzzy legs, or use an epilator. I chose the epilator (and my husband is thankful).<br /><br />I think this particular epilator is very nice. The light is a nice touch, although the blue cast it throws can allow some hairs to go unnoticed (I hate thinking I'm good and then going out in the sunlight to see a stripe of fuzz running up my leg), it is certainly more helpful in the task than not helpful, especially if you, like me, have to shave at night after the kids have gone to bed, when there's no natural sunlight to be had.<br /><br />So, if you think the pain is worth it (and really, it isn't that bad, especially if you follow the instructions and move the epilator s-l-o-w-l-y), then this is the one for you.
  119. My wife and I had another epilator that we liked over the last 4 years. When our current epilator began to show signs of failing I researched a new one and based on the reviews bought this one. Despite being $20 less than our last one this one is far superior. We can use on the bikini and lower abdomen area without the pain being unbearable. And yes depending on the area there will be more of less discomfort as you pull hair out of your skin. Though I haven't gone through childbirth I find it hard to believe having been there delivering babies that it can be a fraction of that discomfort despite one of the reviews. As a guy with minimal pain tolerance for injections and blood drawing according to my wife I don't find the discomfort all that bad and it is worth it for the smooth skin that lasts. My wife who typically shaves way more body parts than me and only used the epilator for certain body parts used it on her legs the other day and I can feel the difference several days later even using the less aggressive head. Buy this if you are hoping to get results similar to waxing without the mess or inconvenience. Great product and quick shipping.

  121. I love this epilator. I am glad some of the reviews had tips on how to use it and that the pain would decrease after a while. The tips were very helpful since the product didn't really have much.
  122. I got this product on Thursday and immediately plugged it in to try. I used it on my chin hairs, upper lip, and a spot test on my leg just above my ankle and OMG it was awesome!! So awesome in fact, that I had to show my mom. I used it on her chin and her day old shaved legs, she couldn't believe it either!!! Our chins, her legs, my spot test were so smooth. I couldn't really get into my upper lip because it hurt too much, but I have a plan for that which I'll explain at the end!<br /><br />I'm a regular waxer, which is why I only did a spot test on my legs. I decided not to skip my last regular wax because of Mark Twain's advice below. And I would recommend everyone follow it to a T!!!! It is better if you get use to the device on raw skin before using it on actual hair growth. If you are tolerant to pain then you can probably start as my mom did with day old shaved skin with slight stubble. But the rest of you, shave/wax/pluck for your final time and then use this product immediately after. You'll get use to the pulling of the machine without very much pain (because this thing WILL pick up what you missed and didn't even realize) and get the feel of how to glide it over your skin to get all the areas you need to reach.<br /><br />Now back to my story. My last wax appointment was on the following Saturday. My regular package consists of full legs, full bikini, underarms and ... my backside nether region. When I got home I set this thing to work. The light was amazing; I could immediately see all the blonde hairs my waxer missed!!! I glided over them and pulled them out. I cleaned the head a few times and let the hairs lay in the sink just to get an idea of how many were really missed, but even I wasn't prepared for the results. By the time I was done the sink looked like my brother had just shaved his 5 o'clock shadow and left me the mess to clean up. I couldn't believe it! I was able to reach every crevasse of the waxed portions of my body without a problem. The only time I had pain was when I attempted to epilate my not so well waxed female gouch area. I think the hairs that were there were just too long and well rooted since they've probably never been touched before in their existence. So when they were caught by the machine it pulled hard, hurt like a b**** and made me bleed. But I think that it will be better the next time, I'll give it time to heal and make sure I not neglect that area again.<br /><br />Now, about my upper lip, this is the most sensitive part of the body and I'm sure somewhere in the manual, that I didn't read, it says to not use this on your face. But, if you do, then here's some advice. Wax it before you use it for the first time and then practice up and down strokes, straight down from the nose to the lip to remove the hairs. If you go side to side it will hurt more because you are pulling the hairs out in an unnatural direction. I believe this was the main cause of my pain because I was trying to go straight across my lip, side to side, as is done when the wax is applied to the area. I was pulling real hairs (I had not waxed as I have recommended) and had not used to the machine prior to this.<br /><br />Also, I would recommend that if you have ingrown hair problems you get this product and use it every day, hair or no. I have ingrown hair problems and this is a really good exfoliator with the massaging rollers attached.<br /><br />I hope this helped someone. And if you still aren't convinced to buy this product let me put it in perspective: 700+ reviews and STILL 4+ stars!!! Come on! The ones that are 1 stars are either complaining about pain and were too early to read Mark Twain's advice or got a DOA product that you can RMA for a working one (I didn't read any 1 star articles, just Mark Twain and W. Tong. Then I saw 700+ reviews and still 4+ stars and said \\"what the heck\\"). This is well worth the money because (if you are a regular waxer) you will get back your money the first time you use it AND NEVER LOOK BACK!!!!

The skin has to be pulled tight for smooth hair removal. I cannot use it on the under arm, bikini or facial areas.   129. This is really an awsome epilator. I bought this to replace my Emjoi AP-9T Tweeze Tweezer. Comparing to the EMjoi tweezer which is mainly for removing facial hair, this is a epilator for the entire body. It works much more effectively and faster. Two power settings, I used the higher setting and here are the results. Underarm: slightly painful than the Emjoi tweezer -- make sense because it has 40 tweezer heads. The pain is very minimum to me, but keep in mind that I regularly used the Emjoi Tweezer for underarm. It took me about 2 minutes for each side. Facial: Remove even the tiny hair on my face. Bikini Area: The shaving head comes handy. I have not yet tried the tweezer I read a review complaining the epilator creating scars after use. I suspect it was because the epilator was not cleaned properly therefore the skin got infected. The epilator needs to be cleaned regularly since hairs are trapped at the head every time you use. If it is not cleaned properly, I could imagine germs and bacteria would grow. The tweezer/shaving head could be removed easily by pressing the side buttons for cleaning. Have fun!

  132. As an ethic woman, I have a lot of thick hair that grows FAST. I've tried depilatories and they burn. Waxing is expensive and it requires you to grow your hair pretty long (what's the point?). Shaving is easy, but it creates ingrown hair and itchy skin. This is the first time I ever tried epilating. If anyone has ever had their eyebrows threaded, it's pretty much the same thing.<br /><br />I know all these women that have \\"had 4 children\\" claim that this pain is unbearable, but come on! Obviously it's going to hurt a little...hair is being plucked out of your skin! Man up a little, it's not that bad. If it doesn't hurt, the hair is only being cut--which is also a good way to tell if you've missed any hairs. The only places it can be a bit difficult to use is your bikini area and armpits. I managed to deal with the armpit pain, but I'd stick to waxing the bikini area because all the hair is removed in one swoop rather than one at a time (making pain more bearable, and it's probably better for hair that thick).<br /><br />I have pretty sensitive skin so there was some rash/irritation the first few times. But it went away after 12-24 hours. Hair doesn't need to that long to tweeze...only about 2mm. Unfortunately I'm a bit impatient. I waited a few days after shaving to try it, so some hairs were too small. It pulled most of the hairs out, but the ones that were too short simply got cut. So if this product is \\"cutting\\" your hair, you're doing it wrong. Grow your hair a bit more and you shouldn't have any ingrown hairs. The spots that I got feel SO SMOOTH though! And as the hair grows back it's not the thick pokey stubble that you get from shaving. The hair that grew back is fairly soft, so it's not even that noticeable that it's there (which helps with the waiting period).<br /><br />Ideally, you only need to do this once or twice a month. It is definitely worth it if you can stand a bit of pain and are patient enough to grow the hair out to 2mm.

  141. I got tired of waxing my underarms so I thought I'd try this little machine. It works pretty well. At first it was intensely painful and I considered giving it up. At least with waxing it's all at once, right? If you use it every few days instead of waiting until your underarm hair can be braided, you can barely feel it! I did try it on my legs but I just don't have time for that. I don't have a problem shaving my legs, so no big deal. As for the people who say it ripped their skin out? Well, it certainly felt that way at first, but no skin actually came off. The cons: it's loud, you have to go over the same area several times to get all the hair and it just won't grab some of the finer hairs. Also, be sure to use it the night before you want lovely smooth underarms (or whatever else you use it on) - it's not something to use at the last minute. All in all, way better than waxing. No muss, no fuss.

  158. I've tried waxing, sugaring, and products that promised slow hair growth over the years to reduce and/or get rid of unwanted leg hair. I first got the $19.95 'touch up' epilator from Target to see if I could handle the epilator pain. Seeing as it wasn't too bad I decided to try this one and I absolutely love it. For minimum pain, first let your hair grow for a few days and then try this epilator with the roller attachment. It has a way of vibrating against your skin so you don't feel the hair removal as much. Then use the attachment that is bare on one side to get a closer shave. After, take an epsom salt bath to reduce the ingrown hair possibility. I used the epilator for a couple of days in a row, then waited a few days and did it again. Doing it a few times within a week was the way to get most of the hairs since they grow at different rates. I have to honestly say I haven't worked up to doing underarms yet- don't know if I could handle that pain.

  170. I bought this a couple of weeks before going on vacation to Hawaii in October and I didn't want to bother with having to shave. Because of this product, I threw out my razors and vow to never shave again!! My mom had one of those old school epliators when I was little and it was pure torture, but it worked. I figured I would try a newer model in the hopes that modern technology would come to my rescue. It did! Does it hurt? Of course, it's pulling your hair out at the root! Is it unbearable pain? Absoultely not, thanks to the attachments that come with it. There is a gaurd that you need to make sure you use. The guard has rollers on it which go over the skin first. The eplitor then pulls the hair out, but then another roller goes over the skin to sooth it! The first couple of strokes hurt, but the part of the body you are epilating gets used to it. I would give it 5 stars, but for some reason, it won't get some of the finest hairs on the back of my leg, no matter which direction I go. I also do my armpits, which hurt like no other the first time, but not so much the second. It doesn't get all of the hair with that either, only the courser ones. It may just be the weird angle though! The only other comment that I have is to watch if you are in an area where you have any type of stretch marks. The first time I was doing my arm pits, it chewed up the outer skin on my arm in the crease. It grabbed the skin like it would the hair. I also have some raised stretch marks on my inner thigh, what girl doesn't!! It also got it a little bit there. I haven't had problems since, but I have to be extremely careful in these areas.

  172. I purchased the Silk epilator at the beginning of the summer after reading the rave reviews. It was definitely painful the first time, and I was shocked by the mess and quantity of all the little hairs it pulled out! I figured out that it was best to either sit on a towel or stand in the shower (water off, of course!!!) I guess with shaving I never noticed how much hair was coming off. It is noisy, my husband had to turn up the TV when I tried it in the living room... And it takes a while, um, ages. The light is really helpful in seeing all the hairs, but for me it took multiple passes to get them. Afterwards my legs were red and patchy, so I'd usually use the epilator at night. I really wanted to like this product and use it forever... But unfortunately it's just not compatible with my skin/hair type: sensitive skin and thick, dark hair. After hair removal I used Price Reigns ingrown hair serum, exfoliated with a loofah, everything people had recommended. However, I still got ingrown hairs. Over time, they got worse and worse, and I just kept getting more and more. I loved not having to shave every other day, but I think the turning point came when my husband asked me why my legs were so spotty. After trying it for about 6 months, I have stopped using the epilator and my legs are 'going into remission...' I actually purchased the Conair Hair Removal system (which is supposed to exfoliate away hairs.) Not sure about the hair removal aspect of that product, but it exfoliates well and will help me get all the ingrown hairs out. Sadly, it's back to shaving for me. If the epilator works with your skin/hair type, this would be a great product. But for me, and I'd guess anyone else with sensitive skin and thick hair...good luck trying. It's probably been 2 months now since I stopped using the epilator, my legs are looking better but I still have some deep ingrown hairs, I don't know how they'll ever come out.
