It is so disturbing to see it happening.<br /><br />I am NOT a sensitive person and my hairs are not extremely thick so WE (my dermatologists and I) can't figure out what went wrong. I have been to several different doctors who all agreed that they will NEVER let their patients use an epilator ...EVER. They were impressed that it was SO difficult to battle this bout of MAJOR ingrown hairs. They tried everything and finally my team of doctors told me that at this point with all of the scarring and suffering the ONLY solution is Laser hair removal. My once beautiful legs are so scarred from such HORRIBLE ingrown hairs from using the epilator that I am ashamed to wear shorts or cute short dresses anymore :( ...<br /><br />PLEASE PLEASE think twice before putting yourself through this.   176. I used to shave, but my hair grows back very quickly. I briefly had a go at waxing.....but that was awful. Especially armpit hair, as it tends to have different growth directions.<br /><br />After looking at all the other reviews, I decided on this, and I am very happy with my purchase.<br /><br />The nice thing about the epilator is that you are free to turn it in the appropriate direction to catch hair growing this way or that---compare to waxing, where you will only get the hair that is going one way. It is also quick......well...as quick as you can stand. I've been using it for a while, and it's still a bit painful to do, especially for the armpits (depending on the thickness of the hair).<br /><br />There *IS* an attachment that has small rollers on it so that it helps lessen the intensity of the experience, and it does help to some extent. It also has a \\"close\\" attachment that speeds through the process but then is more painful. Additionally, there is one for trimming the southern foliage, along with the product having a slow and fast speed. It all comes in a nice silver carrying case, which is nice.<br /><br />Just keep in mind that, for epilation, the hairs tend to get thinner and smaller, so you need to exfoliate regularly to help let the hairs grow out. What I end up doing is throwing in shaving now and again so that it encourages the hair to grow out again. This will often cause the hair to thicken again, but I'd rather see the hairs grow out than get them all stuck in lil ingrown skin bumps.<br /><br />I've had this product for a few years now, and it's still doing great, so I decided to come back and rate it so others can know that it's a product worth investing in.

  183. First, I am a man, with medium-coarse (by mens standards) body hair, on about half of the surface of my body (not on my back). I got this because of the previous reviews. It is significantly louder, but it plucks the hairs with fewer passes. I've only had it a short time, and I do have a concern that the attachments feel a bit flimsy, but I've had no problems with them. Maybe it is the time of year (cold and dry), but I notice that dead skin comes off more abundantly with this, compared to the Emjoi, which I think is good. I've also had fewer ingrown hairs. The one drawback I have with the light is that it shows me the hairs that are too fine and short to be removed by this epilator. But believe me, my legs, arms, chest, shoulders, armpits, and unmentionables look very smooth, and they feel very good and healthy. I would recommend this to any other man or woman.

Then purchased this one and have to say overall pretty satisfied. The only downside I found was the noise level, it is a bit loud, but my last one was as well. So I think that is pretty common because of the motors they use, so it gets 4 stars, would give a 5 if they ever make a model that makes less noise.
  202. This is really an amazing product. To be honest I didn't buy this because I hated shaving, but I stumbled upon this product when looking for other things in Amazon.com and saw the reviews and thought why not give it a try. I am so glad that I purchased this. I have waxed only once in my entire life, and never did it again because of the pain. I have always shaved - as a result, hair especially under arms grow very fast. And they are thick too and the shaving doesn't even last for 2 days. I already felt the hair the next day. I tried this product as soon as I received it. Honestly it hurts - but really worth it. I tried doing it the way many suggested - down-to-up in a single stroke, but found it really hurts a lot. I tried down-to-up (opposite the hair growth) and in little short movements like 1cm at a time, and then I ran over it again and covered a little more hairy area (1cm again). This really is time consuming (took 2 hours for me for full legs, hands and underarms), but the pain is very bearable even for first timers. Got red bumps, but went away in 5 minutes. I showered after and hot water hurts, so I used luke-warm. Applied lotion and I'd never felt my skin like that in like forever. I discovered another thing - thicker the hair, more pain. It did hurt a little more at underarms, but I did from outer to inside just like 1cm at a time, so I could recover from the stinging sensation. But by the end of my session I got adjusted to the pain and it seemed normal. I absolutely love this, it's like an investment. I've seen some people say that the cord is short, but it's 7.5 feet, longer than many hair dryers, I think it's the perfect length.
  203. I bought this epilator after reading the reviews. Never had one before and I like it. It is paifull first 2-3 times and after that's fine.
  204. I thought the light was a stupid gimmick but it's actually really useful because no matter what lighting you're in, you clearly see the hair.. the machine works well and the different heads that come with it are useful also.. definitely worth the money. Shipping (I got the slowest/free shipping) was also faster than advertised!! :-)
  205. The Braun 5260 Silk-epil is a great product. The first series of uses are uncomfortable and can be painful but over time less hair grows and the discomfort is slight. You have to allow yourself lots of time in the beginning because it is pretty time consuming. I've used it for a month already and its great to go a week without shaving. Tried it on my underarms but it was too painful to keep up. I highly recommend this product for anyone who has sensitive skin and experiences irritation from waxing. However, if you have low-pain tolerance this product may not be for you.

  210. After one of my children brushed up against my leg and screamed in pain, \\"Ouchy mommy your legs feel like the cactus in the front yard!\\"I felt i had to change up the shaving routine that is time consuming and ineffective. Going to get waxed was out of my budget so the search for alternatives was on. Sugaring was next on my list because it could be made at home cheaply and it looked easy. At 11 pm with smoke filling my house and a fire burning on the stove, sugaring was looking less viable. The next day I was off to my local beauty supply store to buy wax, well lets just say waxing is better left to the professionals! At the point of giving up, I discovered epilators and decided to purchase one. I bought a $40 Emoji and let it rip! Holly hell the pain was unbearable, it missed most of the hairs and I had to make several painful passes to get most of the hairs, but it still missed some and refused to grab my finer blond hairs on my thighs. So I packed that puppy up and took it back to the store pronto! After doing quite a bit of research online I decided to give an epilator one more try because of the great reviews I had heard about the Braun. It was the choice I should have made in the the first place! It quickly and almost painlessly picked up all the hairs that my failed waxing session and the Emoji missed. I got all those baby fine hairs on my thighs. Perfection! Don't waste your time with other models, home waxing, or sugaring, this epilator is what you need! You'll be glad you bought it and it will pay for its self in the long run and no waiting for your hair to grow out for waxing. LOVE IT!!!!!!!! Now what are you waiting for? Buy it!
  211. This was pretty good when I got it. It didn't hurt nearly as much as I thought it would (at least, on the calves) but that may be because I'm younger. The attachments started popping off so I just stopped using them. It's also gotten really dirty after a year and I don't know how to clean it. Even cotton swabs can't fit under the spinner. Also, I know a bonus of epilating is that your hairs will start to grow in lighter and thinner. Well, it took a few months before I noticed this and I have to say, they aren't so much getting lighter, but definitely thinner! It can't pluck the thinner ones! This means that, you have to keep razors on hand. Not that you shouldn't even if your hairs aren't getting thinner, because it hurts like *hell* on the underarms/thighs. Also, many hairs won't peak through the skin but will cause your legs to feel bumpy, a razor can fix that as well or if you have like a loofah I think that'd work.

I took peoples advice and took a hot shower, took 2 tylenol and it did take a long time. More than 2 hours! But, I'm sure that was just because it was the first time and I was getting used to it and going over spots many times to make sure I got it all. I have pretty course hair. My legs came out pretty smooth and I'm stubble-free this morning so that's a great sign! I used the beginner blade at first but found that it did not get enough hair so go over with the beginner blade and then go over with the experienced one and it'll hurt less and get more hair. Also, I did experience a lot of redness and irratation (little bumps) but that went away over night, I just put some lotion on it right after I was done. I will def. continue using this...it's a great product!! Hope this review was helpful...if it's too painful, go slow and don't give up. It's really not that bad!! Good luck!

  232. Yes, there is minimal pain in hair removal, with this method. The preceding hot bath to open the follicles, helps. If you do it every 3 days, you will have pretty bare legs. I wouldn't personally use this for the bikini area, as that is a sensitive spot, and can probably do very bad things down there! And it is very harsh for the face, as well. Underarms? I can go either way, but my underarms are too sensitive for it as well, and tend to have a lot of ingrown hairs after. I've been using this epilator over a year now, and I'm pretty satisfied as I am fairly hairless for a good two or three days. Even the handful of hairs that I do those two or three days later, aren't that noticeable, but I'm a perfectionist like that, haha. Still, this is better than shaving, which my hair grows basically the very same evening--that stubble is NOT cute! The light on the top of it, really really helps you get the hair that you missed! I haven't seen that on too many other epilators, but it is such a big plus, since I run over my legs while I'm multitasking (watching TV or something), glance down and the light shows me the hairs that I missed in those areas. Yaaay! It's very cost-efficient. No need to buy shaving creams, disposable razors, waxing expenses, etc. BUT it does roughen up your skin a bit. A few ingrown hairs here and there, but with any kind of epilating, that's expected. ALSO, it is SO important for you to pull the skin taut, in any area you are epilating. If not, your skin WILL catch in the razors, and possibly bleed. Maybe the super bad reviews, people might've missed that tip. I haven't found that this is permanent hair removal method, but like I said, still the most efficient way. I hope this review has helped you. These reviews helped me when I made my purchase, so I got all the great tips as well =)

  240. I love my epilator (bought in 8/08). This was my first one and I bought this one on a recommendation from another mom. I HATED shaving and that every time I would within 12 hours I would be all prickly again. So someone suggested the Bruan Silk-epil for all its perks. Pros: The light is the best thing! It helps me find the hair and even the ones that are ingrown so I can get them out first. Even with the 3 lights on in my LR, I can't get enough light to match what the light gives me. The multiple heads. There is the roller one for the newbies. It does help with the lessening the pain in the beginning (especially if you pull the skin taut). But after the first few uses (6 or so) I graduated to the other one. I still use it for underarms & bikini. The \\"scraping\\" one I use now to help pick up the hair so it can be pulled. I only have to do it once a week (when I get around to it). Pain. IT DOES GET BETTER!!! It does hurt if you don't use it correctly. But I found with the roller head and the lower setting, it helps. I never waxed my legs but did pull my hair out with tweezers. It does sting a bit (like getting the eyebrows waxed) but gets better over time. The more you use it, the less it hurts. The back of the legs around the knees and upper thigh do hurt the worst. But not as much as it did before. Also I burned my legs when I was younger and still have some residual scarring that gives me a bit more pain. Shaving? I don't shave anymore. I can't stand what happens after I shave and it makes the hair coarser for the next time I do epilate. I stopped doing it for awhile on the underarms & bikini but I think I am going to get back into it. Just make sure you pull the skin taut! Cons: Noise. It is a bit noisy but as I have nothing to compare it to, I am not sure how it compares to others. I just use it at night when everyone is asleep. Over-heat? I do feel that if I use it too long (been awhile for me using it) that it gets hot. So I found that if I watch TV & turn it off during the commercials, it cools down enough so that it will last through the entire session. Must dos! -Put a towel under you. It is the best way to catch the hair -Switch legs if the pain gets too much -Do it over several days if need be so that there isn't too much pain all at once -About 4-5 days after finishing the legs, use a scrubbie on your legs depending on when new hair starts to grow back). It helps to stop the ingrown hairs. -Distract yourself with something; TV, movie, music. It will make the pain lessen as you mind is focused on the TV than on the pain. I did buy this in the summer of 2008 (2 years ago) but I have not used it on a regular basis (every 1-2 weeks). So I cannot tell you how long it lasts. I am hoping I can get at least one more year out of it. Even if I used it every 2 weeks for 1 year, it still pays for itself with the cost of razors nowadays.

  248. I absolutely love my Epilator. I was a little nervous when I first started researching them, but I would never go back to shaving my legs!<br /><br />The epilator is a series of tweezers that rotate, pulling each hair out by the root. Yes, it hurts. But it's not an unbearable hurt. It's more uncomfortable than anything else, but the results are well worth it!<br /><br />The first time I tackled my legs with the epilator, it took me 45min to an hour, and I thought I'd never do it again! You have to get used to it, and accept that you have to go SLOWLY! If you go too fast, you're just ripping the surface of the hair off, and the hairs grow back faster. If you're patient, it's weeks before you have to do it again! And the hairs grow back smaller and 'sparse-er!'<br /><br />There's also a clipper attachment which is fabulous for trimming in other areas.<br /><br />I know people who use the epilator for all body hair, but I find on my underarms it's so unbearably painful it's not worth it! I use it on my legs and love it!<br /><br />There is also a little light that comes on when you turn it on, which can be helpful to be sure you don't miss any rogue hairs.<br /><br />I highly suggest doing this after a hot shower, or use Icy Hot before starting, it helps with the ouch factor.<br />Also, put down a towel or plan to vacuum when you're done, as all those little hairs will be on the floor when you're done. :/
  249. Less painful and Better than waxing ur legs and arms,leaves the skin so smooth for days.i couldnt even feel anything while epilating my legs and arms ,but epilating my armpits was painful might be bcoz the skin is loose in there,so cannot use in the bikini area,but this is the best solution for the hair in legs and arm ,its quick it took only 30 min for legs and arm.
  250. I was initially confused on which model to buy - one with trimmer option or one without. I finally went for the former. The trimmer is very smooth and esp good for overgrown hairs but can be done without if you epilate regularly. This product is an excellent purchase for those who don't wish to spend bucks, getting rid of unwanted hair. It takes out even smallest of hair and actually leaves your skin smooth and silky - true to its name. Regrowth is definitely less as compared to other hair removal methods like veet cream. You have to have patience, as this does take long time - say around 45 minutes to cleanly epilate your full legs and arms. The light feature is particularly good. You can see clearly, even smallest if your hair. And, it's very painful on sensitive areas. You will get used to it with usage. As a one time investment product, it perform its job well.
  251. This product works better than other epilators that I tried because it actually pulls out all the hairs instead of missing some of them. I've had other epilators that worked the first time only and then never seemed to work as well after that time to get everything, this one actually works every time. Warning - be very careful. If you aren't paying enough attention it may catch parts of your skin just below the hair and leave you with an area of red spots which will take a few days to go away, this happened to me on my underarm and back of leg, and because you are already expecting pain from just the hair pulling it may take you a few seconds to realize what is going on. I'd probably only use this on my legs and not on my underarms though - due to this problem. I use a different one on my underarms and it works great there but doesn't do anything for my legs (the Emjoi Epi slim). Other than that, in general I seem to have to use epilators at least weekly still - I never get the 4-6 week results that they claim you can get. But it still beats having to shave.
  252. I've been a semi-regular waxer for years, but it just takes so much time! Plus, you have to wait for the hair to grow out before you can wax again. As a mixed Asian-American, my hair/skin type is dark hair/fair skin. Sadly, I'm like the fuzziest Asian I can think of, inheriting dark hair that gets THICK and icky when I shave. I've tried just about everything to manage the hair and regrowth, but even when I was a teenager, I would have to shave just about everyday if I wanted to be smooth in the summer. But, once in the habit of shaving, the hair got thicker, and is visible under the skin as it's growing back! I actually bought an epilator in the early 90's, but it was a nightmare. The pain was SO bad, and the skin irritation afterwards was awful. I learned how to wax on my own, but still the regrowth time for me is only about 2 weeks, if I'm lucky. I purchased this epilator in hopes that the technology's improved - and I'm delighted to say, YES IT HAS!!! I waxed when I made my order online, and just got the epilator today. Since a few hairs had already started to come back in, I decided to try it out, and I was totally *amazed*! No pinching like the old model, and at worst (on sensitive areas) it's has a pins&needles sensation. Again, I understand hair/skin/pain tolerance is different, but if you're used to waxing - this is the answer!!! Hope this review helps and gives others with hair-struggles like mine hope!

  255. I bought this after reviewing many other similar products. I have used it a lot but it's not that easy to actually get rid of all the hair. It probably gets 80% of the hair and only lasts a few days or so before you have to do it again. Not to mention, any epilator is very painful the first time. I thought I wasn't going to be able to get through it!! I will still use it but I expected it to do a better job.
  256. This was a good purchase. Like all epilators this leads to ingrown hairs, so you have to be willing to exfoliate and moisturize regularly. As for this particular epilator, I disagree with a lot of the reviewers-- so long as you are in a well lit room, the built-in light is useful in illuminating the hairs. The reason I gave this 4 stars instead of 5 is that it does take several go-overs before all the hair is gone. As you use it more the hair tends to break off if you go too quickly, so I've had to go over and over the same spots really slowly to make sure all the hairs actually got tweezed. I have tried other brands and I'd say the $50 I spent on this was a get what you paid for deal.

Guess I shouldn't have done that. But anyways, I would recommend this product. I love it!

  260. After my old epilator died, I bought this one based on reviews and brand respect. I don't mind pain with epilation, I expect it, but this one is far worse than necessary. The ingrown hairs were appalling and constant: with dark hair, I always had these terrible looking hairs growing under my skin. I was so dissatisfied that I started researching other epilators and was directed to the Emjoi Optimax as a brand that caused less ingrowns. Wow! What a difference - I had let my legs recover from this Braun, loofahed until they were sore, then tried the Emjoi. I could barely feel it, and couldn't believe it was actually removing the hairs from the roots. Where the Braun was constantly snagging my underarm skin, the Optimax leaves it perfectly smooth. The only good thing I can say about this item is that the light is helpful, but it isn't enough to make me want to suffer through a Braun ever again. I honestly feel that the pain is so shocking that it causes the follicle to snap back and result in an ingrown hair when it grows back. Don't buy this one, go for the Emjoi and toss out your loofah ~
  261. The caveat is that I am a mother of 3 and a fan of waxing. It is nearly impossible for me to get to the salon for regular waxing, both in terms of time and money. I thought, even if I use this product twice, it will cost less than a trip to the spa, and I can do one leg part at a time, as I have time. Little did I know that I would fall in love with my Epilator. After using the trimming attachment -- which is great in and of itself (my husband could use it to trim his sideburns) -- I started with the massaging head and the lower setting. It was a little loud at first, but, it did such a great job that it was not long before I was hunting down hairs and did not notice the sound. By my second session, I was already using the regular head and the faster setting. Soon, I was even brave enough to use it on my underarm hair. You will be amazed at the amount of hair you have. It gets the hairs you see, as well as many that you don't. You do have to stop it regularly to shake out the hairs, but no more than you would if you were waxing and had to change strips of cloth. Also, because the hair comes out at the root, the little follicle can make the hair stick to the side of the head, but the brush is great for that. I have found that it's best to put a small trash can on the counter and shake or brush the hairs out into there. This helps to prevent a clog in the future (yes, it's that much hair), or hairs clinging to the sink or toilet bowl. A non-advertised feature is that it also exfoliates as it works. I am very pleased with the X'elle Epilator, and glad that I went for the \\"higher end\\" product. While I can't say I can't live without it, I will say, I'd certainly rather not.
  262. I have been using the Braun Silk-epil for about 9 months now...and it does work as it states...but after using it I realized I would like to find another way of removing my leg/bikini area hair because while it works well at removing the hair, and does so consistently, I would rather have a hair removal method that doesn't leave ingrown hair and red bumps (from the new hair growth). The ingrown hairs are a nightmare for me and leave my thighs looking unsightly, where I don't even wear shorts above the knee anymore.<br /><br />Because hair growth is in stages, it is almost impossible to remove all of the hair on a leg, let's say, and have it all come back at the same time to remove it again. It's like you have to use it every few days to remove the hair from your leg to keep it smooth. I even stopped using this on my calves because it was easier and quicker for me to shave vs. the time spent to use this machine for the 2 +/- weeks of smooth skin I did get.<br /><br />I am looking into more permanent methods of hair removal.
  263. Ok. I read hundreds of epilator reviews before I purchased this Braun, so I knew that epilating is painful at first. I have been plucking all areas of my body for years now, so I thought there might be a little bit of exaggerating going on. Let me just say, this was one of the most painful experiences I have had. It lasted beyond the first use too. I finally noticed this morning, on my fourth use, that it was getting noticeably easier. All previous uses left me with red bumps and splotches that lasted well over 24 hours. The bumps would still be there the next day when I would go to epilate again. Maybe because I have very coarse hair and very sensitive skin. Yesterday, after the third use, I was really wondering if I was going to be able to continue (shaking, sweating, fight or flight response). Today I am ecstatic that it was much easier and I am very pleased with the results. The only problem I have had is around my kneecaps. I haven't figured out a position to get all of those hairs (leg straight, leg bent, etc.). Obviously, this is my first epilator so I have no basis for comparison, but so far I am very pleased with the quality and performance. You just have to be very determined, which I am. I am already seeing an end to shaving every day. It will only get better from here!

  269. First of all, your hair should be long enough before you even attempt to use this...but even if your hair is the optimal length, I would say that this epilator will successfully pull out from the roots, at most, 60% of your hair. The rest it just cuts, similar to shaving, so regrowth time is comparable with shaving. Another down side is the amount of ingrown hairs it gives me. I have tried waxing before with lasting results but because of my skin and leg hair type, I've always had problems with ingrowns. I don't know what I was thinking when I bought this with the belief that my ingrown hair problem would vanish magically. After all, the concept of pulling out hair from the root was the same with both. All in all, it had the same problems of shaving and waxing (fast regrowth and ingrowns respectively), but to a slightly lesser degree. It takes longer than shaving but is quicker than at home waxing. For me, this is just an OK product. Expect no miracles.
  270. I have an older version of Remington and this one has a lot more tweezers and it's faster. Plus it has more heads that can be used for massaging the skin while it shaves from the root. It hurts less than the other one I had. And I think it's because it's faster.
  271. This was my very first epilator. My sister-in-law suggested it as an alternative to waxing and shaving. I chose this one because it seemed less expensive than other models and had fairly positive reviews. I found there to be nearly no pain with this epilator especially when you use the massaging head but how much pain you feel will depend on your own pain tolerance and where you are using it. My husband attempted to use this on a small patch of hair on his upper arms and found the process to be pure agony. The item instructions do state that it can be used on your bikini area. I highly advise against it. I tried it and I had very poor results. I found it easy to clean and use. I use it on both legs and both my lower arms. The very first time I used it I thought to myself, \\"Where has this thing been all my life?!?!\\" My skin was left silky and buttery smooth. The gloss of the first use wore off quickly. Most of the hair on my lower arms and thighs is the \\"peach fuzz\\" sort of hair that is not really visible to the eye but can still be felt. This product does not do well with this sort of hair. Yes, it grabs the small fine hairs but it doesn't rip them out, it snaps them close to the skin. With the peach fuzz hair you don't get the stubble feeling when it grows back but it doesn't stay silky smooth for weeks the way the product claims. Unfortunately, I am also having this snapping problem on my lower legs where the hair is more coarse and it is creating a stubble feel in some areas. I've minimized this problem by going very slow and being very careful to maintain the 90 degree angle recommended in the instructions. The drawback with that is that it takes a very long time. Whether or not I'd have this problem with a different epilator, I don't know. It may just be the way my hair is but I have not had breakage problems with traditional waxing. This breakage did happen even with the first usage when the hairs were the ideal 2-5mm length stated in the instruction manual. Another problem I have is that even with going very slowly, this product still misses hairs here and there. Overall I think this product is just okay. I'd say that the amount of time I spend with the epilator is probably a little less than how much time I was spending shaving. I'm also using it on areas I wouldn't normally shave (like my forearms). The bonus is that I'm at no risk of accidentally cutting myself and my husband doesn't complain about me using his razors. I still have the product. I still use it but when it gives out I will probably purchase a different model from a different company and maybe spend a little more money.

  278. My daughter wanted one of these and then after she had hers a week and liked it, I decided to get one of my own. Using this for the first time hurts, there is no getting around it. When you have a leg full of hair, there is a lot to pull out. Just do what you can each day until you become accustomed to it. Then once you have all the hair removed on your legs, you will find that a touch up every few days is probably enough. Since hair growth is constant and at differing rates, this won't produce a perfectly smooth result, but if you need it, then shave afterwards if you're fussy about that. The hairs need to grow to a certain length for the tweezers to grab them. Also, this gets my major, coarse hairs, but not the tiny, baby fine hairs. YMMV.<br /><br />If you desire ultra-smooth legs for a special occasion, then you can epilate that day and then afterwards, shave. For me, I like this product, since I hate messing around with the shaving process every day. There is less stubble using the epilator. If you feel tiny bumps after epilating, that is where the hair was pulled out of the pore and it's a little irritated and raised, but that will go down.<br /><br />I now also epilate my underarms, being very careful and holding them taut. Using the bathroom mirror helps ensure I catch all the hairs. What's nice about this, is that those black hair roots under the armpits don't shows since they are pulled out entirely. The first few times you do this will be challenging, but after a while you'll realize it's a little pain for a lot of gain.<br /><br />Make sure you skin is clean and dry first. Keep the epilator away from any loose clothing, threads, long hair or your socks. You can also use a natural loofah and gently exfoliate so you don't get ingrowns. Do *not* apply lotion, since lotion will just make the hairs slippery and harder to grab. Technique tips: hair grows in various directions, so you will need to move the epilator up, and diagonally to get the best results. Choose your speed of preference, there is high and low - either works well. The light on it really helps see the hairs. If you have a private area with daylight, then that's helpful.<br /><br />Cleaning is important: with with brush included, or a separate, clean toothbrush (method I prefer). Unplug the unit first. Then remove the epilating head and brush clean. If you brush it well, it will remove dead skin debris and hair which clogs up the tiny tweezers. If you feel your epilator is not performing up to speed, it is probably because the little tweezers are clogged with skin cells and hair! Brush cleaning also lessens your epilating time and frustration, and prevents you having to go over & over the same areas since it picks up more hair, faster. I actually thought I needed a new epilator, but proceeded to do a thorough cleaning and it epilates wonderfully again.<br /><br />Overall, this is much handier than shaving. I will always continue to epilate since I've had great results.<br />UPDATE: May 2012 and still happy with it.s. Choose your speed of preference, there is high and low - either works well. The light on it really helps see the hairs. If you have a private area with daylight, then that's helpful.<br /><br />Cleaning is important: with with brush included, or a separate, clean toothbrush (method I prefer). Unplug the unit first. Then remove the epilating head and brush clean. If you brush it well, it will remove dead skin debris and hair which clogs up the tiny tweezers. If you feel your epilator is not performing up to speed, it is probably because the little tweezers are clogged with skin cells and hair! Brush cleaning also lessens your epilating time and frustration, and prevents you having to go over & over the same areas since it picks up more hair, faster. I actually thought I needed a new epilator, but proceeded to do a thorough cleaning and it epilates wonderfully again.<br /><br />Overall, this is much handier than shaving. I will always continue to epilate since I've had great results.<br />UPDATE: May 2012 and still happy with it.

  280. I bought this epilator in preparation for my wedding--for which I have found myself doing all kinds of things I never bothered to do before. In terms of hair removal specifically, throughout my life I have tried shaving, plucking individual hairs (SOOO time-consuming), and waxing. This is the first time I've ever used an epilator, and I have to say, all things considered, I'm extremely pleased. Being blonde, I have relatively light body hair, but I still find it quite irritating--especially in light of the fact that I will be spending the majority of the honeymoon in a bikini, and the idea of running back to the room to shave is not one that pleases me. Probably the thing that most concerns people about the idea of an epilator is the potential for pain: I mean, what seems like a billion hairs at once will be simultaneously ripped out of your skin by the roots. Ouch. Considering, though, that that's what happens with waxing anyway, I would say it feels about the same. Actually, on the legs, I would say it hurt less. I did take advice I read beforehand, though, and used it on legs I waxed relatively recently--so the volume of hairs there was relatively low. Even so, I would liken it to the feeling you get when an electric shaver accidentally grazes your skin. I did NOT use the provided cooling glove. On the UNDERARMS, however, I experienced the greatest, most cripplingly unholy pain I have ever experienced in my life. The only thing that I can think of that even comes close is getting pierced--with a needle, not that stupid gun at the mall. It's that same stomach-dropping, light-headed, don't-forget-to-breathe-or-you-might-faint all-consuming-death pain. (Incidentally, I am a big baby with things like this--I just do them anyway.) Seriously, I had to keep checking to make sure it was just the hair--not tattered pieces of flesh--being ripped off. (For those of you wondering, no, I have never given birth, so that may very well be worse--but I DID find myselfneeding to employ everything I have ever seen on TV about breathing through the pain.) Because of this, I skipped the \\"beginner\\" head (which hurt just as much but accomplished far less in the same time), and went straight to full power with the advanced head to get it all over with ASAP. BUT, now my underarms are delightfully hair-free! SO, in conclusion, I definitely recommend this product for anyone looking to win the war on annoying body hair. IT REALLY WORKS, removing hairs I could barely even see, and the little light is awesome. I would also recommend that, if you are worried about the pain, you take some VERY deep breaths and begin with the underarms...because next to that, legs, and yes, even bikini area, seem downright pleasant. :) Good luck!
  281. I purchased this item recently. I had not tried epilation previously to this purchase, and I'd only been to the salon for waxing once. I shave irregularly so I wanted to give epilation a try. I've never found tweezing hairs to be particularly painful, so I expected minimal pain from epilation. On the advice of a friend, I shaved prior to the first epilation and made sure my skin was warm and dry. It wasn't painful at all except a few place under the arm and of course the bikini area.   289. I have very pale, sensitive skin with thick black body hair. My skin is so translucent, you can see the black hair under it even when I'm clean shaven. My skin is also sensitive, so waxing left my legs bruised and swollen. I had about given up on wearing shorts or short sleeves, let alone bathing suits. I had never even heard of an epilator until I found it on Amazon. This one had great reviews, so I ordered it. I am so happy I did. Yes, it hurts the first time. I've just been doing small areas at a time. I've completed my arms, my legs below the knee, and I'm starting on my thighs today. I've gone over my arms multiple times now, and the pain has turned into slight discomfort, nothing unmanageable. Plus, the discomfort goes away in minutes. I love being able to feel comfortable in my pale skin, as it has never looked so good! Also, I expected to be dealing with ingrown hairs and some bruising, but I have yet to experience either with this. If you live in a cold place like I do, I recommend ordering this product before the warm weather starts. That way, you can take it slow and adjust your skin while you can still cover up. The popular review that recommends the tips and tricks for better epilation is spot on. Take her advice and this product will work beautifully for you, too. I'm off to browse cute bathing suits :)
  290. I love this product, I use it once a week on my legs and wait for it . . . my armpits. The thing is that you do really have to be able to deal with some PAIN. This is a product that litterally pulls out the hair, don't be decived, that's what it does and that's what it feels like. Using it on your legs gets to be pretty natural though, dosen't hurt so bad after a few uses you kinda get over it. But on the armpits it kills everytime. But it does leave your skin feeling soft and hair free, no stubble, so for me it's worth it.<br /><br />As far as cost, I would buy it again in a second. It's worth every penny.
  291. Does a pretty good job... Tried it on my legs and did a fantastic job! Couldnt get it to work on my face due to large head... underarms were too painful... Will stick to my hands and legs with this...

  299. I bought this about 2 months ago. I love this device and I wish I knew about it sooner. This would have saved me so much time and grief over the years. I am a light skinned woman with very coarse dark body hair so if this product can work for me, it can work for anyone. Like others said, it is very painful for the first time on an area but the pain decreases the more you use it. I followed the directions and took a long bath and shaved the day before so that the hair was not too long. The key to using it on an area for the first time is to do small sections of an area or the whole area everyday for a week so that you pick up missed hairs, new growth, and the areas that have not been epilated as yet. This helps to build your pain tolerance and results in less and less stubble everyday until eventually you are smooth. I tried it on my legs, under my chin and my underarms. The underarms were extremely painful but I did small sections everyday with the beginner's head until I got the whole area and now I am able to epilate using the advanced head with a very slight discomfort. I am trying to work my way to doing the bikini area. The hardest part is getting past the pain. I think the key to success with this product is patience. You are not going to have perfectly smooth skin the first time you use it and I think that's why some people were disappointed and gave it a poor review. But after a few uses, you will see a big difference. Think of it as retraining your hair. Hope my review helped.
  300. The light is definitely the best feature, and I love that it comes with a razor head too for when I'm running late and need a quick touch up. Also it's great for the bikini line. The cord is a good length so it doesn't really bother me that it's not cordless - though I hope they do make a new cordless model because that would be more convenient for travel.
  301. I just started using this product and love it. I found that it is not as painful as I anticipated and after using for short durations for 3 days in a row, my legs are very smooth. I am excited about not having to shave daily as I have coarse dark hair which grows quickly and shaving daily was a must. I did NOT shave for 3 days prior to using the product so that hair was longer and more easily removed. The light feature is also very helpful. This will greatly reduce my shower time in the mornings and especially will be helpful when traveling as will not have to carry supplies. I did use it around the bikini line but not underarm at this time. DMC in South Carolina

The only reason I didn't give this product 5 stars is because it does hurt a little (and a lot in some locations) the first few times you use it.

After using it hair doesn't grow back for 3 weeks on my legs and arms. I also use it for facial hair once a week. I think because my facial hair is thinner and obviously smaller, it doesn't pick up on all the hairs at once requiring more frequent use. Yes there is still some pain, but not as bad anymore. I do use a topical numbing cream for my thighs though, just can't seem to get use to that yet. On days I am in a rush I have used the trimmer/shaver part and was really impressed with how close a shave it gave me. Like I said before I do have thick hair so typical shavers have always left me with stubble; no stubble, felt just like shaving with a razor, with none of the razor burn.   310. I read so many good reviews on this product that I decided to try it. The first time I used it I could only do half a leg with the started head attachment and on low speed; My God, it Hurt!!! The next day I tried the rest of that one leg and the other one (sounds like I am an octopus) and it wasn't as bad as the first day. By the time I finished I was using the more advance head attachment. So, yes, it hurts at first but once you get a hang of it, is not that bad. The hairs do not grow back as quick as they do when you shave and they come back thinner. Those of us who shave (or used to) know that once the hairs start growing back, they all come out at once and even all around, well with this epilator they do not. You will not get a leg full of hairs in 2 days, but a few hairs here and there in about 5 days or so. Overall, I am very pleased with this product!
  311. I have very dark hair and pale skin, so even when I shaved my legs, I'd be left with black stubble you could see through my skin. It was horrible! I've tried a million different things to try and get rid of my hair, and have been saving up for laser treatments. In the meantime though, the Braun epilator has been a god-send. It pulls up my hair, including the black \\"roots\\" that get left behind when I shave, so that my legs look and feel smooth for at least a week (often more!). Moreover, I've noticed that my hair has been growing back thinner after I've started to use the epilator (though I still have lots of it). The machine itself is simple to use. I don't use it anywhere other than my legs though. I tried it ONCE on my under arms, and it pinched my skin and was incredibly painful. So, I never repeated that again. The only negative, as far as my legs, has been the ingrown hairs. As others have notes, this does happen. I have to exfoliate my legs really, really well after using the epilator, particularly around day 3 or I'll get massive red bumps and a leg full of ingrown hairs. And, even if I keep up with my exfoliation, one or two end up ingrown no matter what. Oh well. Honestly? It's a price I'm willing to pay for otherwise smooth legs.
  312. I bought this item from Amazon about 2 years ago and I am still using it. Yes, it hurts. But it is pretty quick, affordable, and convenient compared to waxing. Use it on the areas that can withstand the pain. I find that the more often you epilate the area the less it hurts. Use it even when it seems too early to need to do it again. It helps a lot.

  314. First, it is no secret that epilating = ouch!!! But as others have suggested, a warm bath to soften the hair shaft and follicle (and for you to relax, haha), plus a few ibuprofen an hour or so before you actually use the epilator can really lessen the blow. As far as results go, my legs were not really as smooth as they are after I use a razor with shave gel; however, using the epilator a few times per month really reduced how often I had to shave, which is nice. I will really take anything that ultimately makes being a lady less of a hassle:) Now onto the more sensitive bits: I have waxed the southern region (though not totally bare) for many years but wanted to try the epilator to save money and trips to the salon. Believe me when I say it can be done (but not recommended for the faint of heart, or for the inexperienced), but again, it will not leave results as smooth as the waxing does. I also found myself having to tweeze hairs the epilator seemed to keep skimming over. Overall not a perfect product, but it certainly is helpful so long as your expectations are set right.

  325. I bought this item as a \\"newbie\\" to epilating. I was tired of the high cost of razors and wanted something that lasted longer, was more cost effective and less messy than waxing or chemical hair removers. I got every penny's worth and more. I love my epilator!!!!!!!! I wish I had discovered this years ago. While initially it's more time consuming to do than shaving, it's well worth it in the long run. I'll list the pros and cons, then go thru a summary of my experience/opinion for you. Areas used on- Primarily legs and occasionally bikini & underarm (the tweezer head on this model imo is too large to use on the face-for those areas I recommend the smaller model by Emjoi called EpiSlim) Pros: -Light to illuminate hairs-this is a godsend. -Multiple Speeds -Comfortable to hold -Easy to use -Multiple guide covers -Shaver attachment -Really does what is claims with slowing regrowth and lasting results (although that will vary per person) Cons: -Rotation of the tweezer head cylinder will PINCH (only certain areas) IF the skin is not pulled \\"really\\" tight (only in the loose and/or tender skin areas) -Mild to Mod Pain (first time is very unpleasant, but it gets less uncomfortable each time & I have a low tolerance for pain) -Occasionally misses hairs (only if your not slow and thorough enough, going against the hair growth or pulling the skin tight enough-basically, if you don't following directions) -Loud running sound/noise Features would Like to see added: 3 Speeds instead of 2 Brighter LED light I'll address the complaints most ppl had in other reviews from my own experience and perspective. In regard to: Pain-----as I said, it gets less so each time you do it-well worth the results Ingrown hairs and bumps------all forms of hair removal from shaving to waxing can cause ingrown hairs/bumps if the area is not regularly and properly exfoliated and moisturized before and after. Time---initially, yes it takes much longer, butthe results LAST much longer too. Missed hairs & random strays growing back in---This is a given with any form of hair removal esp since nothing is 100% totally effective and hair grows at different rates. Summary: If used properly, this device does what it claims and is well worth the cost and time. I highly recommend it. I won't ever go back to shaving again!

I wish it didn't have a plug and operated on batteries, bc having to plug it in to use it makes me lazy.   340. Decades ago (and I do think it was that long ago) I tried a friend's epilator that was something with a coil that reminded one of razor wire. Anyway, that thing was impossible and horribly painful! The Braun is a breeze. Granted, the first go around takes some courage (maybe even the liquid kind), but after that it's actually fun b/c if you do it often enough you're only pulling a few hairs here and there. I actually use it daily (even though weekly would be fine) during the time my computer is booting up or waiting for a file to download--a great way to pass time when you're waiting around anyway. Places I wouldn't even think of shaving b/c of inconvenience or just not wanting to have even *more* areas to maintain via shaving (thighs, toes) I now have cleared down to unbelievable smoothness, and they stay that way much longer than shaving. The one gotcha: in-grown hairs. Be ready to have a good pair of good tweezers to fish out in-grown hairs. They have not been a serious problem, and maybe if i used lotion more often it would not be an issue, but just lightly pulling on them with tweezers before I use the Braun helps.

  348. I LOVE this thing! Yes, it hurts, but as others have said, within a few minutes your skin is somewhat numb to it. I was able to do both my legs (to knees only) within 30 minutes. In the days following I did some touch up for the finer hairs that it missed. And, don't forget that not all hair grows at the same rate. Overall, this does a better job than any professional wax I've ever had. One recommendation I have for Braun is to somehow find a way to capture the hair as it epilates it. I found that my hair was all over the bathroom floor.
  349. I am shocked. You can definitely feel it, but it's not painful at all on my legs. Definitely no worse than using a slightly dull razor. I am sure using it on other areas of my body will probably be more painful, but on my legs it was fine. I think the key is making sure your hair is shortish. Oh, and I have course, dark, thick hair. Waxing and sugaring are painful. My only criticism is that it has to be plugged in to use- I think for the price paid it should be rechargeable. That's why it's four stars and not five :) .
  350. I bought this item almost 2 months back but I just used it once till now. It really does its job well. I really felt good after using it. But there is one thing that I thought wasn't exactly true. But its is not really true - atleast in my case. Guess if you use it twice a month it will really solve the purpose. On the whole the product is worth buying and easy to use. I would suggest to buy this item.
  351. I owned Philips epilator before, and I liked it a lot. It was very efficient, plucked everything at one or two attempts, no need to go over one area many times. This one is not so efficient, I have to go over one area for 4, 5 times (learned to be patient). Guess these tweezers are not strong enough, sometimes they kind of pull, but not pluck. The \\"more efficient\\" head I didn't like, my skin gets a rash if I use it. So I stick with \\"normal\\" one. Takes longer than with my older Philips, but the result is acceptable. The little light is a convenient feature though, very helpful. On the whole, not a bad product.
  352. I had tried \\"Epilady\\" many years ago, and this ISN'T IT... thank goodness !! I was so tired of shaving, the very next day to have stubble... it was frustrating. Waxing is a lot of work. I have been using this product for close to two years. I use it at least twice a week. The best part is there is no more hard stubble. It seems like the hair is softer, and less. Sometimes the hair can grow under the skin, but using a loafa helps. I think based on others reviews I might be better off using it daily. But it really does the job. I only use it on the legs, under arms were just too painful. I use the brush to clean it and it has worked fine. I would buy it again. And will when mine gives out.
  353. I have used an Emjoi epilator in the past. I thought that one was pretty good until I bought the Braun. I replaced my Emjoi with the Braun after using it for about 7 or so years. The Braun by FAR out does the Emjoi. The little light is a super plus. It helps to see the hairs I missed. The extra attatchments are really nice. I dont think that using an epilator hurts but then again I have been using one for about 10 yrs now. The Braun really gets all the hairs. I would not how ever use it on my bikini or arm pit area as that is WAY to sensitive for me. All and all this was a really good purchace and I highly recommend it to any one.
  354. I bought this product on the recommendation from a friend. I have waxed my legs for 15 years and was starting to get annoyed at the difficulty in finding quality wax for a decent price. I use this device once per week and it keeps my legs hair free! Note: you have to go over the same area few times-- once through does not get all the hair. I also tried it on my bikini line. It hurts but works well for a quick bathing suit job. I still plan to get my bikini line waxed as I can't get to all the areas with the braun. I recommend it to anyone who has been waxing!
  355. Let's face the facts: hair removal which is done by yanking hurts whether you wax or use a machine. After years of messy waxing, I bought one of these. Yes, it hurts, but I was already signed up for that when I bought it. I love this appliance because I don't have to replenish expendables such as wax, tongue depressors, or strips, so it is only a one-time expense. I don't have to heat it up and risk burning myself. I don't have to clean up after I use it. I just stick it back in the drawer. This particular model is great because it has a light, which is helpful to illuminate those fine, elusive hairs. It comes with a shaver for those faint at heart when it comes to underarm epilation. Because applying pressure after hair removal reduces pain (somewhat), the pressure rollers on the tweezer head help (a little).
  356. I decided to splurge out on the Braun Silk-Epil X'elle 5270 after reading a whop-load of reviews, mostly positive. I have tried 3 other epilators: an Emjoy, a Remmington and another Braun model. Since two of these were purchased second hand online, I opted to try a brand new Epilator, a bit on the pricer side, so see if there was any difference. So far, I'm quite impressed. I find this model is a lot quicker at epilating, it grabs the hairs nicely and gets the really short ones no problems. With all of the epilators I've tried, I need to epilate every few days, as my hair must grow at a faster rate, although the hairs are definately sparser and finer so it doesn't take long. I'm also discovering less ingrowns which is a plus. My legs feel a lot smoother also, so I'm happy with the result. Initially I found the Silk-epil to be a bit more painful to use than the others I've tried, but the results are a lot better, so I don't mind too much. The light is quite useful and the noise doesn't bother my ears as much as some of the other models. The only downside I can think of is that the attachments look a bit flimsy, and mine came with a pouch, would have prefered a nice case or something for the money I paid. I haven't tried the shaving attachments. I am wondering since I bought it new if it will continue to perform well or become less effective over time. So yes, so far so good, I would recommend this one for experienced epilators :)
  357. If you're considering getting this because you want to spend less time on hair removal than you would with shaving, you're out of luck. It takes forever to remove all the hair with this. The first time I tried it, it took almost all day. That in and of itself wouldn't be a huge problem, if the only downside was that it took as much time as shaving. After the hair is removed, I'm left with red bumps that persist 4+ days after using it. When they finally go away, and the hair starts pushing up through the skin again, more red bumps occur. Certain areas where the skin is soft (inner thigh) are a horrible experience. Pain I could deal with if the results were okay. But the skin actually gets caught in the machine and gets scraped, red, and bloody. This only happens in areas where the skin is malleable, for me it's inner thigh, back of knee, underarms. I thought this would work well considering all the good reviews. However I am inclined to believe most of those reviewers are not representative of a random sampling of the general population. Draw your own conclusions. I gave this 3 sessions, a week apart, over almost all of my body. After the first time it is less painful. It's still not worth it though, because all of the red bumps and all the hairs that snap off above the root. You also can't wait a month between uses as some say. After a week, there is a lot of hair visible, and the hair is less even and uniform than it would be if I had shaved it. In short: MUCH more irritation than shaving. Takes a VERY long time. Fails to remove some hairs. Painful over dense or deep hair or areas of sensitive skin. Don't believe the hype. I did.

I got tired of waxing, tweezing, bleaching, and the home laser hair treatments did not work. This product has held up great...Braun makes an excellent quality product. I use a toothbrush with rubbing alcohol to clean the head. I just wish I had bought this sooner! The product is also dual voltage which is wonderful if you travel!

  361. For reference: I'd traditionally have to shave once a day to once every other day and I'd never had experience with epilation or waxing. I have owned this product for almost a month. First off, what it WON'T do: 1) It will not give you silky smooth legs to the touch. 2) It won't get every hair every time, and it may miss finer hairs completely. 3) It won't be like eating ice cream in the park (pain factor). 4) It will NOT last weeks. 5) It will not look nice immediately (need time for the redness/bumps to go down). But it WILL: 1) It will give you VISIBLY nice legs for about a week at a time. 2) It will become more efficient as time goes on (first time ~3 hours, now ~0.5 hours) and it will dominate coarse, dark hair. 3) It will go from feeling like fire ants are devouring your legs to a vaguely uncomfortable sensation within a few uses. As for the product itself: 1) The light is extremely useful for spotting finer or missed hairs. 2) It is comfortable to hold and feels solid, plus the kit is nice--I like that it came with a little brush to clean it. I would recommend: 1) A pumice stone, loofah, etc. to exfoliate--some ingrown hair is kind of inevitable with this thing, but I got those shaving, too. 2) Rubbing alcohol or witch hazel to clean the tweezers (and to prevent infected ingrown hairs, so far all mine are just caught growing along the surface but not \\"impacted\\" if you will). 3) Taking some advil before your first time. I know some people are recommending an alcoholic drink, but booze tends to dilate blood vessels near the surface of the skin and (in my non-expert opinion) I can't help but feel this'd be the same as taking two steps forward and one step back. 4) If you have a bigger bathroom, you may need an extension cord since you'll probably want to do this over the tub to avoid a mess.. Final/qualitative remarks: I haven't worked up the chutzpah to use it on my bikini line or underarms (tried the latter once and it startedto bleed), but those take only a couple of minutes to shave in the first place... I mostly like being able to throw on shorts or a skirt without worrying about my legs. Every time I'd get goosebumps after shaving, I could practically feel the hair growing and my legs would no longer be smooth. Epilation eliminated this problem and I find it fantastically rewarding to see the hairs ripped out by the root (you can see the little bulb on the end, so it's definitely not just ripping it off at the surface). I also love the fact that this thing costs less than a single wax job around here; I'm very satisfied with my investment. If you've got a reasonable pain tolerance (for the first one or two uses, especially) and you're committed, you'll probably love this thing as much as I do. :)
  362. I have used Braun products for more than ten years and I am satisfied with them. This one also is a good choice for this prize and it is useful. but its average life will be not more than two years if you use it twice per month for one hour.

  365. I've been using epilators for a very long time and I must say this is the best I had so far. It has all the right attachments and it works like a dream. the light is also very helpful, so you don't miss anything. great buy!
  366. Product Usage: Some reviews say that it didn't hurt much at all. Other reviews say it hurt a fair bit during the first use. My first time use was very painful and it took quite a while for me to finish the first session. My second session was MUCH quicker and far less painful. Most of the time, I felt a mild plucking sensation as opposed to the \\"OW!\\" feeling I had during the first use. If you wax semi-often, it shouldn't hurt much at all. This thing is basically controlled waxing. Sensitive areas of the body included ankles, wrists, elbows, and knees. If you're one of those who find epilation painful on the first use, try setting it to the \\"slow\\" mode and twisting your wrist left and right as if you were making paint brush strokes. This will get hairs bit by bit while pulling the epilator back after it grabs a few, reducing the first-time pain from \\"constant\\" to \\"semi-constant\\". Women with smaller hands may find the unit a little akward to use, especially when getting the hard to reach spots like the back of a leg or arm. Also, I've never felt a pinching feeling when the epilator is pressed too close to the skin. Finally, redness will occur from use so I advise using it a full 24-48 hours BEFORE going somewhere important or when doing something in which you feel looks matter. Two days after use and still smooth skinned! I have seen many people suggest using a mild moisturizer though after epilation to soothe your skin. The Smartlite: Ingenious idea! It helps highlight the hairs in the area you've got the light near and can show you hair in places you might not have expected to see it in. Without this, I would never know if I had gotten all the hairs or not. Product came with: The epilator came with a \\"beginner\\" head that's supposed to sooth the skin and lessen the feeling of pain through vibrations but I haven't noticed a difference between either the beginner head or the precision head. It also came with a shaving head for the men afraid to try it on a particularly long haired area. The shaver also came with an attachment that combs the longer hair is \\"certain areas\\" into the trimmer, making for easy shaving/trimming. The trimmed hair doesn't feel prickly or stabby-sharp like hair does a day after shaving. Storage: The product came with a durable feeling, draw-string pouch large enough to contain everything. Everything being the shaver head, various attachments, power cord, cleaner brush, and the epilator itself without feeling as if I were cramming the pouch overly full of things. So, storage is fairly easy. Cons: Occasionally, I had to turn the machine off to let the motor cool off in fear of it otherwise burning out during my first-time area use session because it was taking so long due to me being a wimp with pain. Second time use, I didn't encounter this problem. Secondly, it is a bit noisy so I avoid using it late at night or before the average household bed time. Overall, this is a good product and worth the money but I would still suggest people shop around for the best price. $50 USD+ is a LOT of money to pay for anything these days so make sure you get the best damned deal you can!
  367. I was expecting it to still hurt like crazy when I used it, but it didn't hurt at all and got rid of the hair. It takes a few passes to get it all but it's better then shaving. Highly recommend.

This is the only epilator I tried & I do not want to try anything else...

  373. I have been using epilators on and off for years and lost my last one. I was never totally satisfied with it but it was good enough. I jumped on Amazon yesterday to read product reviews and I admit this wasn't my first choice. The one I really wanted is on back order so I thought I'd give this one a try. I got next day delivery and just finished using it. I am very pleased with my results. I haven't waxed or epilated for awhile so I used the starter head. Worked pretty well. Once I finished my entire leg, I went over it again with the advanced head and got a ton more hairs. Even TINY little ones! I never used my epilator on my thighs before because the hairs are so fine, it seemed like I could never get them with the epilator. I used this one on my thighs and it got almost everything. The light is not bad, not really necessary but not bad. If you really don't like it, you could just put a little piece of tape over it. Some hair did break instead of getting plucked but that will happen with any epilator. If you are getting a lot of hair breaking off, hold the epilator so that the light is pointing down towards your ankle and the hair is being pulled in the direction it grows. Also hold your skin really tight. That helps too. I also read that if the hair breaks before it is pulled out, that the hair is too long. I am going to go over my legs again in a few days to see if I can get all the little ones that broke. As no epilator will ever be perfect, I am rating this 5 stars becuase it is way better than my Emjoi or any other epilator I have tried. I love it! And wayyyyyy easier than waxing. And yes, the pain will get less, just push through it the first time. One tip is to get your legs waxed at a salon and then try the epilator when the hair starts growing back.

To get my underarms less painfully I really need another hand to hold my skin taut but I haven't had the heart to ask my boyfriend to do that for me. Unfortunately I do have the tendency to get ingrown hairs, I did when I waxed and shaved, but I got a lot with this. Nothing that a good hot soak and scrub in the tub with maybe a couple of tweezes didn't fix though. The other problem is that no matter how long I wait between epilating I never really get smooth. There always seems to be those shorter hairs that it can't grab but mine won't seem to sync up at all. You can't see those hairs so at least my legs LOOK nice and soft and smooth. I'd recommend a hot bath first with a scrub pouf, dry off really well and then go for it. When it grew back it was a little finer, but mostly just came out easier and I did it when the hair was really short.   389. I have no complaints about this product; I love it!   391. I got the epilator as a gift. I've tried a lot of things, coil epilators, wax, gels and of course that lovely razor! But nothing compares to this one. I tried it on my girlfriend whose legs were like a jungle. 1 week went by and the hair was substantially thinner and sparse. It really does minimize the hair and the regrowth. Just one note, it hurts the first time you do it, but well worth the discomfort. It was so good, I bought 3 more, you never can enough of a good thing.
  392. This is great for my chinny chin chin, which would otherwise be rather hairy. I have tried electrolysis, shaving, waxing and plucking and this works better than all. It does not hurt much on the chin, but probably would other places. Did you really think hair removal came without pain?
  393. My husband researched all kinds of epilators, then purchased this one for me for Christmas. I was happy to get it because I hate shaving, but very nervous about what it might feel like. But since I'm Italian with dark hair and have to shave about every other day, I am glad to have it. The first time I used it on my legs. It took two days for a total of 4 hours because I have a low pain tolerance. It felt like FIRE on my legs! After reading other people' reviews, I may not even try it on my underarms, I'm not sure. I'm not going near facial hair with this machine...I use creme bleach for that. But it's been about 2 weeks since I first used it. I had to use it again tonight and it took 30 minutes for both legs and did not hurt nearly as much. I did notice tons of ingrown hairs, so I guess I'll need to do a better job of exfoliating. Bottom line: shaving will give you perfectly smooth legs at least for a day, but you'll have to keep it up every other day just about. The epilator lets you forget about your legs for alot longer, but you'll always have different lengths of hair growing out, so you'll never have a day with perfectly smooth legs. For me, it's just nice to not have to shave so often! And the hairs that do grow out aren't too obvious or prickly.
  394. Well that is my girlfriend opinion. The Braun 5270 includes a shaver/trimer head and in my gf opinion it is not as painful as wax ways.
  395. I had this product on my Wish List and got it for my birthday. I have thick dark hair, and I was getting sick of shaving every single day, or going through the embarrassment of having those little buggers say hello to the world if I didn't have my legs completely covered. I was eager to try something new, so I did a bunch of research and comparing online and decided Braun was my best bet, and had the best reviews. Being a college kid, I've become quite the penny pincher, but I decided if I was going to invest in something like this, I might as well get something that looks like it would last me. I tried my new epilator for the first time, and as most will tell you, it's certainly not painless. I wouldn't qualify myself as a baby when it comes to pain, but I don't have super pain tolerance either. The first time I used it I was only brave enough to do part of my leg and then stopped. A month later I decided to go at it again (I strongly recommend making it the first thing you do after toweling off after a hot shower to open the pores, soften the hair and calm your skin). The part of my leg that I had epillated a month earlier had fewer, finer hairs and I found it MUCH easier to re-epilate this area than to do the rest. I finished that lower leg and have yet to be brave enough to do the other one. It will take time to get used to, but I'm convinced it will only get better from here! Someday I'll be brave enough to do my upper leg and underarms. I got all the attachments advertised and I'm happy with my product! Everything works like a charm and the spotlight really really does help!
  396. I am a woman of fair complexion who has sensitive skin with various types of hair growth ranging from black thick sticks to clear feathery wisps. I've been shaving for years and enduring painful razor burn after every shave. I've tried all kinds of razors and cremes and nothing gave me exactly what I was looking for. Electric razors never shaved close enough. I tried waxing at home, but I could never get it to work especially on the thick, stiff hairs (which I am sure was due to my lack of technique). In a moment of desperation I decided to look into epilators. After reading several review sites the Braun line jumped to the forefront. The one I was initially interested in is not offered in the United States so I found the one most similar to it. Several of the reviews that I read suggested that one should get a professional wax job (one or more) before attempting epilating. I am too cheap to do that so upon suggestion from my boyfriend I tried plucking out some hairs with my tweezers just to see how painful this may become. Yes, it hurt but the pain was fleeting. I decided that I could live with this and bought the epilator. When it arrived I started with the beginner attachment and ran it on the high setting (the high setting was strongly recommended by many as the slow was too torturous for them). *OUCH!* The initial shock momentarily took my breath away! Tweezing one hair at a time is one thing, but pulling out several at a time is MUCH different! It wasn't too long before I felt I might pass out so I stopped and took a break. After regaining my breath I tried again. Each time I did something a little different. I experimented with how fast I moved the epilator along and the attachment that I was using. It took some time and several breaks before I had just my left calf done. However, I managed to gather valuable information such as where I am the most sensitive (ankles, shin bones, knees, and the backs of the knees) and that the toughest hairs will sometimes take multiple swipes to pluck. I also discovered that moving the epilator faster results in a more intense level of pain, but that the pain subsided that much faster. The beginner attachment works just fine, but the professional one is much more efficient in that it plucks out more hairs at one time. More initial pain, less time spent plucking, AND faster recovery ... Oh yeah! On to the right calf! My right calf was much more difficult. Unlike the left one the hairs grow in all directions. This calf took even longer *Sigh!* I had to move the epilator in multiple directions multiple times just to get all of the hairs. Just remember to keep the skin pulled taught no matter what direction you are going in. This helps tremendously! The first day was the most time consuming. I thought I wouldn't make it! However, the maintenance is a breeze! About every 10 days I go back and epilate the few hairs that are growing out. This is quick and not nearly as painful as before. I've only had my epilator for 1 month, but in my mind it has more than paid for itself. No razor burn ever again!!!! Since getting it I have epilated all types of hairs all up and down my legs with great success. There were a couple of bumps that formed and quickly went away, but nothing painful. Yes, I have to take multiple swipes with the epilator, but that may be due more to my multiple hair types and multi-directional growth patterns than anything else. All told, I highly recommend this product to those willing to endure that first very painful session. Believe me, once you get past that point it's all a breeze from there! P.S. - If you decide to try plucking with tweezers don't do what I did and pluck too large of an area. The tweezers don't do nearly as good of a job as the epilator does. I am still dealing with hairs in that area that are growing straight under the skin. I've had to go back and dig them out with my tweezers. I can't wait to be able to use the epilator that area!
  397. I love it! Much faster than having to tweeze, and the price was fantastic!
  398. The Epilator's discs are not all metal like the one I used to have some years ago, therefore it seems to me like they don't do as good as a job. It also seems to hurt more than I remembered (I am used to doing the brazilian waxing, so I'm not too sensitive). It still is great for when you can't wait for the hair to grow long to have them waxed. It takes out even the very short ones. I found the light and the attachments very usefull. The cover for the normal epilator keeps slipping out though. Overall I like it, but some of those other \\"little problems\\" bother me.

I used my Braun right out of the shower and was done within 10 minutes. There was no tugging or pulling on my skin. My hair length was a good 1/4\\". I won't lie and tell you it didn't hurt a bit but it wasn't unbearable. If you pull your skin taught, it's much more comfortable. This was definitely money well spent!!!!

  415. I was afraid to use this for a week after I got it because I was afraid it would be very painful. On my legs, though, I am not quite sure. I can feel the machine pricking my skin, but after each use, my legs do not feel very smooth. I can feel the stubble already growing in! Like another reviewer has said, it seems to be only breaking the hairs off and not plucking from the roots. I am not sure why it works better on my underarms than legs because you would think it would be easier to epilate the leg cuz the surface area is larger and smoother than the nook of the underarm.   416. This epilator is outstanding! I've used an Epilady in the past, and while I liked the results, it took forever, the hair had to be fairly long, and it was a little uncomfortable on legs and excruciating on underarms. This solves all those problems! It works so quickly. Take slow, even strokes along your leg and in 3 passes (tops!) all the hair is gone. It grabs even the shortest stubble - if you can see it, it can grab it! And I found it completely pain free on my legs. Maybe some people have more sensitive skin, or really thick roots and that's why they complain, but I literally felt no pain whatsoever. The underarms is a different story. Don't be fooled, it does hurt but there are some tricks! First, it takes a bit of flexibility but you need to make sure the skin is tight. Whether you can manage to use both hands (a bit tricky) or hold the skin so it's tight by using the heel of your hand, and move it only with your fingers, keeping the skin tight makes the hair come out much easier. (Same goes for your legs, hold the skin tight with your other hand and the hairs come out even faster and easier.) If the skin is very loose it can get grabbed by the tweezers and scratch the skin. Also, the first time on the underarms is the worst by far. If you can do it once, follow up as soon as you see some hairs. The hairs won't all grow back at the same rate so if you do it when there's only a little it hurts much less. After only a couple of times I can do my underarms in a few seconds each and it barely stings. In general, it takes about the same amount of time as shaving (maybe a little more) but the results last for weeks! My only regret is that I waited so long to buy this!
  417. I've never waxed in my entire life and so I was a little scared when I first tried this epilator. I used it on full speed when I tried it and there was a little discomfort but It really wasn't bad at all. I have fine hair so I have to go over the same spot a couple of times but thats fine because you don't need to use it as often as a razor. If you tend to get ingrown hairs all you need to do is exfoliate regularly.

  424. Don't usually write, but if you're on the fence about this it's great. It hurts, but beauty is sometimes pain.
