  425. I love this epliator! I was a teen in the 80's when the epilators back then were horrible medieval coiled devices--I never could bear the pain. The grip and the light make it so comfortable and user-friendly. To deal with the pain for newbies: I saw another reviewer's suggestions and used them--they worked. Soak in hot water for your first time or two, dry thoroughly, then use the massage head. Believe me, after you do it a few times, the pain goes away. (Think: plucking eyebrows. Hurts at first, but after a few times not at all anymore.) So run through with the massage head a few times, then you can upgrade to the faster attachment when the pain lessens. To deal with ingrown hairs (A MUST TO READ!!): when you epilate, if you don't do anything to your skin to prevent ingrown hairs, expect ALMOST EVERY hair to become ingrown! I have dark, thick hair and was having to shave daily. When I first became smooth with the epilator, I loved it! I didn't think anything could be worse than the 5:00 shadow I routinely got on my legs every day with shaving. I WAS WRONG! After my first epilation, I tried using Prince Reigns a few times, but it was so gross and sticky that I did not use it regularly. When the first new batch of hair grew in, it was a horror! I was covered in in-growns! The thing about Prince Reigns is, it's pretty expensive, you have to use a lot of it, so the $25 bottle goes really quickly, and it leaves this gross sticky goo on your legs that doesn't get better throughout the day...it stays sticky until your next shower--and you put on more after each shower. I felt like my skin couldn't breath and was suffocating, plus I had to be careful not to rest my hands on my legs as I sat in shorts or a skirt or I'd have to go wash them again to get the sticky residue off. And it wasn't fun for my boyfriend. In-grown solution: a good, course body brush. You know, natural bristles on a stick like at the health food store? I recently discovered body brushing (which, by the way, makes your skin feel FABULOUS!), and decided to see if it could help prevent the in-growns, and it does. My hair is super thick and grows in very quickly, and I have to epilate at least a few days every week (versus others who can make it 3-4 weeks). I've been using a body brush for a month on my legs, and the results are just as good, if not better, than Prince Reigns. My skin is also super soft and feels buttery (boyfriend LOVES IT!), no in-grown hairs, and no more sticky, gooey legs. My skin can rock and still breathe! It's better for you, natural, and way more cost-effective. How to use body brush: Do it dry! Don't get the bristles wet. Every day before you shower, brush down your body from chin to toe. The bristles are course and it's another thing you get used to, but you'll crave it after you start. Make sure you really go over the epilated areas well. The brush removes dead surface layers, improves circulation, and polishes and smooths the skin. Easy, takes about 3 minutes. If you love your skin and like feeling beautiful, also look into getting a Clarisonic Pro facial brush. Trust me, you'll feel like a million bucks and look like it, too!
  426. I wanted to buy an epilator for my legs. I got this after reading all the reviews. It doesn't hurt much, but it takes a long time to take out the hair. Because of that, the hair grows back in a couple of days. So I don't recommend it for those with relatively thin leg hair. It is also very noisy.

  430. I have been waxing ever since i could remember but with the busy schedule it was damn difficult thing to do. It is much better than waxing as you dont have to wait for full hair growth and you can remove even smallest hair. - The smart light is very useful as it highlights any areas that you can skip even during daylight. -Its best for Legs and Arms and its much easier, cheaper than waxing. Saves a ton of money -Hairs are completely removed and your skin looks as smooth as waxing and regrowth is also slow compared to shaving. -Eventually Ingrown hairs also are reduced, if you implement and read the instruction manual, which gives you tip about removal of ingrown hairs. Negatives: -Truth is it is bit painful, I would say slightly more than waxing. Thicker the hair, more the pain. So the trick is use shaver attachement for thick hairs trim them a bit and then use the normal hair removal attachment. This is just first time, once you get used to it, you will just feel it normal. - Dont try straitaway in sensitive areas like under arms and bikini, it will hurt a lot. Use them on legs and hands if comfortable try slowly on other areas. - It is not cordless and is bit noisy you have to station yourself at some place to use it. But i beleive battery powered wouldnt work at such speed so its ok. -After hair removal, put on some moisturiser or body lotion to prevent bumps. The trick to use this product in best way is dont wait for the full grown hair, just keep on removing as and when they grow. I have loved it and am much releived after buying this product as i can do it on my own convinience and especillay dont haveto wait for the \\"rgiht time \\". So best for busy women.

  433. Ladies (& Gentlemen),<br /><br />After much research, and many years of shaving, attempting to wax, going back to shaving, and repeating this vicious cycle, I finally decided to invest in an epilator. I think I read every single review on Amazon, put this epilator in my cart, took it out, put it back, and finally had the courage to go through with this purchase. I knew it would be painful, but I was hoping the ends would justify the means - and it has!<br /><br />I will admit, the first time I used the epilator, I did one little strip of hair on my leg and didn't know how much more I could stand. However, I eventually got used to the sensation and found the courage to continue. The first time I epilated (I didn't shave before hand and had about two days of growth), it took about an hour to do both of my bottom legs. The next day I did my upper thighs and it took about a half hour. Yes, the first time you do this it will hurt and there will be *a lot* of hair. However, I am happy to report the growth that does come in is now much less. Because I just started epilating, I realize that my hair will continue to grow until I've epilated throughout the entire hair cycle. So every other day I have been epilating. Now it only takes about 15 minutes to do both legs. I will continue to do this for another week or two to ensure I am keeping up with the hair growth cycle.<br /><br />Now for the elusive bikini line - I did shave this area before attempting to epilate. Look girls, I am in the military, I am deployed to Afghanistan, and I carry two weapons every day... I consider myself a pretty tough cookie, but even I will not attempt to epilate this area without extreme caution. So as I said, I shaved before hand, and then epilated... It wasn't bad! I will continue to epilate this area as I do my legs.<br /><br />Undearms - I have tried this area, it hurts more than the bikini line - but go for it. With any area, the first time is the worst time and it will get progressively better.<br /><br />So overall - a great product! Oh and don't forget to exfoliate!<br /><br />God Bless America... and Braun :)

  435. Even though this Epilator is very effective in removing hair, it was the most painful thing ever!!!!!! All pain aside, It has been almost 3 weeks since I used the epilator and I have a lot less hair than ever before...I recommend it for its effective hair removal that can last upto 3 weeks, but the pain is something you'll have to take...pain is beauty so...good luck!
  436. I have used Braun Silk epil in the past and this is a great replacement. I would highly recommend this product.
  437. Let me preface by saying that I have been waxing for over 10 years, so I find that there is no pain associated with this product on my legs. It does sting a little if used in more intimate areas, but that too, seems to lessen over time. It is certainly a tremendous improvement over the first epilady from 15 years ago, which caused ingrowns and never really worked properly. In using this, one gets maximum results by keeping the skin taut. It is essential to exfoliate daily to prevent ingrowns. One one's legs, this works as well as waxing, and it is certainly MUCH easier to take to Europe for 2 months than a tub of hot wax. The biggest failure of this item is it's size, which requires a relatively flat area of body of roughly 2 inches across. The epilady slides effortlessly over the legs, but there is not 2 inches of flat body on one's underarms or bikini area! Consequently, there is chafting and it is very difficult to remove all the hair. Please manufacturers, make a smaller head attachment for the bikini and underarm areas!
  438. I was quite skeptical to try this. My mom had an epilady long long ago, and I remember trying it and it HURT! Well, this thing hurts too, but it's SOOOO worth the end product of not having to shave every other day! I worked at my legs in sections, and it took a few days to get most of the hair gone. But NOW!!! I run the epilator over my legs every few days or when I notice a stray growing. NO more shaving, unless of course I want silky smooth legs, then I still have to shave. Haven't gotten the courage up to do my underarms or bikini area though. The only thing I can relate the discomfort to is getting a tattoo. It's that annoying uncomfortable feeling, but once most of the hair is gone, it's not bad at all.
  439. I have never tried epilating before and the first 3 times I tried it on my legs, I nearly had tears in my eyes. After I got through the initial pain, it was like other reviewers said and the pain decreased significantly much as with plucking your eyebrows. I have attempted to do my underarms on a couple occasions, but it really did bring tears to my eyes, so I think I will have to think of alternatives for that area. I shudder to think what it would be like if I attempted the bikini area. I am really pleased with the results on my legs as my skin seems to be much smoother and I can go several weeks without having to worry about unsightly hair. Since my hair is pretty course and dark, it did take me several attempts to get a hairless leg. I have been using a body brush to exfoliate and have not yet had a problem with ingrown hairs.

  442. ok, so i bought this product after reading all the positive reviews on amazon. it arrived within 4 days and i was very excited (also very nervous) to use it. many users mentioned that it was very painful. \\"hah,\\" i said to myself, \\"i'm a strong chick, how bad can this hurt?\\" i was pretty convinced that my pain tolerance was high. just in case, i took two shots of vodka and chugged some wine. HOLY #$#@ and all the powers of hell, THIS DEVICE HURTS. the pain is almost unbearable. ok lets keep in mind i am very hairy. i have hair EVERYWHERE and i've been shaving since i was like 13... my entire leg, \\"bikini area\\" stomach, etc... (other horrid places that i wont get into...) And my hair is thick, too. Three or four grow out of each follicle, from shaving, i assume. now this epilator hurts like the powers of hell. i am not lying. i cannot express how bad the pain is. i'm in my early 20's but THIS WAS THE MOST PAIN I HAVE EXPERIENCED IN MY LIFE. i started crying midway through my first leg. (seriously). luckily the epilator is so darn loud my roomates couldn't hear me. i had tears, sweat, and mucous streaming down my face as i sobbed -- my legs were twitching horribly and i winced and gritted my teeth against the firey stinging. i couldn't even get through both legs! (i'm doing the other one today). however... my leg is NOTICEABLY SMOOTHER and has less hair. SO... i fully intend to continue this. i'm tired of being hairy. update: the pain is getting easier to deal with. the ingrowns SUCK. what a waste of my time, pulling ingrown hairs out. ugh. and it still hurts A LOT. it doesnt get my legs smooth either... i still have to shave. i dont know about this thing... my legs look ugly. and they have odd stubble. is it worth it? sigh. :(

I have my legs waxed but the hair still grows out pretty coarse and thick. Guess I should thank my parents' genes for that one. Anyway, right off the bat I realized I made a mistake purchasing the silk-epil. Not only did it hurt like \\"insert word\\", it barely took any hair with it. You have to hold it at a complete 90 degree angle and pray with every stroke for it to nab just a few hairs. The rest of your skin is left looking like you took up giving yourself lashes. Mind you, I wasn't pressing into the skin at all - following the instructions to the letter. I, in my brilliant state of mind, decided that \\"gee, I must be missing something here\\" and tried my other leg. Heaven help me! I am so sorry for all the wrong I have ever done. Please make the pain stop! My legs are now burning, red and ready to walk away from me on their own. I have a very high tolerance for pain but this broke all barriers. Moral of my experience: If you have coarser hair, you might want to think twice about purchasing this particular epilator. If you have baby fine hair that won't feel like fish hooks being ripped from your skin, then you might consider this for purchase.

  459. The Braun Epilator is my new best friend! Ok so I was at my wits end with shaving. I am hypoallergenic and you wouldn't believe how much of a pain that makes hair removal; I know it's a pain enough for the average woman but my skin is so sensitive that I loathe the thought of having to shave. I was skeptical to try and epilator but it was getting to the point where shaving wasn't an option any longer and waxing was too much work for too much money. I read as many reviews as I could find, and did my research. This epilator ended up looking like the most bang for my buck... so I went ahead and decided to give it a try. I used it for the first time last night thinking I was going to be disappointed with yet another failure. On my first go I tried it on the \\"Slow\\" setting and with the massage head (this is supposed to be easier and not hurt as much). To my amazement it didn't hurt at all! And it pulled the hairs out like magic! So, without blinking an eye I put on the \\"Expert\\" head and used the high setting. EASY! I said out loud, \\"I'm never going to have to shave again!\\" And I was so excited I called my best friend to tell her about my incredible new find. I'm even so happy with this I am getting her one for her birthday. So, here's the breakdown: don't get me wrong, it does feel like every hair is being plucked out of your skin but it's really not bad at all. If you are reading this review you are probably as fed up with hair removal as I was and this is your answer! Don't let the idea that it may hurt sway you in the slightest! It's nothing you can't get used to, and ladies if you are reading this and you've ever gotten a tattoo this is completely doable!!! It is NOTHING in comparison. And to those of you that don't know what that feels like still listen to me when I say that you can use this product. I also like that it comes with a ladies shaver head too, so you really are getting the most for your money. Try it! I bet you'll be wishing you had found it sooner.   474. I like this product. However, I have been using it as directed for 1 month, and I have yet to not have stuble. I think that it pulls lots of hairs from the root, but it also breaks some off. This causes the stuble. I have noticed that some hairs take weeks to grow back, but a lot grow back within a week.<br /><br />For those who have always shaved, SHAVE FIRST, then use the epilator every day for two weeks. This will DRASTICALLY reduce the pain. It does hurt, but it is true what they say about it not hurting as bad the more you use it. I think that when the hair is pulled out, it weakens the root, causing less pain.<br /><br />Powder helps a lot. Make sure you use the brush to clean it after every use, or it will get all jammed and it will not grip hairs. It takes about an hour to do both legs. I have not used epilators in the past, so I have nothing to compare it to, but I think that it takes too long. Hopefully, if I keep using it, eventually I will get every hair and have no more stubble. BE SURE TO EXFOLIATE!!!! If you don't YOU WILL GET INGROWN HAIRS!!! PROMISE!!!<br /><br />All in all, it is a good product, but don't expect some miracle machine that makes your legs feel the way the models do after they spend hundreds on a wax job. LOL. I hope it gets better. LOL.

Oh, and the shorter the hair the less it hurts, I swear! I am not sure if this epilator would be great for everyone but it definitely worked for me and I have medium-coarse hair and pretty sensitive skin.

It's a little scary at first because of the noise and the fact the head is spinning so fast but once you get used to it, it's easy to use and not as painful (depending on the area) as I thought. I've used it on my arms, legs, bikini, underarms, and face and it works everywhere. You just have to go in different directions to get all the hairs. If you're looking for something quick, this is not it. It does take time to get all of the hairs removed especially since your body has curves. Also, your hairs grow at different rates so when you start out you may have to use it a couple days in a row but then you will have a lasting result. Be warned... you may get addicted to hair removal because of this product.
  504. I am very happy with my purchase of this little machine. It's true that the first time especially it definitely hurts, as you have the most hair then, but it's not unbearable if you've waxed before. I'd been shaving for much of the winter, so it was especially uncomfortable the first time I used it, as I had a lot of shaving regrowth. However, now I can just get the little bit of regrowth whenever I like, and due to the cycle of hair regrowth (just some regrows at a time), it doesn't hurt at all as it's so little hair to pull each time. It will be so much easier, so much less messy, & so much less time-consuming than waxing! I'm also the sort of person that when they shave, the hair is already stubbly and gross the next day, so waxing or something of that sort is essential for me. I've only done touch-ups in the past month (which is much more easily done than with waxing), but my legs have stayed mostly hairless the whole time. I use it on my legs and arms currently so I can only attest to those (I can't stand to do my armpits- it is too sensitive!!- and I had my bikini-line laser-removed 2 years ago, so there's nothing there to test. I'd never done my arms before but was tempted with this product as I've long disliked the dark hair there. It seems to do well so far with that too.). As with waxing, ingrown hairs can be a problem on your legs, so you need to experiment to find what works for you. I use a loofah, but it's not totally perfect, so am still looking for the best solution- sometimes something like a medicated scrub on a loofah or something like that seems to do it. So far, this product has greatly helped me and made my life easier- I'm very happy with it. For those that can stand waxing, I'd highly recommend it!!

It's weirdly fun -- same satisfaction you get when vacuuming a dirty floor, hehe. Way better than home waxing (messy, time-consuming, hard to get back side); salon waxing (whoowee, pricey); shaving (I nick myself and it comes back the next day so it's endless); creams (smelltakular and messy); laser (haven't tried that one but thought about it and can't justify cost/risk). It's a bit loud so prepare yourself for that. Does it hurt? Didn't bother me on my legs (but I have self-waxed). Maybe a bit pinchy at times and I did have some dots on my legs (slight irritation) after wards that subsided in about half an hour (don't whip this out right before you're gonna showcase your gams). A quarter inch length made it easy to grip and remove hairs but it got shorter ones too. You do have to pass it back and forth to get 'em all (i.e., more like a vacuum than a lawn mower). I tried it on my armpits. Whoa nellie! Had to grit my teeth and just did a teeny area at a time. But ahhh totally worth it. It's so easy to use that you can grab it, run in back and forth over any new sprouts in 30 sec and be done (since hairs will come in at different times). And then you can smile knowing they won't be back for a few weeks. DO get this version, not the cheaper one cause the light is FANTASTIC. Look, yer gonna be using this for years and years, so pony up and treat yourself. You will be happy. I'm just sayin. Finally, i will share that I did it with no skin preparation (exfoliation, washing etc.). I just wrestled that sucker out of the incredibly frustrating packaging (have scissors or axe handy), plugged it in and had at it. Worked just fine. For Legs of Devastating Glory I would 1) use this night before; 2) exfoliate with awesome salt scrub next morning; 3) lavish with rich moisturizer. Good luck!

  533. First, let me say that I was very hesitant to buy an epilator at all because I was one of the victims of the original Epilady back in the 80's which was a spinning coil that grabbed a bunch of hair and ripped. Yes, it was as bad as it sounds. I remember sitting outside in the snow hoping the cold would numb my legs enough to deal with the pain. It didn't. Money wasted... Fast forward 20 years...MAJOR leaps in technology and design were made with epilators! I bought the Braun 5270 because I liked the idea that the massaging rollers that would help to dull some of the pain. Well, I didn't even need that attachment. I started with it, but quickly went to the pro clip and maximum efficiency. I did my entire legs without a problem. Sure, it pinched a little, but you kinda get used to it. After my legs, I was so confident, I went on to my bikini line. The top part, I had no problem with. It wasn't as painful as I had expected. Inside my thighs, though, was another story. I haven't been able to conquer that or my underarms yet. It feels like it's getting caught on my skin even if I pull the skin tight in both of those areas. Ladies - if you had the torture device know as the original Epilady in the 80's and are hesitant about ever owning one again, DON'T BE! This is nothing compared to that thing! I wish I would have gotten one of these sooner, but I'm so glad I finally did! I've read a lot of reviews that said that it is painful, but bearable. I'd say it's more than bearable, it's more annoying than painful. That was my experience anyway. And just to put it in perspective, I've only waxed once...recently did full legs and full bikini. I'm so glad I won't have to waste my money on that again! I hope this review helps! If you can stand the minor annoyance of tweezing, or the pain of waxing, then buy this. I don't think you will be disappointed. The massaging rollers do help, but it also keeps the tweezers from getting to all of yourhair. So, it helps, but is less efficient. Overall, I give this product 5 stars. I think it's great! I wish I bought it years ago, and if I had to do it over again, I'd do it in a heartbeat! Worth every penny!
  534. I have been using epilady since I was 12 or 13; for about 20 years. Bought this Braun due to replacement of an old epilady. I wish I purchased this model much earlier. Better in every way than any Epilady I've used in a long time. Light that assists vision while removing hairs at first seemed rediculous but it really does help. Fast removal, completely does the job. Super highly recommended.

The attachment does make it less painful, but it also keeps it from grabbing as many hairs. However, I am still using it and have discovered that if I epilate regularly (once a week for me), it doesn't hurt as bad because your hairs grow in cycles and not all of them are there.   551. I'm not a reviewer but I had to write a bit on this product. I have been a waxer for years. I am dark haired and of mediterranean descent. I would consider the hair on my lower legs to be thick/course, as well as the hair on the back of my thighs, my arm hairs are plentiful but fine. Generally when I wax I would have my upper lip ($15), full leg ($75), and bikini (brazilian) ($40), and on occasion my arms ($40) done. The bill would total out to $170 dollars w/o the tip (um...NYC is pricey, no?). I had been growing out my last wax job to have another when a friend recommended this product. I thought there was no way it would do a job that would compete with my professional waxer. I was mistaken. I did my legs while watching TV. Good job, it got all the hairs! So I decided to do my arms which I would wax on occasion but would always get pimples here and there because of the wax, so stopped. It did my arms and I woke up this morning with no red inflamed little bumps anywhere! woot woot! I didn't think it would be possible that this machine could possibly get the finer hairs on my upper lip but it did, PERFECTLY, and I don't have to worry about the inevitable zits there either, where historically the wax would clog my pores, or the bright red swath of irritated skin where the wax was applied!!! I couldn't bring myself to do the nooks of the bikini area but was able to get a bit off the sides and top, after using the trimmer. Good enough until I get around to fully waxing the lady bits. It was time consuming but I could do it at home and, again, I saved a total of $130.00. And I love that I can get all the little hairs that will pop up in 3 to four days when I feel like it, so I can stay smooth. As for the pain, I followed the same regimen that my waxer has recommended for years. Hot bath, loofah, no moisturizing or oil based product beforehand, and two pain killers of your choice, before you start. Also never wax/epilate right before or during your period because (she says) you feel more pain. Whether this is true, I don't know, but it sounded reasonable so I followed her advice. (clearly not a concern for the men folk...) I would recommend this little marvel to any waxers out there or anyone that is super busy and just doesn't want to deal with the salon, specially for the upper lip and arms! Love this purchase, love a beauty product that ACTUALLY WORKS! Love the convenience of never having to wax my upper lip again and LOVE the hundreds of dollars I will be saving! (all the positives outweigh that this little guy is kinda loud and for a second I was paranoid that my 3 male neighbors might think I had some kind of industrial 'vibrating device' going for two hours...;) so be warned, its not soundless!)

  556. I bought the Braun Silk-epil X'elle in 2006 and still use it and love it. The first few times it hurt like crazy and I'd shout with each pass over my legs and arms. My neighbors must have thought I was crazy. Over time, however, the pain has lessened and the hair has grown back thinner and there is much less of it growing back. Consequently it now takes less time to epilate and it doesn't hurt half as much though it still gets stingy if there is a lot of growth to clean up. I have to do this about once a week to keep my legs smooth. As for ingrown hairs, I found that exfoliating in a hot shower prior to epilating then using a lotion (PFB Vanish is sold here at Amazon in a kit) made to prevent ingrown hairs afterwards reduces the bumps quite a bit. I've been using the Braun on my bikini area, arms and legs and absolutely will never return to the daily shaving routine! It's not painless, it's stingy for lack of a better description; hair does continue to grow and you will have to do this about once a week; and you will get some ingrown hairs, but even with all these things, it still beats the chore of shaving. The Braun does a great job.

  565. Alright, I surfed and read reviews both positive and negative before settling on this epilator. I based my purchase on the number of realistic reviews given. I have very thick body hair that likes to grow back fast. I also used to have an ingrown hair issue. Here's what I've found since my purchase:<br /><br />The noise: Yes, it's loud. It's about as loud as a pair of hair clippers. Believe me, you'll get over it. If you can't, I'm not certain what you're trying so hard to hide!<br /><br />The pain: Yes, the first time it is painful. What do you think it feels like when a machine pulls out your hairs but the root at a very fast speed? You're probably right - a LOT. But you will get used to it and find little tactics that work for you to make it bearable.<br /><br />The shave: If you can get beyond the noise and the pain, the shave is worth it. My hair doesn't grow back for over a week at a time, sometimes closer to two weeks before I see the bare beginnings of regrowth. That's saying something I think! Will it miss hairs? Occasionally. It's not that bad. I'd say shave the first time and do spot checks everyday for the next week. It will get it out, the hair just has to be poking out of the skin enough to grab. I hardly have any ingrown hairs and my skin is SMOOTH.<br /><br />The time it takes: Set aside 2 hours if you're feeling ambitious and want every last hair out. It does go somewhat slow, but after that first really long painful shave, it gets easier and takes less time because there's less to shave.<br /><br />If all this sounds like the positives outweigh the negatives, I strongly encourage you to try this product. Happy shopping!

  570. I owned an Epilady years ago and figured this couldn't possibly be as painful, but I was wrong; it really hurts. It is very painful, but it gets ALL the hair--even the ones the tweezers couldn't get. The package states 40 tweezer technology and I believe it. The only problem 2 problems I encountered are 1. you can only do a small area at a time, as there is too much pain involved otherwise; and 2. after doing my upper lip, there were some small bumps that went away after 3 days or so. Since I have very thick hair, I'm pretty sure this part of the issue. However, many of the other reviews state how painful it was for them too. If pain is of no consequence to you and you want to save money by skipping the waxing sessions, this is the way to go. But if you have a low or even medium pain threshold, do not buy this product because there is no way around the pain that I can figure out. Finally, the good news is if you use this product long enough and use it consistently, you'll eventually get a little used to the pain, but you can't skip too many days, otherwise you'll have to start all over. Good luck.

I thought I would be able to handle it since I had a child and seemed to manage that okay, but this thing really hurts and it's a totally different ballgame when you're inflicting the pain on yourself. I might have been able to handle it better if someone else were epilating me, but who would want to do that?! :) Also, it takes FOREVER to do. I thought it would save me time not shaving, but it takes an hour to do both legs. If I epilated once a week, it would still take longer than just shaving in the shower everyday. Overall, this product did not do what I thought it would, or even close to it. Major buyer's remorse here!

  578. I purchased this product in May 2009, as an alternative to waxing. I was using it every six weeks or so, and by the end of the year, my legs had turned into this monstrous web of hairs growing under a thin layer of skin. The ingrown hairs cause bumps, sometimes become infected and as a result, my legs are all scarred with dark spots everywhere. If I need to wear a skirt, I need to apply leg makeup even under pantyhose. I have olive skin with medium dark hairs, and I don't know if my type of skin has a tendency for ingrown hairs. If you are going to buy this product, test first... or you will risk paying $60 on the epilator plus $100 on creams and lotions, a couple thousand on permanent hair removal (which does not entirely solve the problem) and a few other hundred on skin treatments to minimize the scars.

Just wanted to share my story, and thank you Braun- for this truly is an amazing product.
  583. I use this product for facial and forearm hair, and I will NEVER go back to tweezers and creams. I have not used it for my upper lip yet. There is some minor pain with this, but it's probably about as minimal as you'll ever get, considering that the device works by plucking thousands of times a minute. But I've noticed that once I remove longer hairs from one area, the discomfort of removing the shorter regrowth is much less. And the results are definitely worth it. Regrowth is much slower than I ever had with tweezers and depilatory creams, and I don't miss any hairs -- which I often did with plucking, because I am farsighted; I had to use glasses and a magnifying mirror just to see the hairs. I often found plucked hair remaining just below the surface, so they looked like blackheads. The light is essential, at least if you wear glasses. It'll give you a nice clear view of the area you're working on. Get this device - it is a god-send for anyone plagued with excess hair.

  587. I purchased this epilator to replace a much older Braun model in which the gears had begun to slip. Considering the old one was nearly 15 years old, I would say that it held up quite well. But this baby! Wow, what a difference! It is so much more gentle than the older model was, and the LED light feature illuminates even the finest of hairs. If you've never used an epilator before, yes, they ALL sting a little the first few times you use them, but this one comes with special rollers and skin stimulaters to make the process much for comfortable than some of the other models out there. The shaver/trimmer attachment for the device is very nice, and does a wonderful job on the bikini line. I've been using this method of hair removal for over 15 years and I've seen many posts that complain about \\"stubble\\". The stubble is a by-product of hairs that break off, rather than get pulled out, while using the epilation process. For first time users, or if you haven't used the product for a long time, this is very common. First, the length of the hair is important. If it's too long, it will likely break off, especially if the machine only grabs the hair at the end. However, if you use the shaver/trimmer head first, to cut the hairs to optimal length, it will greatly reduce the amount of breakage that occurs. For the hairs that do break, simply allow a day or two for them to grow out a bit, and reuse the epilator to extract them.
  588. Can someone please tell me why the price has gone from $49.99 to $69.99 in just one month for this model??!! Have they added some special features or something?? when is the price coming down!!! Thank youuuuuuu
  589. Yes, this is the best epilator currently on the market. If you're here at Amazon, you've probably done your research. But if there was a magic bullet to remove all unwanted hair, then we would all be walking around smooth, sleek, bald goddesses. I could write the book on what the review \\"pros\\" and \\"cons\\" are, from the 1,000 plus reviews on Amazon, but here's the reality: The success of this epilator does not depend as much on your pain tolerance as it does on your natural individual hair shaft density and your skin type. The reality is that 40 fast-spinning tweezers running across your skin not only can hurt, but it can be unsuccessful. I am a frequent at-salon waxer, and also use a GiGi professional wax warmer and Brazilian hard wax on myself regularly. It is expensive and time consuming, and I am not at all afraid of pain, so I decided that if \\"it hurts\\" and \\"it seems to cut hairs off and leave stubble\\" were the two biggest complaints, my pain threshold (I laughed at reviews) and my skill would put me in the \\"it's a winner!\\" category. Turns out, I was on the opposite end of the spectrum. Not a winner. Despite changing techniques, following directions obsessively, and sparing no expense when it came to discomfort I felt, this simply doesn't work for my \\"genetics.\\" I have dark hair, but it is very fine. The tips of the tweezers are rather sharp, so when they grab my hair, they clip the tender hairs and are unable to rip it out at the roots. The result is the appearance of \\"no hair,\\" but it leaves my legs feeling stubbly. In some areas, where my hair is slightly thicker, the tweezers are able to grasp the hairs and remove them from the root, but it leaves tiny red pinpricks all up and down the area epilated. Tend Skin, and other post epilating/waxing products would sooth the sting, but could not reduce the appearance of marks. This is not a design flaw in the machine. This epilator has a bright light that highlights every last speck of even lightly colored hair. The grip is comfortable. The epilator has to be plugged into an outlet, but it is via a generous power cord that I found I adapted to easily. The product runs smoothly, functions well, and has a nice quality to it. I tested it on a few friends, my fiancé's arm, and a few volunteer male legs and chests. It works well on men because of the thickness of their hair (trimmed first). It worked well on friends with denser individual hairs than mine. It worked beautifully for some of them. So the truth is, just like the latest \\"Must HAVE Allure Magazine Beauty Product of the YEAR\\"...one size just doesn't fit all. Sometimes, today's \\"best\\" beauty product just is not your shade. Sometimes, the latest clothing trend just isn't the right cut for you. And sometimes, the best epilator on the market just won't leave you baby soft. This product will be your best friend, if: You have coarse or thick hair. You have firm, tone, well-exfoliated skin in all of the areas intending to be epilated. This will be your enemy, if: You have fine hair, or soft blonde hair. The hairs will be cut off, rather than epilated. You have areas of thin skin, loose skin, dry skin, or skin that needs vigorous exfoliation. (If you are prone to ingrown hairs, I am talking to you.) This product is likely to make you bleed and leave tiny red bloody spots. With that in mind, this is absolutely worth trying out. For those it works for, it's an utter miracle machine. And if it doesn't work for you? Well, at least you'll stop having that burning, tingling, \\"what if?\\" anymore. I'm keeping mine. Just in case.

  596. I've had my bikini area waxed three times this year. Can we just say, \\"OUCH!!!!!!!!!!!\\" I also had my arms waxed for the first time a few weeks ago, which was considerably less painful. I was highly considering plunging into waxing my legs once summer was over. I didn't want to go around all hairy in between waxing while I waited for my hair to be long enough to be waxed. I was waiting for \\"pants\\" weather. However, after talking with a friend who epilates, I decided to try it. <br /> <br />I spent much of today reading reviews on this site and others. I narrowed my search down to the Braun Silk-epil X'elle and the Epilady Discrette. The Epilady was rated #1 by Consumer Reports. This Silk-epil X'elle wasn't tested by them. The Braun they did test came in #3, but was since replaced by the EverSoft, which I don't even see on this site. <br /> <br />I pretty much read equally positive reviews on both epilators in consideration. I was 50/50 in my decision. It finally came down to the fact that I couldn't find a store nearby where I could go and buy the Epilady, yet I could drive to Bed, Bath & Beyond and use my 20% off coupon to buy the Braun. So, I did. <br /> <br />I can't wax my legs yet, since I just shaved them today, but I did try it on both my arms and bikini area. As for my arms, almost pain free. Little pricks here and there, but it was really quite a breeze. The bikini area ... NOT so pain free for sure, but SO much better than waxing! I'm sure it helps that I just had my bikini area waxed three times, so there was less hair to start with. With waxing, a large section comes off all at once with one big, \\"OUCH!\\" every time. With epilating, I can control how much is taken and just do a teeny bit at a time if I want. <br /> <br />I used the \\"beginner\\" SmartStart Head, which pulls out less at a time. It takes longer, but is easier to start with until you get used to it. I'm confident that if I can handle epilating my bikini area, I can certainly handle my legs. Iwould have had to wait another 3 weeks to get my bikini area waxed, by the way, because I'm suppoed to let all the hairs grow to a certain length to get optimum results. My waxing gal says 6 weeks. Yet, with epilating, I can do it whenever there are any hairs long enough, which is WAY sooner than 6 weeks so far. Also, it's free and I can do it in the privacy of my own home. Not sprawled out for a stranger to see my \\"privates\\"! <br /> <br />Another reviewer stated that she didn't like the SmartLight feature. I, for one, thought it was great. I have blonde hair, so having a light to show me wear all those little buggers are is wonderful. <br /> <br />If you've done any waxing and you know what that feels like, epilating is so much better. I can't comment on any other epilators, but this one seems to be a great one.

  604. I've been using this epilator for about 6 months as of this review. I have coarse, dark hair that I used to have to shave almost daily to feel presentable. I wanted an epilator to try to cut down on the maintenance time and, hopefully, improve the results, as well. <br /> <br />Overall, I'm very pleased with this epilator. It's no magic fix for coarse, dark hair, but then, nothing is. It hurt like anything the first few times I used it, but just like plucking your eyebrows, it stops hurting after a few times. What I like the best about epilating is the fact that it doesn't require daily maintenance to keep my legs feeling smooth. My hair grows quite fast, so the results don't last anywhere near 4 weeks. In fact, if I don't epilate for a few days, I will have quite a few stray hairs. Yet, I've found that I really don't notice. Despite stray hairs, my legs are still very smooth overall. The only major downside I've found with epilating is the amount of ingrown hairs that result, something I never had when shaving. Nonetheless, I won't go back to shaving, and that said, I've never even used the shaver head that you can switch off with the epilator head. <br /> <br />I researched a number of epilators before buying, and I chose this one because Braun seems to have a good reputation for reliability and this epilator has 40 tweezing disks as opposed to the 20 on most epilators. As I've never used the 20-disk epilators, I can't speak authoritatively for the difference in speed, but I figure it has to be faster. I've never had trouble with the length of the cord, the shape is easy to grip, and the Smartlight helps the task in a way you won't understand until you've used it. You don't receive the cooling glove, as the product description states, but I've personally never needed it.

  626. Most of the reviews on here seem to be written by people using an epilator for the first time - all \\"it hurts\\" and \\"it's noisy\\" so I thought I'd add a review from someone who's epilated for years and tried several different models. After 4 or so years my emjoi optima needed replacing, one of the heads simply stopped turning. It had served me well so I nearly just bought a replacement but decided I'd see what else was out there. It seems the Optima is still a top pick but the Braun range consistently got great reviews. The 5270 wasn't the highest rated overall but I know I don't need cooling mits, easy start kits, or a range of heads and at just under $50 I figured it was worth a try even if the light seemed an unnecessary gimmick. Initial impressions, nice size, fit well in the hand. The blade head arrives with a sort of guard with 2 rollers on it, apparently to kneed the skin and reduce pain. Don't waste your time, it just decreases the hair removed on each pass; swap it for the other guard. I really like this attachment, it makes it easy to keep the epilator at the perfect angle on your skin and it made light work of deforesting my legs (in the name of research I left them untouched once my optima failed). This brings me to the light. It annoyed me there's no way to switch it off but I quickly found out it's actually very useful, especially when there's serious hair to remove, it really highlighted what was left on each pass, without the need to stop and run my hands over my legs to check. Overall I got a better result than with my old optima and in less time which surprised me. I did my underarms too and found it easier to maneuver than the optima although a little more painful but I think that's down to having shaved for the last few weeks. It's also no noisier than other epilators and the power cord is a decent length. Comes apart easily for cleaning and as the guard comes off getting the blades clean is simple. In fact the only downside of this is that there's no cover for the head. I'd have preferred that to the bag that was included. Overall a highly recommended buy, I just need to see how it stands up over time.
  627. I have never used an epilator but I always will now. Love it. I rarely have to think about hair removal anymore. What a relief. It hurt the first time but after a few times the pain is no big deal.
  628. Being a beauty therapist I'm quite adept at body hair removal, albeit a painful episode, until now. The Braun 5720 is realatively painless, quick and very easy to use. It's idiots work. The rollers in front of and behind the automatic tweezers seem to act as a \\"pain barrier\\" resulting in hair free legs for up to 6 weeks. Occasionally you will get a \\"rogue\\" hair popping up here and there but because hairs are yanked out from their roots, the new growth is soft and hardly noticeable at all - instead of the blunt stub that shaving creates. Without a doubt worth the money.
  629. When I bought this product I was looking for something that would remove hair from my legs and underarms but unfortunately it has only worked on my legs. I have to go over the area several times for it to remove all the hairs. This machine is quite noisy and it would be better if it were cordless,

I was able to do all of both my legs with only a little pain! Of course it didn't feel GOOD but once I got used to the tingling feeling it wasn't too bad. And then came the armpits.....It was very painful. But I was very motivated! I found that stretching my arm as high as I could helped. I also found that using a mirror was easier than looking directly at my armpit. And now that I battled through it, I have perfectly smooth armpits! There is some redness but I'm told it will be gone tomorrow. I am definetely glad I bought this product. It worked awesome and didn't pinch my skin once. Even as a first timer! The power cord is plenty long, the light works fine, it's easy to operate and it did exactly what I got it for....to take all the hair away.
  631. I have to say, after being a slave to shaving and waxing - this is fabulous! No, you won't get EVERY single hair off, but you know what - it's pretty doggone smooth. Initially it'll be a little uncomfortable but I use it every 2 days and have welcomed the little 'stings' as it means that the hair is being plucked. Make sure you take your time (do it while watching tv) and go slow so it's more effective. No more waxing or shaving for me!!!! Worth every dime!! p.s. I've got coarse thick hair.
  632. Purchased it this afternoon, took it home & was SO excited to use it! I have been growing out my underarm hair for weeks-just waiting for this day to come. I read the instructions (keep at 90 degree angle) and plugged it in. The first thing I felt was a tiny pinch, the hair being pulled out obviously. Then, everything after that was the most horrendous pain I have ever felt! I have given BIRTH, had over four tattoo's, waxed, shaved, threaded-you name it! THIS, by far, was the WORST pain I have ever felt! I tried it in every darn direction and it SNAGGED my skin and ripped it to shreds! Both of my underarms are red and tender from where the skin got torn off and it's been 8 hours already (it's 11 pm and I did it at 3 pm). Other bad things: Noisy as hell, the two settings, Soft and Something Faster should have been labeled Super Fast and Something even Super Faster! The Soft setting was so fast I was AFRAID to put it to my armpit! It's like this scary weedwhacker! The massaging rollers did nothing at all. I am giving it TWO stars because it DID get 95% of my hair out by the roots (all over the place), the color is cute...and thats about it. I can see how this would pay for itself after one or two sessions-but imo, the pain was NOT worth it! I am going to stick with sugar waxing & shaving thank you.
  633. I purchased this product a week ago in hopes that I would be able to stop shaving, and be able to go longer periods in between hair removal. Both of my roommates epilate, so I figured I would try it again (it has been years). I spent a good 3 hours of tooth-grinding pain removing my body hair. I did my legs, arms, underarms, and most of my bikini zone. This was a week ago, and my forearms still are covered in bumps.... It looks like I have chickenpox or something similar. I have not gotten any ingrowns (yet), but a few of the bumps on my arms pimpled up. It took multiple passes to remove most of the hair, which I then had to go at with tweezers. The bikini zone was torture, so I switched it up a bit and went to my underarms. At first it wasn't too bad, then it started to REALLY hurt. I have a VERY high tolerance for pain, but this was really excruciating... So, I took a few aspirin and waited about 30 minutes. It didn't seem to help at all and a large portion of the hair under my arms was still there, but the pain was too great. I decided to put the epilator away for the next day. The rest of that day, my underarms were a deep, vivid red color and I couldn't put on a shirt. I tried deodorant. Big mistake - it BURNED! When I woke up the next morning, my underarms were still red along with some scabbing. This continued for 3 days. I spoke with a friend about it that owns a spa, and she begged me to return the epilator, even though I was planning on actually giving it another try - because all the reviews say it gets easier. I have thin, light hair (being a blonde), and thought about it a while - and determined that I never had a hair problem, so the torture really isn't worth not having to shave. I would say stick to shaving, waxing, Nair-ing, or laser removal - epilating is just not for me :/

  637. I hadn't heard about anyone using an epilator since the old torture springs of the old 1980's epilady until I met a woman from South America who told me epilators were very common there. Since I am always looking for better methods of hair removal, I researched and read all of the reviews for different epilators and decided on the Braun 5270. I've had the epilator for about a month now and I love it. It's easy to use, there's minimal mess, and the results last a lot longer than shaving and just as long as waxing. The light and the other attachments are useful too! I usually use it in front of the t.v. in the evening after a bath, then I follow with a moisturizer. The poor reviews this product has received due the lack of pain tolerance is unfortunate. I've been waxing at home for a while so the pain was not an issue for me. Actually, the more I used the machine the less painful it was. I will say that if you are prone to ingrown hairs from shaving or waxing then you should definitely exfoliate regularly in addition to using a product like \\"No Bump\\" which can be purchased at Sally's Beauty Supply. I highly recommend this product to anyone who doesn't like the mess of home waxing or the price of salon waxing. For those who don't wax regularly the pain will probably be a bit much to get used to at first.

It cools it down, is an antiseptic, and helps the pain.<br /><br />*TIP*<br />touch it lightly at first on the armpits and rotate in between your armpits to give yourself a break and using witch hazel and dry it off before going back.<br /><br />*TIP*<br />Put your hand way up on a door frame or wall to help hold your arm back to pull the skin tighter in your arm pits.<br /><br />Legs were no problem at all. Barely felt it. LOVED it!<br /><br />*TIP*<br />use it right after you dry off from your shower; you hair is more flexible and won't break off as easily, plus your pores are more open and the hair comes out easier.<br /><br />I liked the light a LOT, as my hair is pretty fine and difficult to see under room light. I didn't even need the vibrating head; I used the head that gets closer.<br /><br />I wish it was cordless/rechargable, but I'm in the bathroom anyways near an outlet. The cord is long enough.   643. Okay, I have lots to say and I will try to be organized about it. I had never heard of an epilator before. I was looking for a new electric razor and came upon them in my search. I ordered an Emjoi and when it came it did not work. I started researching after that and found many reviews that said Emjoi works well WHEN it works...so I moved on to Braun. First let me say that Amazon has the fastest shipping and terrific customer service. Now on to the epilator. First of all, the pain. I am not a wimp...had my first baby naturally...on pitocin. This process HURTS. The first time I wasn't sure if I was going to be able to get through it. But, I did one leg one day and the other the next. My hair is course, medium darkness, but I have a lot of it. I think I should have shaved and gotten the hairs and different periods of regrowth. Although I used the trimmer, I was yanking a lot of hair all at once. The worst areas were my ankles, inner thighs and behind the knees. I found that my bikini did not hurt as much as other areas-perhaps because the hair is more sparse there. Now, the second and third time I used the epilator the pain was decreased one hundered fold. BUT...IT STILL HURTS-it is just more bearable. This last time was even better....perhaps as the hair changes it will continue to get better. Now...the results. VERY smooth the first time, but not very smooth since. However, the regrowth is so fine, that although I am not completely smooth, I ahve found I can last 7-9 days without a touch-up and it doesn't bother my husband or me. I used to have horrrible stubble the morning after shaving. I have used the electric razor part to smooth some problem areas out and it works better than any I have ever used. The trimmer is also very nice. I am too afraid to try my underarms. Side effects: I got a terrible red rash that clears after 24 hours. That has also been getting better with each use. But...don't expect to put on shorts right after epilating. I got some ingrown hairs, but I got those along with horrible razor burn after shaving also. TIPS: Exfoliate before and EVERY day in the shower. Pull your skin tight in the opposite direction that you are epilating...it eases the pain. The roller head is a good idea for 1st timers, but if you can stand it, use the \\"experienced\\" head on high speed-the pain is reduced and it is much more efficient. I gave the product 4 stars because you don't get completly smooth for \\"weeks.\\" Epilation is not for everyone. It is very labor intensive (my first time took me 2 plus hours) and it is painful. But, I find that compared to shaving every other day and my razor burn and stubble from that I really like it. The more I do it, the less I want to go back to shaving. I first used this around Feb. 20th and it is March 19th and I have not used a razor on my legs since. The product itself is great...the attachments are nice and it works as described.
  644. I stumbled upon this epilator doing a search for hair removal, read all the reviews and hesitantly purchased. Until I found this the only epilators I had any experience with was back in the 80's when I was a kid and a cousin and I experimented with my aunts coiled torture device-needless to say I swore never to epilate again. Fast forward twenty-five years and thousands of disposable razors and nicks later and I have saw the light. I used it for two weeks before I reviewed it to give an accurate description. It does hurt like #@*! the first time you use it but as most other reviewers have said it lessens each time. I did get a rash after the first time and for some reason it was worse on my arms and the worst bumps lasted a couple of days. The second time I epilated the rash was minimal and went away overnight. It lessens the sting if you just use the massaging rollers first and pull your skin tight when epilating. I use a good moisturizer afterwards. I have course hair on my legs and have always had to shave every day, but I have been able to wait 5 days before doing a touch up and alot of the hairs I get then are ones I missed before. The light is great and very helful especially on the backs of my legs. I have not used it on my underarms or bikini area yet-trying to build my courage. I'll never use a razor on my legs again.

  650. This is my first epilator ever. I was anticipating alot of pain at first and this it did hold true to that! It feels like an electric shock, but it isn't that bad after a few times. I started shaving with a razor and did a once over every day until the hairs started growing in. It did get better after just a couple of days of just doing spots at a time when the hair did come in longer. I've had this for 3 weeks now and I don't hesitate to grab it and do maintenance. The downside is most of the time it doesn't fully grab the hair and pull it completely out so I'm not getting that super smooth feeling that it claims. It like cuts it shorter, but doesn't fully pull every hair out. I have some very short stubble all the time. It's like when you just shave and you get a shiver and the stubble appears almost instantly. It feels like that all the time. I do need to keep practicing so maybe once I master the technique it will improve. ALSO, YOU HAVE TO EXFOLIATE, EXFOLIATE, EXFOLIATE! Exfoliate every day especially before using. Dead skin cells accumulate every day and when a hair is pulled from the root it has to have a clean follicle to grow through or it will create an INGROWN HAIR! I had a a million all over and am just now fixing this problem. Other than the super smooth feeling that this epilator implies, I love it. I hope it lasts a long time for me because I've only had to use a razor to do underarms and bikini line. It's been very liberating!

Then the Braun epilator works great to maintain and is not very painful either. For the money I think it is well worth it if it holds up to time. Then again with the cost of a wax job, for maintenance it is great. Plus there is the advantage that it will grab hairs much shorter than needed to do a good wax job, so you can stay smoother more of the time.   655. With over 300 5-star ratings, I doubt there is more I can say about how great this product is. Instead I have two tips for users or potential users.<br />If you have skin that gets red & blotchy after tweezing or epilating, get a bottle of Benadryl itch stop gel, apply to the skin, wait 5 minutes, wipe off and then epilate with blotch-free (or at least reduced) skin!<br />If you are a person absolutely terrified of the pain, get a bottle of skin numbing gel. I don't adhere to one brand, just anything that ends with -caine. Just test a small area first to make sure you aren't allergic to the product first.<br />Cheers!

I came across the reviews left for this product and I figured this product was something for me to try. I got it yesterday and I was so excited to try it! The pain was minimal considering this device yanks hair from the root. I was expecting much more discomfort and pain. I did not experience ANY, no lie! My tolerance for pain is a bit higher than most people I would guess. I do give myself bikini waxes on a regular basis, so maybe that has something to do with it. I did follow the advice of doing it right after a shower, that could have helped. After I was done, I applied some lotion (non-perfumed) and my skin felt great! Now my legs will be hair free for weeks rather than days! This product works so well and I believe it is worth every penny!!
  658. I've been usign Braun products for years and fairly happy with all of them. This Braun Epilator is no exception. Before this, I've tried cordless Epilators from various brands, and found none of them worked quite well. I don't have a lot of body hair, but the few there are have grown coarse through years of shavings. The corded Braun Epilator is the first one that works on my hair. Compared to all the cordless epilators I've owned, this Braun is powerful and intimidating at first. It is also much more painful than all my wimpy cordless because it actually pulls a lot of hairs out with one swipe. I thought about having a glass of wine while using the Braun, but didn't because I was not supposed to operate heavy machinary while drinking. Luckily, it is almost painfree after the first round because the new growth are much finer. Despite its intimidating power, it is actually quite easy to manuver around curves as long as one is careful. Some features I thought not necessary, such as the lighting, turn out all very handy and practical. It's finally time I can throw away all my other cordless epilators and shavers. Braun is the way to go.

  666. This was my first experience with an epilator so I experienced a mix of fear and excitement when it arrived at my doorstep. I expected pain, but I figured the excellent rating on this item meant it was either tolerable or worth it. Now that I've used it for exactly 1 week, I've found there is also a big mental component as I kept closing my eyes and tensing in expectation of the pain, too. This is what I did: I shaved and then used the epilator every night (on the low setting) as the hair was growing back. I tried both head attachments and prefer the massaging rollers hands down (the \\"advanced\\" attachment felt like it was scraping my legs because I couldn't get the angle exactly right). Yes, it was painful and certain areas are worse, but having baby smooth legs, arms, and underarms make it worth it. The bikini area is still a \\"high anxiety\\" area for me because it is the most painful to do but I think it will get easier with time or until I master my fear. Doing my underarms weren't too bad and arms were actually a piece of cake. My goal now is to gradually increase the days between use. Would I recommended this product? Yes. Does it work? Absolutely. Is it loud? Yes. I also wish it was cordless but it's not a big deal. Best of luck to you!
  667. There's just two things you need to know: 1) it really works and 2) it is painful. Pain of course is a relative thing - some handle it better than others, and some handle different types of pain differently. I can't stand tooth pain and hate going to the dentist, but had no problem getting a tattoo. This is more like the tattoo for me. Also, since I previously had my legs \\"sugared\\" (like waxing) for cycling, I am probably more desensitized to this than someone who has only shaved their legs. So if you can take the pain, then get one. I could buy two of these a month for what I paid for sugaring. That alone makes it worth it. I like the way it operates and (as others have noted) the light is a brilliant add-on. If mine breaks, I will definitely get another!
  668. I am hairy, I take after my dad. My razors go dull after two shaves. I'm finally retiring the razor! True, it hurts, but only for a bit, because the skin goes somewhat numb as you work. Initially it reminds me of the time I was gardening and thought I was standing in a pricker bush (thistle). It was a bees nest I stomped through and they were stinging me. But if you aren't being stung then you know you have a bad investment. Also - by the time you think you want to stop the hair is gone and you can. That's how the upper lip felt. However, unless you have no nose I doubt this unit would satisfy you for an upper lip job since it's too big for that for most people. I highly recommend, as soon as I got it I did my legs, pits, and I bought a small one by enjoi for my upper lip, also recommended. After treatment it feels like I shaved. Inspection of the hair reveals that some was cut, others pulled, no pulps were present, unfortunately. But this thing does the job fast, although it works better to take it slow and steady, and I am happy. Also - this unit is made in Germany, not china :) If you are already tweezing, if your hair grows so fast that you get shadow after two hours, then this may be for you!
  669. I love this Braun epilator! It is my 2nd epilator (the first one was the Emjoi AP-9L Epi Slim which I didn't love). I have been using this product for about 5 months now and I would love to share with you my experience with this great epilator! It comes with 3 detachable heads: 1) Shaver head with OptiTrim attachment (I totally forgot that it came with a shaver head until I started writing this review. It don't think many people use it but I guess it's not a bad thing to have around. I have never used it myself). 2) Active massaging rollers - \\"massaging rollers stimulate the skin with micro-impulses before and after epilation\\" (I only used it the first time because it says that it'll \\"massage\\" your skin. But I think that it just gets in the way of faster removal of hair) 3) EfficiencyPro clip - \\"provides a thorough epilation that is now even faster. It ensures maximum skin contact at the optimum usage position thus enabling more effective hair removal\\". (This is not a clipper as I had initially thought when I was doing my research...it's just a head thing you put on the epilator and this is the only thing I am using with this epilator.) I have used it on my leg, underarms, bikini, and upper lips. I'm going to go over each body part separately because the hair is so different for me (thickness and how fast it grows). My Legs - I probably need to shave my legs a 2-3 times a week. My leg hair is kind of thin and sparse to begin with but I do have black hair so it is noticeable (at least to me) when I don't shave for more than a week. My first time using the epilator - I let my leg hair grow out for a little over a week (maybe like 10 days). I took a warm shower as some other reviewers suggested. My gosh, the first time was very painful but tolerable that I was able to finish both my legs. It did take me about 40 minutes the first time because it was pretty painful so I couldn't go as fast. I was very, very happy with the results. My legs weresuper smooth and I didn't have to worry about hair removal for at least a week. A week later I tried again and I was shocked to see that it hurt a lot less...I couldn't believe that I had already gotten used to the pain, plus it took half the time (20 minutes) to get all the hair out. By this time I had discovered that EfficiencyPro clip head was much more efficient than the rolling massaging head. My hair was even thinner than before. After about 4 months of using this, I had gotten a bit lazier with my leg hair. It still takes me at least 15 minutes to do both legs. I think the reason is that my leg hair is so light that I can't see them and I have to look at my legs closely to make sure I get every little hair. Because it does take me 15-20 minutes (which is a long time if you have a busy schedule like me), I have recently started shaving my legs again because it takes me less than a minute to shave. My underarms - This area is a whole other story!!! The hair on my underarm is totally different from my leg hair. When I was shaving, I had to shave every single day. I have dark, coarse underarm hair (and I have a lot of it). 12 hours after shaving, I usually have a 5 o'clock shadow. Sometimes I would pluck my underarm hair and I always loved the results but it just took forever to do. When I discovered this epilator, it was a dream come true! Because I was so used to plucking my underarm hair, it didn't hurt at all to use the epilator on this area! It takes about a couple runs over the same area to remove the hair. It takes about a minute or two to do both underarms. This is how I used it: First time, I let my underarm hair grow out for two days (it wasn't a pretty sight!). I used the epilator and as I've mentioned already, it was not painful at all. The next day when I took a shower, I accidently grabbed my shaver as a reflex (I've been shaving my underarm for like 15 years every single day)...then I realized that i didn't have to shave anymore!!! On the third day, I noticed that some of the underarm hair had started to sprout already. By the fourth day, I had to use the epilator again. And that has been my pattern for the last 5 months...every 3-4 days I will use the epilator for my underarm. I have not shaved my underarms since I got this epilator. I'm loving the freedom of not shaving every day! Using this epilator hasn't made my underarm hair any thinner like it did with my leg hair. My Bikini area - I wax (myself) in this area. I have thick, coarse, dark hair in this area so shaving is not an option (unless I want to shave everyday...which I don't want to do). I thought that it was pretty painful the first time I used the epilator even though I'm used to waxing my bikini area. I have not gotten the nerve to do a complete Brazilian bikini hair removal with this epilator (I'm not that brave...yet). I have to say that this does a good job in removing the hair...but I do end up with more ingrown hair than with waxing (which other reviewers have commented about). I guess with waxing, it removes the the dead outer layer of the skin so it does exfoliate the skin but with epilating, it just removes the hair so you have to remember to do extra exfoliating before and after using your epilator. I use Tend Skin to help prevent and treat ingrowns and I have to use it more frequently when using the epilator. I think I prefer waxing over epilating but in this case, epilating takes less time so I tend to epilate my bikini area. Unlike my legs, it is still relatively painful (not as painful as the first time) but I guess my skin is more sensitive in this area. I use the epilator maybe twice a month on my bikini area. I'm not so overly concerned about being hairless in this area. Upper lips - I used to wax once a week. My upper lip hair is relatively thin and sparse but I do have black hair. Epilation with Braun has completely replaced waxing. I tried [[ASIN:B0000DK5LW Emjoi AP-9L Epi Slim Cosmetic Hair Remover]] but it could not get the tiny, thin hair out. With this Braun epilator, it removes the tiniest hair, even the ones that are barely sprouting out of the skin. It takes about a minute or two to remove everything. I use the epilator once a week on this area and that's all I need. I don't get ingrowns (never have) on my upper lips. As you can see, overall I have had a positive experience with this epilator and I totally recommend this to anyone! One annoying thing about this is that the cord gets tangled very easily...but that's not super important. Maybe the next time I get an epilator, I might get the cordless ones but for now, I'm happy with this Braun epilator!
  670. I've had this epilator for 7 months now. It's been a wonderful thing for me, but not without its issues. So here is my synopsis. For reference, I'm a dark haired person with sensitive fair skin who has both been waxed by pros and done it herself for the last 10-15 years... It's a great little gadget that will keep you hairless and smooth - for me, I have to do a 'touch up' approx 1x per week during bare leg season. But my hair grows fast and coarse. I can get away with a longer timeframe during the winter months since my hubbie never seems to notice if my legs are smooth and silky or if I'm a sasquach. ;-) #1. Does it hurt? Of course it does. You're yanking out hairs by the root. It's probably a bit worse than waxing because you have to go over the same area a few times to catch all the hairs. But if you can stand waxing, you can grit your teeth and stand this. Or take an aspirin/advil/tylenol first to help a bit. #2 Does it scar? NO. In my opinion, it will definitely cause ingrown hairs, but no actual scarring. If you have an ingrown hair that becomes deeply embedded without being removed, it may leave a dark spot on the surface skin. What has worked well for me is the following: - Exfoliate both with a scrub wash regularly and use a chemical exfoliator (such as KP duty) once a week or so. - Follow the product instructions and make sure to use rubbing alcohol to clean the exfoliator parts every time you use it. - If you need to remove an ingrown hair, use good tweezers which are dipped in rubbing alcohol first. What else. I like the light. Yes, it is noisy, but the motor works well so far, which is more important to me than quietness. Does it break the hairs? Yes, I'd say it breaks some hair rather than removing it, but not overly so. Overall it functions as advertised. It takes about an hour for me to do both legs and bikini area properly each go. A professional waxing is probably less painful and more effective/less ingrowns - so if that route is affordable to you, I'd say go for that. But for someone who gets 5 o'clock shadow on her legs after shaving in the morning, and can't standing paying $80+tip for waxing every couple of weeks, this is really a great product. It'll pay for itself the first time you use it!! What do you have to lose? Try it!!!
  671. I am pleasantly surprised that following my first use of the Braun 5270 epilator, that very few hairs have returned to my chin area. My skin is smooth and very soft with no stubble after many days. In the past I used a battery operated model, however I find that this electric model far excels my old one. I would recommend it to anyone that has facial hair to remove.
  672. At only $50, more women ought to give this great little epilator a try! I'm sure it's not right for everyone, but only a few weeks in it's hard to imagine ever going back. I read a LOT of reviews here and elsewhere before buying this, my first epilator. Everything pointed to this being the best value. I'm very happy with my purchase so far. Ouch factor dropped off pretty quickly. Be sure to hold the skin taught if you notice it pulling - it makes a huge difference. I'd read the best way to get started was to shave as usual, then use the epilator every day for a week, then every other day for 2 weeks, then less and less. I'm in week 3 right now. Do NOT \\"grow out\\" and then start. The more hairs you have to pull in each pass, the more it will hurt! I found my legs were much less painful than the reviews I read made it sound. A few weeks into \\"the schedule\\" I barely feel it - plucking my eyebrows is definitely worse. But my leg hair has never been thick. The included trimmer/shaver work pretty well, though I find the device's shape rather awkward and bulky for use in that mode. I guess the idea is to be \\"all-in-one\\" and offer you alternatives for any areas you chicken out of epilating. Personally, I was most interested in getting this for my underarms and I'm extremely happy with the result. That area always grew a lot faster, darker, and thicker than my legs, and tended to get very irritated by shaving. By the time the razor burn went away, the ugly prickles would be back! First day after shaving, epilator could only find a couple strays at the edge to yank out. The second day was, I admit, painful enough to make my eyes water. But the results were fantastic. I've continued \\"on schedule\\" to minimize pain but could easily be going more days in between already. Going in, I was hoping I could work my way down to a once per week grooming regimen, but I'm confident at this point I'll get to the 2-4 weeks between sessions people talk about. I'm working on the bikini area very, very slowly. It is much more painful than legs or underarms (not surprising - waxing there is a lot more painful, too). I think I may have to get waxed and restart \\"the schedule\\" down there. That should get me past the worst of it (pulling the firmly rooted existing hairs) all in one go so I can skip straight to the maintenance phase. Fewer hairs with younger roots will be a lot more manageable. If I successfully keep this up, I may buy one of the cordless, water-proof versions next year (for easier cleaning and travel). But I'm glad I got this first. When I'm down to using it every other week or so the minor inconveniences of the cord and the alcohol/brush cleaning procedure may not be worth upgrading to avoid.
  673. No regrets with this product. I have been using now for 2 months. I did get the little red bumps after first usage and it was not comfortable but now I use weekly with no bumps, no pain, no problems. Would buy this product again in a heartbeat.

It hurts a little less if you use that Smooth Away product that supposedly removes hair (it doesn't remove much, but I think it gets rid of those tiny, invisible hairs that still hurt like crazy to yank out at the root). If I could feel no pain, i would love it. It is so quick and easy to use every day. Although I always think it's going to pinch my skin, it never has. If you're brave, or have very fine hair, it's great. Otherwise, it just collects dust b/c you're too scared to use it!

  678. I had an old Braun Silk epil (Comfort) that I used for over 10 years before it finally died. I'm glad it did because this one is much better in several ways. First, the light does help you see the hairs -- one of my complaints with the old one was that in my bathroom lighting, I would miss hairs, have to come out to a better lit area, then go back and re-do. Second, it gets all the hairs in fewer passes. I thought maybe because mine was so old, it was not as precise anymore, but it looks like this one had more tweezers, so I think that is a factor. Third, the rolling head attachment makes this practically painless. Even though I have been epilating for years and usually would keep up with it (if you wait too long in between, there are more hairs to epilate at a given time, and therefore more pain), it still would hurt a little on occasion when I did my bikini area. Also, I think this creates less irritation since you go over the area less, so fewer in-grown hairs. Finally, as for epilating in general, I have found some areas where the hair has not regrown (certain parts of my bikini line and some of my leg hair) because of years of epilating. I would never go back to shaving because of the superior results -- no stubble. Even when some of the hairs grow back, you can run your hand up your leg and will still feel smoothness. I did not need to use the starter head, but if it's less painful than the regular, I would say there is no better way for a beginner to check it out.
