  686. I'm truly impressed with the 5270 epilator! I have gone back and forth between shaving and waxing for 14 years. Other than a little bit of touch up for fine short hairs on my knee area, I think I can retire my razor. The biggest pros are that it gets all of the thicker, lower leg hairs and exfoliates your skin at the same time. If it's not pulling out hair (in an area you've already done), it feels like a little massage. In other words, it doesn't pinch or scrap your skin raw. If you can handle waxing (in terms of pain) then you can certainly use this epilator. I don't feel much pain from waxing anymore on my legs and bikini area. I don't feel any pain with the 5270 there either. Just little tiny plucking feelings. Because it's pulling so many hairs at once, it causes nerve confusion and less plucking pain vs using a tweezer. My armpits are still really sensitive to waxing (just started doing that 2 years ago), but I get ingrown hairs and pimples there when I shave. After showering, I stretched my underarm as taut as I could to get a firmer surface, and was done with both arms in 2 minutes. It hurt a bit, I won't lie. No blood though (which I sometimes get with wax). After a couple hours, my under arms were back to regular skin tone and only let me know they'd been through a rough time when I touched them with my fingers. I would recommend this to anyone who wants a superb alternative to waxing!!!

  688. After I bought this product through Amazon, I was so nervous I would hate it. I finally tried it last night and was thrilled with the results. I'm impressed by the fact that it really doesn't hurt! It's more like a surprise zinging sensation. I concur with the other reviewers that mentioned this isn't done quickly. I spent at least an hour going over my legs (and bikini area) in every single direction possible to make sure I got each and every hair. But that was my first time, and I suspect it'll only get easier from there. I've got very fair and sensitive skin so I'm glad I did it an night because i did develop very distinguished red dots all over my legs but I rubbed them down with lotion and went to bed and this morning they'd vanished. And honestly, if I can easily 'tweeze' all of my leg hairs in one hour, small red dots(that go away!) aren't even an issue. I'm amazed at how user friendly this is. This doesn't even compare to waxing--it can be done quicker, with less pain, in the privacy of your own home, and by YOU. The cord is nice and long, and the 'smartlight' is helpful, as are the attachment that shaves your hair to the correct length for epilating. As for ingrown hairs, anytime you rip your hair out by the roots, you're going to run the chance of an ingrown hair. This has nothing to do with the product, but with the act of tweezing out hairs and that hairs way of regrowth. I know from shaving and hand tweezing that I'm prone to them so I plan on epilating after warm showers and scrubbing everything down pretty often to reduce them. This is my first epilator since that godawful Epilady coil thingie (which stung so much I could NOT use it)so I don't know how it compares to others...say the Epilady Legend for example but I do know that the Silk Epil is a very exciting find. I'm super impressed.

I had to shave my legs every day and I still would always feel little stubbles here and there....this leaves my legs so much smoother. It works wonders and I look forward to the upcoming summer months! Definitely a must have.

  699. I bought this because I was so tired of shaving every two to three days with the time and razor burn and could not afford to get waxed. I also like to keep my nether regions clean so was excited about the shaver attachment. The first few times I used the epilator it hurt like sin. I found that pulling the skin taught made it more bearable but, lets face it, it hurts and be prepared. BUT, stick with it and it will hurt less once your hair becomes thinner with each grow back. I use the shaver attachment for my nether regions and my armpits. I really like it and it does get pretty close. I get horrible razor burn if I use a razor in those areas so this was a great alternative for me. My only recommendation if you choose to try it, be aware of the little teeth that help grab the hair might catch your skin if you go too fast, go slow and you should be fine. I have been using my epilator on my legs for 4 months and I LOVE IT. I only have to do it every couple weeks to one month depending on what I am wearing/the weather. I usually do it right before I shower and just watch TV or something while I do it. It takes me about 30 minutes now that I have done it for a while but I do remember it taking longer at first. I never tried it on my bikini area, women who do use it there are BRAVE and I commend them. Hope this review helps. Cheers.
  700. I only recently tried using an epilator for the first time. I borrowed a friend's emjoi while on vacation and I liked it. I decided to get my own and purchased this instead because it had a lot more reviews than the emjoi epilators with a good average rating. I was disappointed in this. It doesn't do as good of a job removing the hair. It seems to have some trouble removing some hairs and also cuts them instead of pulling from the root. Also, corded is more of a burden than I thought it would be. The epilator is harder to clean. With the emjoi, all I had to do was knock the head on the sink a couple times and it would be completely clean. I didn't want to return someone's epilator with my hairs stuck on it! The Braun on the other hand is a pain to clean even when I use the cleaning brush it's still never clean. The hairs get trapped in the \\"tweezers\\" and you'd have to pull hair out of each slot one by one to get it totally clean... Not only that, but this somehow pulled at my skin when I did my armpits and I ended up getting blisters! I'm returning this one and getting the Emjoi. I should have stuck with what worked for me but I thought this would be better. The only thing that makes this Braun better than Emjoi is that Braun is made in Germany and Emjoi is made in China.

So, I was expecting the worst, but the pain was actually more of a discomfort. It helps to pull your skin tight, and also to make sure the hair on your legs is standing up by rubbing it the wrong way. The 2-week duration of the epilation is overestimated - I found that I need to use it once a week or so. However, the write-up said that when the hair grows back, it is finer and lighter, and that is true. So far, I have only used it on my legs, even though the literature says that it's safe on bikini area and armpits.

I couldn't stand seeing/feeling stubble everywhere and feeling like I could never keep up with it. I found waxing to be a bit embarassing and never removed all the hairs, leaving me completely smooth. I was beginning to give up and just admit I would be hairy forever. In comes the Xelle. After reading others' reviews here on Amazon, I purchased it for myself. I tore into the box and plugged it in immediately, eager to see what it could do. I was NOT disappointed!! I find that this epilator is pretty quick, and removes 98% of the hair (some are too short to be pulled up by the tweezers). I probably couldn't be happier with my purchase. A fair warning is that this IS painful. I think I have a high pain tolerance, and doing this on my bikini line had me gasping for breath...not in a good way. It is extremely painful in sensitive areas, but I've found that by doing just a tiny bit at a time, you can get through it. I have not been able to do my underarms yet, but I am going to try numbing them a bit with ice first. Either way, this is the best $ I've spent in a long time!!

  714. I purchased this item about 4 months ago. This was by far a very wise investment. So, I am a latina female of 32 years of age who has thick black hair all over. I was waxing all over before this purchase. Pain: minimal, as I was waxing before so this helped with the pain level. Use: I use on upper and lower legs and armpits. I found that the arms hurt more than I was comfortable with. Complaints: Some women complain of the \\"stubily\\" feel and not getting a smooth feel like you get after shaving. The secret to getting the smooth feel, which I have now, is not going fast when epillating. I notice I was rushing through my legs and was snapping the hairs instead of pulling them out. I now go slow and make sure the hair is plucked. I have extremely smooth legs, no stubble, my husband LOVES, and I only use this machine once a month. As I see hairs pop out here and there I just remove with the epillator. My hair barely grows back now. I don't have an issue with ingrown hairs as I vigorously exfoliate before and after use of epilator. I don't use this for the bikini areas as I wax once a month anyway. I haven't used a shaver in almost a year (I was waxing everything previous to this). The armpits I epilate once a month and I used to have a hell of a bush when I would shave and a shadow....gross. Now I have smooth baby soft pits (I was waxing them before but this is easy and faster). ENJOY!!!!

  716. I decided I was really tired of shaving every other day, and the regrowth of shaving is always sharp and spikey! And I didnt want to spend tons of money waxing everything at a wax salon every single month. But I still wanted to be as smooth and hairless as possible, so I did a little research and deceided to buy the Braun 5270 X'elle Body System Epilator. I have used this item for a little over a month now. It is the first epilator I have ever used or owned. Here are my thoughts,<br /><br />The Good:<br />This epilator was not nearly as loud as some reviews lead me to expect. I like the helpful light on it and the choice of speeds and the soothing roller buffer head or the close, I-Know-What-Im-Doing head. It comes with a shaver head as well. I like the clear instructions and little cleaning brush and storage pouch it comes with. At first I was really afraid it would suck in my skin and pinch me, but as long as I pulled my skin taunt, I had no such problems. It worked VERY WELL for my arms and underarms. Although the underarms was EXTREMELY painful the first time, I was prepared for the pain as I have had this area waxed in the past. I have been shaving there the last 2 or 3 years consistantly, so had some strong, thick hair there. After the first traumatic time of epilating the underarms, I have almost no pain and very sparce hair regrowth which I epilate simply every few days now. No problem and I enjoy having smooth, clean underarms everday. looks even better then when I shaved because there is no \\"5 o'clock shadow\\" to deal with! I have no ingrowns under my arms, but I think maybe its because I am diligent about exfoliating with a rough washcloth every time I shower. SO that first super painful time was so worth it for me. You could get it waxed the first time and just maintain with the epilator if you wanted to forgo that first time torture.<br />The Bad:<br />I used this on my legs and face and even attempted to do the bikini area with it. I was way to scared to do the bikini area. Having this whirlwind of spinning ninja tweezer action so close to such a sensitive area was just too scary for me. The face peach fuzz was surprisingly painful to epilate! But it did remove most of the blonde fuzz on my checks and upper lip. The legs did not work so well for some reason, even with multiple passes it just didnt pull out all the leg hairs.<br />The Ugly:<br />My face broke out HORRIBLY 2 days after I epilated! I will never do that again! I will either live with the peach fuzz or use the electric razor to trim it down, but not remove the hairs entirely. The break out was REALLY, REALLY bad and just not worth it! I still have some scars from the blemishes which are slowly fading. The pro waxer I saw said it was possibly because our skin oil uses the hairshaft as a vehicle to get out onto the skins surface, so maybe with out face hairs the oil couldnt get out and made me have an awesomely ugy breakout? I dont know, but Im kinda bummed because I usually do break out with any face wax as well, and was hoping the epilator would solve this problem, but it did not.<br />My legs also became comletely COVERED in ugly bumps and ingrown hairs about 2-3 days after I epilated them. I have since exfoliated the bumps and ingowns away and resumed shaving the legs, which isn't too bad since I have only peach fuzz on my thighs and really only need to shave from the knees down.<br />Final verdict:<br />This powerful and inexpensive product seems well made and was worth it for me even if I can only really use it on my arms and underarms. I like the razor function for trimming down the blonde hairs on my arms and bikini. But the epliator function is way too painful and epilating makes me break out terribly.scared to do the bikini area. Having this whirlwind of spinning ninja tweezer action so close to such a sensitive area was just too scary for me. The face peach fuzz was surprisingly painful to epilate! But it did remove most of the blonde fuzz on my checks and upper lip. The legs did not work so well for some reason, even with multiple passes it just didnt pull out all the leg hairs.<br />The Ugly:<br />My face broke out HORRIBLY 2 days after I epilated! I will never do that again! I will either live with the peach fuzz or use the electric razor to trim it down, but not remove the hairs entirely. The break out was REALLY, REALLY bad and just not worth it! I still have some scars from the blemishes which are slowly fading. The pro waxer I saw said it was possibly because our skin oil uses the hairshaft as a vehicle to get out onto the skins surface, so maybe with out face hairs the oil couldnt get out and made me have an awesomely ugy breakout? I dont know, but Im kinda bummed because I usually do break out with any face wax as well, and was hoping the epilator would solve this problem, but it did not.<br />My legs also became comletely COVERED in ugly bumps and ingrown hairs about 2-3 days after I epilated them. I have since exfoliated the bumps and ingowns away and resumed shaving the legs, which isn't too bad since I have only peach fuzz on my thighs and really only need to shave from the knees down.<br />Final verdict:<br />This powerful and inexpensive product seems well made and was worth it for me even if I can only really use it on my arms and underarms.   719. I am a female of ethnic descent and, consequently, have very coarse body hair. I've tried waxing but was not pleased with the results - or the expense. I looked into laser removal but that is expensive as well and I was concerned about its overall effectiveness. I finally got tired of shaving twice a day just to keep up and started scouring the internet for ideas. That is how I came upon this epilator! I tried it for the first a few days after receiving it and heeded some advice but not others. For starters, I hadn't shaved in a couple of weeks and decided not to \\"prep-shave\\" before epilating. What I did do though is take an aleve, take a hot shower, and exfoliate the areas to be epilated (to help prevent in-grown hairs). I then situated myself on a heated blanket to keep my legs warm and pores open and started the process. Yes it hurts but, for me, it wasn't anything close to intolerable. It felt like little pinches - just like tweezing your eyebrows. If an area I was working on happened to get a little tender I would pull the epilator away for a moment and then go right back. I worked in small strokes on the lowest setting, staying in one area until all of the hair had been removed, and I had no problems! It took me a fair amount of time to complete both legs but there was a considerable amount of growth; I think it is fair to say that it will take less time if kept up with regularly. The next area I tried were my underarms - also not pre-shaved. This stung more than the legs and required more frequent breaks but was also not intolerable. After epilating I re-exfoliated all treated areas just to be safe. (I exfoliate using a sugar scrap and real loofah.) It's been a few days since my first epilation and I couldn't be happier! My legs have been smooth all of this time and it should be a breeze the next time I epilate due to the minimal regrowth. The best part is that I don't have that \\"shadow\\" effect on my underarms anymore. My skin color is lighter thereso you could actually see my black hair growing underneath the skin - unsightly with nothing I could do about it, until now. :) Can't remember the last time I looked forward to wearing shorts - hurry up summer! This product is highly recommended by me but please be sure to take precautions to prevent in-grown hairs.

  726. I have been a regular waxer for years and I used to epilate, but found that most did not work well or would pinch my skin. This epilator is the cream of the crop! It is well-designed, comfortable bean shape that fits nicely in the palm of your hand. It allows for good grip and control, especially with the components on the inside rumbling around. <br /> <br />I used this on my forearms, upper thighs, lower legs and even....underarms. The epilator worked well for all areas and the massaging rollers really do help ease/numb any discomfort you may have. I braced myself for the pain, and was surprised to find little to none at all (keep in mind I'm a regular waxer). The sound of the epilator is a little overwhelming, as it is quite loud. <br /> <br />The optional shaver head is great on it's own and even better with the trim attachment---does the job quickly and easily. I like the fact that if I don't have the option of epilating (hair is too short), the shaver works just great. <br /> <br />The smartlight, I have to say, I LOVE IT. It has got to be the best feature on this epilator. Without it, I would have just gone over the regular areas that I always wax. However, this light picked up every single hair in every nook and cranny on my body. I mean, I discovered hair in places I never knew I had hair----inside the bend of my elbow, on my hands, the crook behind my knee. <br /> <br />The only complaint I have is with the short cord. The cord could be longer, as I had to plug it into an extension cord for it reach properly, and it would be nice to have a swivel on the cord. Other than that, I love this product and would recommend it to others.

  730. This does work very well. It rips out the hairs at the roots without pinching skin. However, this hurts a lot. I wondered why more women don't use epilators, and the reason is because it feels like needles poking through your skin. It hurts less after a minute or so, and hurts much less your second, third, etc. times. But it does hurt a lot--more than waxing because it's slower, but it's not messy like waxing and you can do it at home any time, and it's cheaper than waxing. (I wouldn't plan on using it on bikini areas or armpits unless you have nerves of steel.) As for this particular epilator, it is sturdy, made in Germany, comes with different attachment heads, and comes with a shaver head and a trimmer attachment. And everything fits conveniently in a little storage case. The light it has on it really does help you to spot every rogue hair. I can't think of anything it could/should have to make it a better package.

It is pretty effective, although sometimes it does take a few strokes to get all the hairs. I found that the massage head really does not help the pain and is not worth using in my opinion. The light is very helpful in seeing the ingrown hairs which is one drawback to this. Since I have been using this, I have noticed a lot of hairs that have grown under the skin's surface. While it is bothersome, I have tried using the epilator after I have exfoliated to loosen these hairs, but it doesn't really work. But overall it is just annoysome and I manage to get these out. The pain on the underarms is very very intense. It does dissipate after using it for a minute, but it is pretty painful. I haven't been brave enough to try the bikini area. The only real complaint that I have is that some hairs do not get pulled out by the root and it seems to be losing some of its power the longer I have it. (BTW I only use it about 1-2 times a month). We will see how it holds up. But it is worth it for me to not have to shave everyday.
  735. It felt a little prickly the first few times I used it. It did reduce the overall amount of hair and became easier to use over time. However, I started noticing I got ingrown hairs. I tried exfoliating, but i continued to get them. If you are typically prone to them, you might reconsider. I can also say that I never was able to use it under my arms with much success.
  736. This is a good epilator. I owned one of different brand but this seems to be much better. It has different speeds and different heads and this helps to minimize unpleasant feelings as well as to extend period of time when you shouldn't be worried about hairs. I am satisfied.
  737. it saves me a lot of time and really easy to use. highly recommend it!
  738. What can I say other that this product has changed my life. It has eliminated the daily routine of shaving. Let alone all the other things I have tried for hair removal. At first is HURTS..... ALOT... Be prepared. But at time passes so does the pain. If you can bear through the pain it will pay off in the end. I have tried waxing and my skin would be irritated and have red bumps. Not what I want after paying so much for the waxing. Then I have tried the creme hair removers and it removed the hair alright and the first layer of skin. So this product is really AMAZING. I only have to use it once a week and thats is only about 10 min. of time invested. My adivce for first timers is use powder before you start the treatment. Then for sensitive areas I apply ice for a few mins. after completing treatment. And REMEMBER take a break... If the pain gets to bad take a break. I do my epilating while watching TV and time passes faster when you are distracted from the pain. I mean face it we are Pulling Hair From the Root. It is going to hurt. But as time passes the hair get thinner and grows in slower. Overall A GREAT PRODUCT. I have tried others and this IS THE TOPS. I highly reccomend this product. Become friends with it. You to will Love It.
  739. First of all, I am a guy so I wanted to give my opinion. I play tennis and arm hair seems to make me sweat more, so I wanted something to take it off. After reading the reviews here, I broke down and bought this thing when it went on sale. I was expecting it to be a walk in the park, and I have to say after using it, I have a new found appreciation for the pain tolerance women obviously have. I am a big guy and this thing had me writhing on the first try....yikes! I cant imagine what the more painful models rated on here must feel like...cause this one felt like someone sticking me with needles...I was actually sweating from the pain! I also had some definite redness and irritation on my arms the following day although to be fair to Braun, they tell you in the manual to do it at night so your skin can recover before going out the next day. I will say that it works pretty well...not as easy as they say it does, but after several runs across my skin it does get all the hair out...but certainly not in one pass. My subsequent visits with this needle machine have gotten less painful (as they suggested it would). I would give this thing a 3.5 if it were available, but I rounded up to a 4. It hurts the first couple of times, but the pain gets less with more uses and it does what it is suppose to.
  740. The purpose of this product is to make you as smooth as possible. It does that, 100%. If you are concerned about the pain, don't buy an epilator because I don't see how any epilator on the market would not hurt. Definitely don't buy it if you have never been waxed, because using an epilator is basically like the slowest ever waxing you've ever had. It is pretty brutal, but it is much more cost effective than spending $100 or more a month, and for the money I have to say that this product is amazing. So if you can handle the pain, this epilator is the bomb. Buy it.
  741. I just loved it........... no pain as compared to the messy waxing thing. Best purchase i ever made....
  742. This product is plesaant to look at and comes in an attractive silver mesh carrying case. The weight is perfect and it fits comfortably in the hand. It has two speed settings and a few attachment pieces. All the different attachments seem intimidating at first, but it's easy to get their usages down after the first session. This epilator does make a bit of noise when you switch it on, which in itself can be intimidating and scary. Once on, it's pretty easy to use, though the instructions are very long-winded: just hold against skin at a 90 degree angle and move slowly along. The second you place the device on your hairy skin, you are shocked by the pain. It may be quite painful, even if you've waxed before as I have. Despite the excruciating pain, it does work very well. One swipe of the epilator is usually enough for legs. I used several swipes in different directions to remove my underarm hair. The epilator pulls out the stubborn hairs that waxing would miss. It also doesn't remove a top-layer of skin, as waxing does, which is a plus for those with sensitive skin who are prone to hyperpigmentation. Like waxing, it doesn't always pull hairs from the root; sometimes the hairs just break off instead. Epilating stubble seems to help with this problem and also with the pain. It's been too painful to epilate my entire leg at one time, so I've been gradually epilating more and more of each leg one hairy patch at a time (I used to do the same thing when I waxed my legs). I am definitely going to stick with it--regardless of the pain. I highly recommend for women who are willing to endure a bit of pain for hairlessness and hair density reduction.
  743. I bought the Braun 5270 Epilator about six weeks ago and I'm just getting used to it. I only use it on my legs and bikini line as my under arm area is too sensitive. It hurt A LOT when I first started using it but it's true that the hairs do grow finer with continued use. I can now epilate without gritting my teeth;-) It takes longer than I thought though, as I find that it doesn't get all the hairs the first time and I have to go over the same area a few times until they are all pulled out. I really like the bright light that it's fitted with as I would certainly miss many hairs without it. I do have some advice though for anyone, who like me, is new to the whole epilation experience. I made the mistake of buying some waxing strips and using them a couple of times before I bought the Braun Epilator. What I have noticed is that because I didn't remove all the hairs on my legs with the wax strips I now have hairs growing at different rates. This means that I am using the epilator about every two weeks, which is still much better than shaving every three days. If you are going to buy this (or any) epilator then I suggest you wait until all your hairs are at the same length and remove them all at the same time. Overall I think the Braun 5270 is a good device and Amazon has one of the best prices I have found. I am also using Nisim Kalo Lotion in the hope that some day I'll be totally hair free. Until that day, I'm happy to epilate with my Braun.
  744. This epilator is great. It works really well, resulting in very smoooth legs. I really like the light, it is definiately a feature I would look for in future epilators. Overall, just a good purchase.
  745. I read quite a few reviews before I bought this product. I'd never waxed or used an epilator before so I was nervous. I followed one reviewer's advice and shaved before my first use-which was a great idea. It let me ease into the whole idea of epilating over the course of a week. When I first turned it on I'll admit that I almost took the whole thing back due to the loud noise it made. Like most others, I'd advise skipping the attachment for beginners-it is more frustrating than helpful. Using this product was no more painful than using a disposable razor 1-2 days past when it should have been thrown out-just a little scratchy feeling. This is my third week using it and I am now starting to experience the ingrown hairs phenomenon which is annoying, but expected. A little exfoliation is not much of a price to pay to skip shaving! I like the light on it as my bathroom lighting is not as good as I thought. I protest the company's claim that one swipe gets 90% of hairs. I'd put that percentage closer to 70. Overall, though, I am very happy with how well it works.

  748. HURTS!! I thought I had a high pain tolerance, but the pain of using this on my legs is unbearable. For what it is, it's an excellent epilator, but be aware that it's much more painful than tweezing eyebrows or waxing. It's like ripping a huge bandage off very, very slowly, and leaves the legs not very smooth due to fine hairs breaking off just above the surface of the skin. It may work better on thicker hair that doesn't break off as easily. It works well enough under the arms, where the hair is thicker and the surface area is small enough to be done with before I lose the ability to inflict any more pain on myself. So I'm still happy with the purchase, because I don't need to worry about shaving my armpits anymore. Give it a try! This is an excellent model.
  749. Yes I am a MAN who for the past several years, off and on, have been shaving my entire body below the neck. I would only keep my legs shaved every week, and 3 or 4 times a year I would get it all, unless I was on vacation somewhere, then it was 3 or 4 times a week. I have never tried waxing, so this YANKING the hair out by the root was a new experience for me. And can be a painful one, the first few times. Well when my Braun 5270 Silk-épil arrived last month, I noticed several attachment heads. One was the shaving head that was suppose to cut the hairs to the \\"Ideal Length\\" for epilation. That does work on some areas, but for most areas there is no \\"Ideal Length\\". I had read in another review, the user suggested shaving the area you plan to epilate, and latter that day or the next day, start epilating. Some areas work just fine using the shaver head to get started; the legs, arms for me the pubic area was one of the less painful areas to start with. But keep in mind trying to epilate anywhere the hairs are full length, it will HURT, and hurt BAD. There were a few areas that even using the shaver head, or the old fashion razor blade caused me to break out in a cold sweat the first time I took the epilator to them. The area between the pubic hair and the navel was not that bad, but I did know the epilator was there. When I did the area between the navel and the nipple line, it did curl my toes a few times. But one of the worse areas was above the nipples to the neck line. I had to do that area in SMALL sections, with plenty of breaks over several days. But the area that I'm still trying to get completely done is my under arms. Those two small areas are being more painful than the entire rest of my body. I will do as much as I can stand, and then take the razor to the rest. I'll start again the next day and get as much as I can as the hairs are starting to grow out again. One day I will have it all done. Keep in mind that the first time is always the worse, no matter what part of your body you are trying to do. But it will soon seem like there are on hairs to pluck. When you shave the area with a razor and then start using the epilator a few days latter, you will not pluck all the hairs at the same time. It seems to me that the hairs grow back at a different rate, so on the first time you may be getting only 10 to 20 percent. The next day another 10 to 20% and so forth. You will also have a certain percentage of breakage, the hair does not pull out, but it breaks off level with the skin. Those can hurt worst than the ones that do pull out, and they will look much thicker than the ones that did pull out as they continue to grow. Like I said I've had mine for about a month now, and I still go over at some part everyday. At this point I'm about 99% smooth, there are still a few strays that I find every few days, but for the most part I have not been this smooth I was born. Also less and less hairs seem to be growing back. Yes if I had it to do over again, I would buy either this model, Braun 5270, or the next one up. ***UPDATE*** Two nights ago I convinced my wife to let me start using it on her legs. She is very pain sensitive, so I used the shaver attachment on both of her legs first. I then started using the Epilator attachment and started pulling the hairs that the attachment could grab. She didn't mind it at all, but keep in mind I did a pretty through job with the shaver head. Tonight I could feel a little more stubble from the shaving, so I went over both of her legs again. She felt far less pain tonight than she did last night. Apparently I missed quite a few hairs around her ankles. We are going to keep up this nightly ritual until we can tell all the hairs have been plucked. Once she gets use to it being used on her legs, I'll try to convince her to let me do her arms, underarms, bikini line and anywhere else she has been shaving at. I hope to have her as smooth as I am by next summer. For myself, I spend an hour or two once a week to stay smooth all over. At first she hated the smooth look on me, but now she likes it.

NO WAY could this be used on my bikini zone, but the trimmer works great for that, trimming it down really close, which is good enough for me. I also used a sugar scrub to exfoliate and get rid of all the ingrown hairs it produced. I have to say, it was too much effort for very little pay-off. I had to use the machine every week, and the finer hairs still grew back in between usages. I went back to shaving, much less time and completely pain free. I think I will still use the trimmer in the summer for my bikini zone because it leaves no razor burn, but I won't use the epilator part again. I gave a 3 star review because I think it would work better for people with darker, courser hair, and the pain lessens with each use.

  757. The Braun 5270 Epilator is a hands-down, fantastic product. Nothing like the eiplators from the 80's (remember those, they could make a grown woman cry). This epilator actually WORKS. It's a nice size, fits well in the palm and is easy to control, even in the most awkward of places. Easy to clean and store. Long cord makes it pretty easy to use just about anywhere and the little blue \\"headlight\\" is terrific for spotting hairs. Legs: Legs are sooo smooth. It even gets the little fair fine hairs on the knees and thighs. Shaving could never leave your legs this smooth and soft, and waxing requires you to grow hair back before you can be smooth again. Smoothness lasted for five days after the first use, and after two months of use now lasts up to two weeks. Took very little time and pain was a 2 out of 10 (1 being a splinter and 10 being amutation without anesthesia!). Kind of like rubbing your skin with sandpaper. Very little redness or irritation, and what was there was gone in an hour. Seriously, never had legs so smooth, even with waxing. Bikini area: Unbelieveable! No more painful than waxing (3 out of 10 the first time, minimal after that) and you can customize your grooming. Wouldn't recommend it for maintaining anything as radical as a Brazilian, but you can certainly groom anywhere from a basic trim to nearly bare. Redness and irritation for a few hours, use a good antisceptic finish and a bump preventer if you're prone. And the result is again, so completely smooth! Underarm: Never shave again! Again, no more painful than waxing, and like waxing, the more frequently you do it, the less there is to do. Pain the first time is probably a 4 out of 10. No stubble, minimal redness and irritation. I've waxed the above areas for many years, and this product does a better job. You can touch up whenever you please, and there is no waiting for complete regrowth before grooming. Regrowth lessens within just weeks with consistent use. Super convenient and paid for itself in one use (versus the cost of waxing). Wish I had stumbled on this even sooner!

  763. Another review here put it best: \\"If you want results badly\\" you will love this product. I've only been using this for a week now, but I believe a lot of the people who have given up on using an epilator simply have never had to deal with the awful difficulties some of us do with shaving. Starting out with this is time and pain intensive, but for people who want long-lasting relief from the futility and demoralizing effects of shaving, this is an unbelievable invention. I have very dark, coarse, fast-growing hair, paired with very sensitive skin. With shaving, I got ingrown hairs along with painful razor burn all over my thighs and bikini line when i shaved. On top of that, I'd have visible regrowth by the end of the day. Yet, I wouldn't be able to shave again for at least 48 hours because my skin was still so damaged. In the summer, I could only wear shorter skirts or shorts once a week, and even then I would usually have to put foundation on the areas that broke out. I say this in the past tense, because I am so thrilled to have found a method of hair removal that will free me from constant worry over having to cover my legs! As I said, I've only recently begun epilating, so I can't compare this model to others or talk about longterm results, but for me what's already happened is amazing. I did it initially four days ago on my legs and bikini line, and it was painful and tedious, but also gratifying to see all that thick dark hair be done away with. I've done waxing before, so I understand how hair grows in cycles and that there will be some irritation that will resolve quickly, so I was not put off by the red bumps or the fact that there was stubble. The second time I did it, two days later (my hair grows very fast, so the next cycle comes in quickly), it was still rather painful and, but much better and took much less time. I then waited another two days (today), and it was fast and totally bearable to touch up. I think I've gotten at least 75% of my growth by now (I see what I haven't gotten yet because my hair is so dark, I can see it before it grows above the skin), and hopefully after another four days and two more attempts will have had a chance to nab them all. Because of my waxing experience, I have high hopes that when the hairs grow in again, they will be much less dark and coarse. Some ingrown hairs (I got those shaving and waxing anyway) and soft, invisible stubble seem like blessings, knowing that I won't be constantly hairy and having to mangle my skin with that razor anymore if I ever want to show it! Maybe people who don't have thick hair growing quickly on them all the time aren't thrilled by the idea of being able to look at your own legs everyday without having to cringe, because they already can, but to me, it is a wonderful, novel experience. I don't have the money to wax, and I really like not having to wait for a full cycle to grow in before getting it taken care of! This product is just what I've been looking for all my life!!

  804. There are several very well-written reviews about this product already, so I'll just mention a few thoughts I feel are salient, particularly for first-timers or people who are new to the vast world of epilators. BENEFITS: I've been using an epilator on-and-off for years. This time I've been \\"on\\" for about 4 months, and I can't see ever going back to shaving. Reasons: 2) The fur-free look and feel last way longer than they do with shaving, since the hair grows back both sparser and finer. 2) Uses no water. I'm in an area suffering from exceptional drought right now; it would be irresponsible of me to stand in a shower for 5 minutes shaving. 3) No more having to buy razors and shaving cream full of chemicals. 4) No cuts. 5) No paying $$ for waxing. PAIN: I realize this is a huge issue for many people, and rightly so. I'll give it to you straight: You're ripping hair out of your body by the root. There's no way it's going to be painless the first time. I did the hot bath, the deep breathing, etc., but it was two generous glasses of red wine and sheer tenacity that got me through that first epilating experience. (The next day I had a gnarly headache, but my legs looked great.) All I can say is buck it up, take frequent short breaks, and IT WILL BE BETTER the next time. This goes for legs, arms, and underarms. Remember to exfoliate every day to prevent ingrown hair. WHY THIS ONE?: You may have noticed there are eleventy zillion epilators out there. I bought this one and I like it because it has two different heads for epilation on different parts of the body. The little light on it is outstanding as well. Finally, my old epilator is a Braun; I've had it for over 10 years, and it still works. I don't argue with that kind of quality. I also recommend a nice cabernet sauvignon. Best of luck to you!

  809. Like many others, I decided to purchase this item based on the overwhelming amount of positive reviews. Let's just say, even with all the hype, I was not disappointed in the least bit. I regularly waxed for years - legs and arms to be exact. It is sticky, messy, expensive, takes a ton of time, doesn't get all the little hairs, and often removes a thin layer of skin leading to redness and discomfort. Shaving never worked for me either. I always had razor burn that would last a day or so - right as the stubble came in. I tried my cousin's epilator recently for the first time. To be honest, I didn't even know such a thing existed. I immediately purchased one myself.<br /><br />The Braun Silk-epil looks great with it's glittery blue exterior. It is very comfortable to hold and fits very nicely in the hand. It comes with several attachments - all of which seem useful. I am particularly excited about the \\"beginners\\" attachment with the rollers. It really lessens the pain and, in my experience, doesn't elongate the time it takes to epilate. As for the pain, it depends on where you are epilating. Some areas are painful, some are not at all. I keep reading that the pain goes away after a few times - that would be nice - although I would keep using it even if it didn't. Another great feature on this epilator is the Smartlight - it really helps you see all the little hairs and get them all. Another great thing about epilating is that the mess is at a minimum and you can do it wherever you like. I like sit in front of the T.V. on a towel. I just air the towel out in the bathtub when I am done.<br /><br />The best thing about the Braun epilator is that I can \\"touch up\\" whenever I want. With waxing, you have to wait until your hairs grow out or the wax won't catch them. This leaves a long time \\"in between\\" where the hairs are too long for shorts and not long enough for removal. The Braun epilator grabs even the shortest of hairs! To me, it means having smooth legs whenever I want, quickly, and without the mess!! I can't say enough good things about this product. I only wish I would have found it earlier!!!and without the mess!! I can't say enough good things about this product. I only wish I would have found it earlier!!!

  814. Bought this for the wife. No more shaving for her, she said it is the best thing a woman can buy for her legs. She loves it.
  815. UPDATE, May 17: I LOVE THIS THING! It's SO much better than my older model Braun epilator! The process is MUCH less painful (even in the most SENSITIVE of areas), and with double the tweezer heads of my old Braun epilator, it truly IS faster and MUCH more efficient to use this one! The light feature is GREAT, too, and very helpful for ensuring that you get every little hair that you're trying to remove! I think I'm in love!<br />; )<br /><br />A few extra notes and suggestions: if you have issues with ingrown hairs, try exfoliating every day or every other day to help the hair shaft make it past the epidermis. I had initial trouble with ingrown hairs, but have found that exfoliating scrubs, like sugar scrubs and similar products, really help make a difference. In order to keep the progressively softer hairs from getting trapped below the skin's surface, you have to help things along by scrubbing the area that you're epilating with an exfoliant.<br /><br />Additionally, Braun epilators DO remove the entire hair shaft, as opposed to just cutting at the skin's surface layer, like razors do. Since your hair follicles are constantly producing new hairs, the hairs that resurface WILL be straight at the end, as if they were cut, but epilators as a rule pluck the hairs out to the root, which is why your skin stays soft and smooth for more than just a day. Give these things a try - they're SO worth the time and effort!<br />~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~<br /><br />I've had an older model Braun Silk Epil Eversoft for easily five years. I'd seen it the last time I was in France (they had them in every Geant store we visited), and wanted one desperately. Got back home to the U.S., picked one up, and have loved it ever since. I use my epilator on almost every surface that visible hair grows on, except my eyebrows and my scalp. If I can reach it, and I can see dark hair there, I epilate it. The upper lip area is very sensitive, but the bikini area is the MOST sensitive, as you might imagine (I have no problem using mine on my underarms, though). Pull the skin that you're epilating taut, go full speed ahead, and you'll be done in no time!<br /><br />If you've got no experience with epilators outside of the antiquated Epilady of the 80s, Braun's epilators are SO much better! One caveat, though, if you don't mind my suggesting one: once you've acclimated to using this, and you experience less pain using an epilator on your body than you did when you first started (especially in the oh-so-sensitive bikini area), for the love of all that's Holy, don't stop using it! If you wait too long (like I obviously had), you'll be right back to square one with the level of pain you experience when epilating (IF you're like me, and I wouldn't expect my experience to vary from anyone else's). Epilators are GREAT tools for removal of unsightly hair, but if you stop using them, from my experience, the hair returns to its pre-epilation thickness, and your skin returns to pre-epilation sensitivity levels. It DOES get less painful over the course of the months after you begin using these; just make sure you stick with it!<br /><br />When you consider that the purchase of one of these is going to be, on average, less than the cost of ONE bikini waxing session at the salon, is there really any question? You take care of YOU in the privacy of your own home, and the effects are just as pleasant! Yes, it'll hurt, but it's SO worth it when you're done! Go for it!ive, as you might imagine (I have no problem using mine on my underarms, though). Pull the skin that you're epilating taut, go full speed ahead, and you'll be done in no time! If you've got no experience with epilators outside of the antiquated Epilady of the 80s, Braun's epilators are SO much better! One caveat, though, if you don't mind my suggesting one: once you've acclimated to using this, and you experience less pain using an epilator on your body than you did when you first started (especially in the oh-so-sensitive bikini area), for the love of all that's Holy, don't stop using it! If you wait too long (like I obviously had), you'll be right back to square one with the level of pain you experience when epilating (IF you're like me, and I wouldn't expect my experience to vary from anyone else's). Epilators are GREAT tools for removal of unsightly hair, but if you stop using them, from my experience, the hair returns to its pre-epilation thickness, and your skin returns to pre-epilation sensitivity levels. It DOES get less painful over the course of the months after you begin using these; just make sure you stick with it! When you consider that the purchase of one of these is going to be, on average, less than the cost of ONE bikini waxing session at the salon, is there really any question? You take care of YOU in the privacy of your own home, and the effects are just as pleasant! Yes, it'll hurt, but it's SO worth it when you're done! Go for it!

  821. Let me just say first, that if this didn't hurt at all, nobody would be using razors to achieve a smooth leg. Yes, the first time I used it, it did hurt some, but it was nothing I couldn't bear at all. I have never waxed my legs before either, and find waxing very painful, so that gives you an idea of my tolerance. However, the second time I used it, it was much less painful, literally more than 50% less painful than the first time. I will say one thing, use this at least a DAY BEFORE you want to have smooth legs, because it left me with little pink dots all over my legs. Those were also not as bad second time around. Anyway, down to the other aspects: The device overall - The design is great and fits in my hand very comfortably. I wish it could be charged so I could use it as a cordless device, but I don't mind plugging it in and sitting on the floor for a little bit. I also really like the light on it, which from the pictures looked useless, but really help you see all the hairs. I also like the little bag you can store everything in, it makes it easy to cary around. The Attachments - I definitely recommend the epilator head with the massaging things for the first time around. It helps distract from the pain a little bit, and also helps pick up little hairs wanting to stay on your leg. The second Epilator Head without the rolling massage things worked great the second time around and was good for getting it done faster. The Shaver works well too, it made my legs pretty smooth and I used it on my under arms as well. I haven't used the trimmer attachment so I can't vouch for that. The effects of this device were overall great. Yes, it did miss some hairs the first time I did it, but it didn't matter because some hairs grow in at different times, so I did have to epilate like a week after my first go. But even if there are a couple little strays hanging around, they are the finer hairs and your legs still appear very smooth. I will definitely keep on using this product knowing now how much the pain reduces the more you use it. It does hurt significantly more behind the knee, and other sensitive areas, but that will get better over time. If you are looking for a good option other than shaving to keep your legs looking great and getting rid of other unwanted hair, I definitely recommend this. It does not seem like a crappy little electronic that is going to die out anytime soon, and I'm excited to keep using it and see the results! Very Happy with this purchase!

But the pain was tolerable, knowing that with frequent use the hair will grow less and will last longer than shaving. The light on the product is a good thing to help see the hairs. Its a little noisy but I guess that can be expected. While I can tolerate the pain, I still decided to save the other leg for tomorrow night. SO in total it will probably take me 4 days to have hair free legs. One for right lower leg, one for left lower leg, one for right upper leg, and one for left upper leg. Then in a few days I will have to do it all again as hair grows in different stages. But it seems like a good product and will last. Only issue is my leg right now has a bunch of little red bumps on it that will probably go away overnight (at least thats what other reviewers say) My advice from my experience and other reviews if you've never done this before: 1. wait until evening 2. take some Ibprofen for the pain and swelling(the red bumps after the hairs are plucked) 3. take a hot shower or bath 4. epilate immediately after shower/bath 5. apply an after shave gel or creme to prevent ingrown hairs (I used bikini zone medicated after-shave gel and it helped with the pain and bumps right away) follow up advice: epliate in stages if you can't stand the pain make sure to exfoliate to prevent ingrown hairs moisturize hope this helps you out!

[[ASIN:B000EZYKTS Braun 5270 Silk-&eacute;pil X'elle Body System Epilator]]<br /><br />I am so excited to have such an excellent hair removing product after all these years of obviously having picked the wrong brand.   830. I've had my X'elle for 3 months now. I purchased mine for $58.99 on amazon when it was the deal of the day.<br /><br />The epilator is sturdy and the light is a definite plus. The bag is very cute and compact which is great for travel. I'm thinking that pushing it down connects the light to some sort of circuit under neath the part. Not a big deal.<br /><br />40 spinning tweezers at even the low setting looks shockingly fast. The epilator head design is very unique and trustworthy. 3 months of use and it still hasn't pinched my skin with the tweezers. Not even on my elbow or knees.<br /><br />If you're a regular shaver like me, than brace yourself for the pain. I was only able to get through with one leg the first time and it must have taken a good 10min with the breaks i gave my poor leg. Rest assure that it is very painful only the first few times. Once you make it a habit to epilate once a week or at the sign of hair growth, then the pain is bearable or nonexistent.<br /><br />The messaging rollers don't help much but it's better to have that attachment on then with the regular attachment on the epilator.<br /><br />The clear trimming attachment for the shaver is very useful to get the hairs down to the right size before epilating. It helps to reduce the pain caused from tugging the hair. Also it helps the tweezers get a closer grip when the hair is short.<br /><br />I've only used it on my legs, arms, and upper lip so far. Not able to muster up the courage to epilate under arms or bikini area, but that's what the shaver head is for :-)<br /><br />Do not epilate before making a public appearance. Your skin may seem fine, but the redness will kick in after a few min. I don't understand why pain is an issue. I would definately not recommend consuming pain killers etc, it is insane, come on!! after all we have waxed or threaded before and the pain does not kill you does it?? I do agree that initially it hurts, but it is the same plucking sensation from threading and as you epilate on skin patch by patch, even this pain becomes negligible. I would recommend chatting with your friend or watching tv or listening to music while epilating to distract yourself from the pain. The process is super fast and I took 15 min to epilate both arms, fingers to shoulders. The smart light is very effective and the massaging rollers also indeed reduce pain. However after your epilate you will notice small bumps on the skin so you must wash the area with cold water, dab it dry and then massage some soothing lotion over it.Skin feels like silk. I would recommend first-timers to use the slow speed setting and enjoy the experience without worrying about the pain. Afterall I am sure we women are capable of withstanding worse pains :) I have epilated before this, roughly 9 years ago I used my aunt's Braun. That one was very painful and slow so you could feel the hairs being plucked one by one, however I can assure you that Braun has advanced a lot over the last decade because this epilator is so much less painful compared to the old one. I try it on the bikini line gradually patch by patch. Shaving for me has been a bad experience, scraping of skin, burningand tingling sensation etc, which is unhealthy and can cause the skin to get septic(infections). Thanks to this braun! Relax and don't worry about the pain- the results are simply wonderful!

Unfortunately I can't compare it to other brands or models, but I am very happy to have this as my first epilator. STAR RATINGS: Each product is carefully reviewed in an unbiased manner. Star ratings are earned. 1 Star: There may be something wrong in the product details or description, it does not live up to what it is advertised as or made extremely low quality. I would tell my friends, acquaintances, and strangers that they shouldn't use their hard earned money on this product. 2 Star: This is not a great product at all. It has mistakes in the product details or description and does not live up to what it advertises or normal customer expectations. It is still now worth the money. 3 Star: This is a neutral rating. It met the product description and details for the most part but isn't something I am ever likely to order again. It could have some really cool features, An awesome looking design, Or maybe it’s just a killer deal. But overall the price of the product is not worth it. 4 Star: I like this product. This item has met all expectations, The design is sound, The build is great and the product does what it was made for. It’s a great product that i can recommend buying. However it didn’t wow me. It does what it is supposed to do. 5 stars: Wow! This item is amazing, it is an exceptional product. Not only does it meet all expectations but it’s well made and lives up to the product details and description. It exceeds normal consumer expectations.

  844. As a redhead, I felt the need to expand on some of the other reviews I read before purchasing this product. I love this product- it is great for removing coarse hair, like bikini area and some on my legs. It is so much better than hair removal creams, because by removing the entire hair you get longer before you develop \\"stubble\\" and feel smoother much longer. The idea that it takes three weeks for hair to re-grow is medically inaccurate, and will disappoint people expecting to not have to use this epilator but every three weeks. (I have to use it about every three to four days.) This epilator is wonderful for pubic hair. When I use it on my legs it takes out the coarse hair, which makes my legs feel very smooth. It DOES NOT take out soft, fine hair, which is what I mostly have on my legs. So while my legs feel smooth, if you look at them (as I noticed the first time when out watching tennis in the sun) you see lots of little hairs. Of course, when you then shave with a razor, you still feel smoother for longer bc removing the coarse hair totally again makes you feel smoother longer than any other hair removal. I have spent extensive time trying to remove all the hair on my legs, but have realized it is just not going to take out the soft hair, but I really like the effect it has even just removing coarse hair. I tried it on some facial hair with the same effect- I bought another smaller emjoi epi-slim epilator which does better with facial hair.<br />Also, anyone with sensitive skin, just be aware your skin can develop little bumps when hair is removed (like a mosquito bite) but these go away on me in about 4-6 hours. The first time I used it I was horrified bc it looked like I had some kindof serious disease, but the inflammation completely went away. Because of this inflammation I can't use it the same night I am going out on a date or anything.<br />In my opinion, the pain is moderate the first time you use it. I did not think it was at all severe, and there was no way it would stop me from using the epilator. It feels like having several hairs plucked at once. (I kindof like the feeling bc I know it is working when I feel that sensation.) It is more tolerable when you use the epilator regularly, but I think that is just bc there isn't as much hair to remove with subsequent uses. I had no problem with the pain when doing my legs, underarms can be tear producing painful, and I stopped doing them (bc of the coarse/fine hair problems- I still had to shave them regularly). The pubic hair is variable. The outer hair is not too painful at all, but when you get to the more sensitive areas there are serious limitations. I am not able to do all my hair down there bc of pain.<br />I think there are some differences that people will notice depending on their hair type. Just wanted to give a heads up to all the other blond and redheaded women out there! :)ere was no way it would stop me from using the epilator. It feels like having several hairs plucked at once. (I kindof like the feeling bc I know it is working when I feel that sensation.) It is more tolerable when you use the epilator regularly, but I think that is just bc there isn't as much hair to remove with subsequent uses. I had no problem with the pain when doing my legs, underarms can be tear producing painful, and I stopped doing them (bc of the coarse/fine hair problems- I still had to shave them regularly). The pubic hair is variable. The outer hair is not too painful at all, but when you get to the more sensitive areas there are serious limitations. I am not able to do all my hair down there bc of pain. I think there are some differences that people will notice depending on their hair type. Just wanted to give a heads up to all the other blond and redheaded women out there! :)

  852. I purchased this because I was very tired of shaving - I like very smooth legs so I shaved every other day at least. I have never had professional wax, and only tried home waxing once and hated it so much I never did it again. I was worried since some reviewers said it was very painful that i might be flushing money down the toliet, and couldn't compare it to waxing. Thankfully, it is not that painful. The pain of epilating is like a 2 out of 10, slightly uncomfortable but bearable. For reference, this pain scale would be 1 as muscle soreness after a tough workout and 3 is stubbing your toe. I would agree with other reviewers the first time is the worst, but after its much easier - both because you are more accustomed to it and because you have less hair to epilate. The introductory head I found useful only because I had trouble keeping the epilator at 90 degrees otherwise although now I have switched. I like that it has two settings also, so that now that I have used it for a while I can use the faster setting. I find that using the epilator once a week or every other week is enough to keep you legs pretty smooth. You will miss hairs, so if you like you legs to be very smooth you may still have to shave. I would also recommend epilating at least 24 hours before you want smooth legs bbecause you will have unattractive little red bumps where the hair was plucked out for half a day or so.
  853. I first bought Braun Silk Epil about 10 years ago. It was one of their first models. I use it once or twice a month for legs, underarms and arms. Before that, I used to wax. Over the last decade, my hair growth had really thinned and I can easily go up to 4-6 weeks without having to do my legs. After nine years of use, my original Silk Epil suddenly broke down when I was only halfway done with my legs! I bought the 5270 from a local Target store for $70. I just love it! They have really improved the Silk Epil and I love the light!! The two heads also help. I can do my legs and arms very fast with the expert clip but I need the other more gentle clip for underarms. The new model is also more accurate and removes the hair in slightly less time. I wouldnt say it hurts any less though. It doesnt hurt much because you get used to it, but both models feel the same. If you are thinking about using an epilator, just do it! If you dont like it, you can return it. But having used it for so long, I love the ease and convenience Silk Epil offers. No sticky wax, no expense of going to a salon. And no stubbles that spring up after shaving. I have never used any other epilator except Silk Epil so I dont know if others are better or worse.
  854. I found this product disappointing. It works well on my armpits but that's about it. The process is incredibly tedious when it comes to the legs and, since my hair grows at different speeds, my legs are NEVER completely smooth. It is impossible not to miss spots as well. So, if I want somewhat smooth legs, I'm having to pull out the epilator every other day, waste alot of time attempting to find new/missed spots, clean up the epilator, vacuum, just believe me..it's tedious. The ingrown hair problem cannot be overlooked either. I've gone back to shaving my legs b/c it works better and is less annoying. Yep, it sucks to be a girl.
  855. works great! previously had epilady and this is more powerful. would recommend and would buy again
  856. I previously owned an Epilady and liked it pretty well but read many reviews that stated that the Braun is much better. No comparison! The Braun is hands down the Mercedes of the two brands. I get more hair removal in less time with the Braun. Hope it lasts as long as the Epilady at the very least! This is not perfect so no five-star rating but is very, very good in my humble opinion.
  857. I don't know who invented this thing,(undoubtedly a man) but I love them and hate them at the same time!!!!!!!!!! I bought one at Target today after weeks of agonizing over the price and potential pain. I just finished epilating my arms and I must say, OWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWA!!!!!!! However, they are now silky smooth and I can't stop touching them. (so glad my husband's not home right now) Although I feel a strange buzz in my skin right now, hopefully that sensation will subside by the time I get up the nerve to do my legs!! If you can keep from passing out from the pain it soon becomes a rather enjoyable experience watching the fur fly!!!Get your mind out of the gutter you pervs, I'm still talking about my arm hair!! LOL! Anyway, pain aside it was very fast, clean and very effective. Beats the hell out of messy waxing! Alas, the things we ladies do for beauty. Bottom line... Buy it. It hurts but you know what they say, no pain, no gain!
  858. It does what it was supposed to do. My wife is happy now....
  859. For years I had been trying to figure out how to solve the problem of arm hair. I don't mean underarm hair, I mean hair on my forearms and upper arms. Being part Italian, I've been plagued with dark hair on my arms. Up until now I'd tried everything - waxing (the hair would come back after 2 weeks, so that was like $100 a month! I only did it a couple of times), shaving (I'd have to do it practically every day, otherwise I'd get this awful stubbly, prickly hair all over my arms...). I just wanted to solve that problem. I didn't care about my legs, since all women deal with leg hair, and I don't mind shaving my legs, but not everyone deals with too much arm hair (many women are lucky to have sparse arm hair). Anyway after MUCH research I decided on this great little Epilator. I was a little nervous, because some people said it didn't work well, or that it was really painful, gave them really bad ingrown hairs, etc. My pain threshold is probably slightly above average... When I got the Silk Epil in the mail, I tried it out immediately on my arms. It was somewhat painful.. I took breaks and slowly did both arms. Afterwards, and for about 12 hours afterwards, they were red and blotchy. I exfoliated right afterwords with a back scrubber on my arms (it's rough but really exfoliates well). I then applied aloe vera gel... soon after, voila, I had smooth arms (the redness went away and I did not get any ingrown hairs). For the first time ever (aside from when I waxed), I didn't feel that annoying below-the-skin stubbly feel on them. To make it even better, I didn't have to re-do them for another couple of days (to get the next stage of hair growth, I believe). After that, I didn't epilate them for about 9-10 days. Some regrowth appeared but it was actually in the form of fine hairs, ones that were not really noticeable, and that were fine to the touch (NOT prickly...!!!!). I have been really happy. I feel like this thing has really changed my life, because I no longer have to worry about shaving my arms each day (and having that gross \\"5 o'clock\\" shadow on my ARMS... and not having to worry about someone touching my arms). I also used it on the nape of my neck a little as well as on my lower stomach a bit (I was blessed with dark body hair :( ). Now, it's not PERFECT, there are some finer hairs that it doesn't really pick up, but I don't mind. I love my Silk Epil.
  860. I've been using epilators for the last 12 years. I've always been a fan of Braun and this latest model is a definite improvement. There are several cutting heads - both beginner and novice levels, plus a little light to see the way. Definitely worth the money and costs have not gone up very much for the Braun product in the last 12 years. Highly recommended.
  861. i'm pretty sure this is the model i have. that said, this thing has revolutionized my life! okay, that's an overstatement, but it is really nice to be able to go at LEAST a week without shaving. sometimes i go for longer because with this epilator the hairs grow in softer (so you don't have that unpleasant \\"stubbly\\" feel). i didn't think it hurt all that much on my legs (unless you're doing some euphamistic hedge trimming, which was a terrifying lesson for me), but my underarms were another story. i still use it on my underarms, and it doesn't hurt as much as it used to, but it definitely doesn't feel great. if you do choose to try it on your underarms, here are some tips: rub down the area with baby powder (this will temporarily absorb any moisture which makes using the epilator both more painful and less efficient), then pull the skin as taut as you can with your free hand, and then go to town. i think that second suggestion is really important for epilating on skin that has any laxity to it (eg, thigh, underarm skin): pull the skin taut!!! also, it doesn't hurt as much if the hairs are on the shorter side of things (with this thing you don't have the unpleasantness of having to grow out your hairs super long so it can catch hold of them). that said, you will probably need to make a couple passes to remove all the hair. it can take a while, but if you mindlessly do it while you're watching tv or something, you'll be carefreely bare for awhile! overall, i'm really happy with this thing, and my mother and sister both sneak using it when they visit me.
  862. This is the first epilator I have ever used, having always been a shaving woman. On the first use, the pain is quite awful as has been stated in other reviews. I thought the comparison to getting a tattoo was right on the money. I have been using it for about four months as of writing this review and am pleased with it for the most part. The other ladies were correct in saying the pain does lesson with each use. I have not been able to use it on the bikini line or armpits though. My tolerance for pain is fairly high but that is just too much (even with the ibuprofen). I'll stick with shaving on those areas, and the shaver included with this works very nicely. I am using it weekly and havent noticed any lessening of hair growth as was described by others but it probably takes longer for that to happen. It is a time consuming undertaking and it is just a matter of personal preference wether you want to spend 30 minutes epilating once a week or 10 minutes shaving every other day (or in my case epilating AND THEN shaving the more sensitive areas). All in all it seems to be a good product and I would recommend it as long as youre prepared for some discomfort.

  870. I've been using these wicked mechanical tweezers for almost two decades now. And they're still the best bet all around. Cheaper than waxing. More convenient, that's for sure. You don't have to make appointments. You go through relatively the same process of growing out your hair and then it grows back in without the blunt end as would a shaved hair, so it seems smoother and finer. And, as with waxing, the more often you do it, the less often you have to do it. This Silk Epil Xelle is nice because it doesnt have the old fashioned coil, so you have an awful lot of control with what you're doing. The light is a nice touch - though frankly you either need a bright light or you go by feel. This product has a nice wide system. I can't comment on pain factor as some other reviewers have as after so many years, I'm pretty immune to it now. But insomuch as every few years I do need to buy a new one - and I like this one -- that's a good recommendation coming from someone who has owned more than 10.

  877. I absolutely love it. It works just as promised and the lighting is great. the first time is the worst time, because the skin isn't used to it and there's so much hair, but if you stay on top of it and do it frequently, it becomes painless. Because hair grows at different rates, you'll only get some hair on the first go-through. The next day, do it again, and you'll get more. Do it again on a third day, and most of the hair below the skin should be gone. From there, about once or twice a week. Shave for added smoothness. When shaving, the smoothness seems to last much longer. I adore the built-in light! It really helps! And I was impressed at how short the hairs can be and still be plucked. This eipillator is so good, I almost want to buy two so that I have a spare should something happen to my current one.

  880. The hair on my legs is coarse and fast-growing, and I've tried a lot of methods over the years--shaving, depilatories, sugaring, and waxing--to keep it from getting unsightly. So after reading a number of reviews and user comments, I thought I'd give this epilator a try. I've had it for just over a month now, and it's worked well for me. The process is uncomfortable and takes a little while to do thoroughly, particularly the first time or two, but the results are good (especially if you follow Braun's instructions about recommended hair length and skin preparation before you start). Hair regrowth is lighter and the new hair is finer, as advertised, so stick with it.

I did find that due to my excessively dry skin that I had some itching and redness but the redness was no more than you would find during a waxing and some quality hand cream took care of the itching.<br /><br />Since I HATE shaving, I can say with certainty that I will be keeping this epilator and using it.   882. This is a well designed product. It has 2 speeds and a little light so you can see the fine hairs.   884. I can't say that I love the Braun 5270 Silk-epil X'elle, but I do like it enough to keep using it. First of all, I don't know who claims that you can use it as infrequently as every four weeks. I have been using the 5270 for a month now, and I have to shave my legs at least once a week and my armpits every two to three days. In addition, it definitely takes me longer to epilate than it ever did to shave, so I'm not sure that there is any time savings. That said, the hair is definitely finer, less noticeable, and sparser, and I can only hope that things will continue this way until I hardly have any hair left at all.... My other complaint is that, no matter how much I epilate, my legs never feel completely smooth -- I suspect that I'm feeling hair that I've previously epilated that is too short for the tweezers to grab, but it is annoying. So, why am I keeping at it? I like the fact that, even as the hair is growing back, you really can't see it. There is no appearance of stubble or \\"five o'clock shadow\\" (for lack of a better term) on my armpits as the hair is growing back. Also, you can't beat either the cost or the ability to epilate at home on your own schedule. A final word on the pain factor -- it never hurt on my legs and, after the first time on my underarms (which was downright excruciating and actually drew blood), it doesn't really hurt on my armpits, either. I think it still would hurt on my armpits but for the fact that I am now contending with significantly less hair so there's not as much chance for the pain to accumulate. I have not yet braved my bikini area and am planning to follow another reviewer's suggestion to get a wax first and epilate thereafter. Overall, although I don't love this epilator, it beats shaving in appearance and waxing in cost, so I will probably keep using it.

But I was willing to do anything to get a hairless stomach. I kind of got freaked out when I got red welts all over, but they disappeared within a day.   899. I have very dark body hair that is fine, but plentiful. I usually shave my lower legs and under-arms. I occasionally Nair my upper legs and arms. Since I am not a waxer, using this device the first few times was definitely \\"ouchie,\\" but nothing you can't handle. Just switch back and forth 'tween legs and arms. The comfort head definitely helps. Also, the first few times don't worry about getting every single hair, just get used to it. I have not had the guts to try my under-arms yet; I'm sure it will work great, but I'm also sure it will hurt a lot worse! :) I've used it three times, and I've already switched off the comfort head in order to get smoother results. Make sure your skin is dry before you use the epilator, with no lotion! I have a small scrubbing sponge that I use to exfoliate before and after I use the epilator; I also use lotion afterwards, and I have not had any ingrown hairs (a big problem when I shaved). My hair is already growing back smoother and slower then with shaving. I also do not have to worry about melting off my skin with Nair anymore. This thing is pretty loud though, so it's not very discreet!
  900. If you do not have a lot of hair, you will love this epilator, it is very nice.
