I hate shaving and this definitely cuts down on the frequency of having to shave/epilate. It is a little noisy, but I just turn on the TV and epilate away. It is easy to clean if you brush it out after every use.<br /><br />I use it on my legs and underarms and while it is a little painful, the rollers help. After using it for awhile, you get kind of immune to it, plus your hair grows back finer so it is also less painful then as well.<br /><br />The light is a big help when trying to see where you may have missed on your legs, especially the backs of your legs.<br /><br />Overall, this was a really great purchase.
  1122. Very Good Product, I recommended.
  1123. I bought this after I became a mom and wanted a way to cut down on the time spent shaving my legs. This fits the bill. You just plug it in, go over your legs kinda like an electric razor, then brush it off with the brush it comes with and you're done. My legs have never been softer. I used to have stubble almost right away after shaving. My legs were never soft. I've had no issues with pain and I'm the world's biggest weenie when it comes to pain. Of course you are going to feel it but it's no big deal. The first time I used this was right after a hot shower and shaving my legs. I used it every day for 7 days. Then every couple of weeks thereafter. Now I have soft legs AND more time to spend with my baby! I highly recommend it.
  1124. Every girl needs an epilator to epilate their underarms especially! My armpit hairs grow right after a shave! So i always had to shave everyday -.- But after I epilate it, the hairs don't come back for at least a week! Its amazing! The only downside to this is that it hurst like hell, every time i do it! if i do it everyday i might get used to the pain, but it hurts like hell especially the first time! Just go slow, ice pack the area before you start, and take pain reliever before using it. Also it makes a really scary sound (as do all epilators) that makes you believe that it'll take your skin off with the hair, but it doesn't i promise! I suggest putting the epilator on the palm of your hand, and you'll believe that this is no scary torture device! it will simply massage the palm of your hand! and it makes you more at ease with it. I also use it on my armpits, arms, legs and occasionally my bikini area. But i really like this epilator because it has a very white bright light that shows any unwanted hairs - a feature that not many epilators offer. I bought this epilator a year a go, and its still going strong! (: Its a love hate relationship with this device. It hurts like hell, but gives you such beautiful results that you can't do anything but go back to it.
  1125. If you never use this before, imagine use a tweezer to pull hairs.   1130. I'd give it 10 stars if I could. This device has been a lifesaver for me. I am too much of a chicken to go to a salon; however, with a little trial and error, I've learned to do the epilation everywhere, even on bikini and underarm. My smooth skin gives me so much confidence, and it does not hurt a bit anymore. <br /> <br />If you are a chicken like me, follow my instructions instead of the manual, provided you are willing to invest a lot of time initially. I said initially, because, after a couple of months, the pain will subside and you'll be able to do it any way you want, while watching TV or lulling your baby to sleep. (Yes, the sound does soothe the baby! Consider that an unadvertized perk.) <br /> <br />So here is how to start. <br /> <br />1) Take a long, hot bath. <br /> <br />2) Shave. If you are persistent, that's the last time you ever will. <br /> <br />3) Use SilkEpil on just shaved skin. Yes, there will be hardly any results, but there won't be any pain either, and your muscles will relax; it's important to get into the habbit or relaxing while epilating, reduces the pain greatly. <br /> <br />4) Repeat next day (except, of course, no shaving). Heck, repeat later same day. You will achieve the results gradually while staying within your comfort zone as far as the pain goes. Do it every day until you feel in control, then gradually reduce the time interval between epilations to up to a month. <br /> <br />5) When you begin feeling pain on one leg, switch to the other. Somehow that reduces the pain. <br /> <br />6) Use long, quick strokes until you are comfortable. <br /> <br />7) Holding the device so that it rotates in the direction of the hair growth makes the process much more gentle on you and more time cosuming. <br /> <br />8) If you feel like giving up at any point, remember the 2nd epilation will be nothing like the first; the 3rd will be a breeze. <br /> <br />Good luck! <br /> <br />As for the product, my only wish is that it was cordless.<br /> <br />(Oh BTW, don't let my nick fool you: I AM a woman ;-) )

  1133. This Braun Epilator has tiny little metal slots that rotate very quickly to essentially pluck all of your hairs out. It came with a convenient carrying pouch and it was rechargeable so that was a huge plus not having to buy batteries. My wife got it in search of what every woman seeks, a better solution to shaving very frequently. Plucking lasts a lot longer. Other epilators on amazon have more metal slots to pluck hair or spin faster. The more and faster, the less painful and less passes it takes. I decided to get this one based off reviews. Some reviewers say you get used to it. One word to describe this product is pain. It successfully plucks the hair on the skin, but it is challenging holding this up to your skin knowing the pain you are going to receive. It leaves a trail of sheer redness as if the skin was chemically burned. If you have sensitive skin, don't even bother buying this because it will tear it apart. She has never gotten used to it and would rather stick to traditional methods, as the pain from this was supposedly indescribable. It is a 50/50 gamble if you buy this epilator, or any epilator for that matter.

  1141. The Silk-epil epilators come in different sets - the number ( example 5100) tells you what should be inside the box ( once you open there is a manual that lists different attachment combinations , with numbers). I got mine in Bed Bath and Beyond ( nb 5170 , if I remember well ) and it comes with :an attachment for the beginners ( massaging one, plus a head with less twizers - that is very useful you dont get too many hair out , but you can get used to the \\"funny\\" feeling and the pain lever ), regular attachment, and one for the best effects (most painful combination, the best working one; with this one I can depilate my legs in 20 minutes and the results are awsome) and one more thing cool pack - I still use the cool pack after the depilation. When it comes to the pain level - there is no way that pulling out hair is not going to be painfull. You can make it better by taking a very warm shower or tub before the depilation ( be carefule if you have heart problems ), I would not recommend putting any lotions on the areas that you are going to depilate nor before neither after hair removal ( putting any lotion after can cause irritation and an ingrown hair problem ) . If it gets to be too painful - shave the rest and depilate in two days. After 3 months of using the silk-epil twice a month I can say that I would recommend it to anyone . I know that some sets come with the attechments for the face hair removal, I bought the attachment seperate.

Which is great. That being said, the very first time you epilate will be painful. I have thicker hair than most women who epilate, and the machine ends up breaking quite a few hairs instead of pulling them out. So I do epilate every few days or every day.   1152. [[ASIN:B000EZYKTS Braun 5270 Silk-epil X'elle Body System Epilator]] After cutting my ankles with a blade, I started falling back on my electric shaver. But, the electric didn't shave very well even though new, and made my hair grow in faster and more coarse. I decided to try epilating my legs again. I'd tried about 20 years ago, but couldn't take the pain, so this gentle removing system really caught my eye. I read the reviews and got tons of great tips that really helped: exfoliating first in a warm shower & opening the pores, (yes, I had a glass of wine the first time-but only the first), making sure to hold it at 90 degrees, cooling/closing the pores after, waiting 30-60 minutes then moisturizing. This turned out to be the greatest product and best buying decision! It was a little painful the 1st time only on a couple of tender spots, but overall very tolerable. The 2nd time was easier, the 3rd a breeze. Those massaging rollers really do help, and after 2 months I'm already down to epilating my legs only about every 3 weeks. The hair is coming in slower, thinner and lighter. No more shaving for me-what a time saver! I highly recommend the Braun 5270 to anyone who's tired of shaving or waxing, but is concerned about if it will hurt too much. A final note-the page I saw said there was a \\"cooling glove\\" enclosed, but it wasn't in the package. Braun said this glove NEVER came in the 5270 model and has been discontinued for all their models, so don't expect the glove. For now, I'm using a substitute. This gets an A+++!
  1153. Other reviews have addressed how well this product works, and I concur (this is my fifth epilator and by far the best).<br /><br />If this is your first epilator and you're not a regular waxer, you need to be prepared. The first time you use it will hurt like hell, and you may want to just try to do small patches to start.<br /><br />But the pain will lessen over time for two reasons. The first is that your hairs don't grow in evenly, so the more often you use it, the fewer hairs you will be pulling out at any one time. And second, it seems that after a while it just hurts less. Maybe the nerves in the hair follicles get worn out. But after a few years, especially on my legs, I can barely tell it's doing anything, nothing more than a little sensation of yanking.<br /><br />So hang in there, it's worth it. No paying for waxing and no need to let your hair grow so the wax will work. No prickly stubble from shaving. And since the hair seems to grow back thinner or softer, no big deal if you don't feel like epilating all the time.

Even with waxing, it didn't last very long since the hair grows back at different rates. I love this device. I recommend it, wholeheartedly. Background: I have a very hairy face. I'm not talking fine facial hair. Bleaching does no good--it just gives me white hair instead.   1171. Alright, so I will admit it up front---I have a love/hate relationship with epilators.<br /><br />At the tender age of 12 or so, when I firmly told my mother I want to be hair free and demanded a razor, she instead gave me an epilator and told me that with coarse hair such as mine, shaving would be futile. After lots of tears I decided that NO, I will be just like everyone else in school and razor.<br /><br />After shaving through my highschool and college years, I have come to the practical conclusion that yes, momma was right and with hair like mine---COARSE, THICK,UGLY--razoring is futile. My hair grows out by midday and it's just plain nasty. So I have returned to the epilator.<br /><br />After using this product for a few months, I LOVE LOVE LOVE the fact that I can go a week without the need to epilate, but alas--the ingrowns. They're there, there ugly, and there are a lot of 'em. But I've decided the ingrowns I can handle, the shaving everysinglefreakingday, I cannot.<br /><br />This unit keeps me hair free for about a week or so. The light whihc I thought at first was gimmicky, I've grown to love; also, the trimming head is something I use quite often. The pain isn't as bad as I remember it being from when I was twelve, and the ingrowns I am HOPING to get rid of by using Tend Skin.<br /><br />If this were cordless, I would give 5 stars.
  1172. I only review things when I really, really love or hate them, and this one definitely falls under the 'love' category. I have waxed and epilated for a couple of years now, and the epilator I was using just never seemed to get those tiny hairs. You know they're there, but can't find them until your legs are highlighted in the sun and look like giant, hairy caterpillars. The little light on this thing really spotlights those hairs- and the tweezer heads actually GET THEM! I tried it on the 40 head attachment, on high speed, with the massage roller dealies, and I didn't think it hurt at all. It tickled a little bit at first, though. This is by far the best epilator I have ever used, both for being painless and getting the most hairs/highlighting them. I recommend it to anyone looking to stop shaving or waxing.
  1173. So I got this braun 5270 silk-épil X'elle Body System Epilator and it was alright at best. It does its job. And pretty fast too, I can do both full arms and underarms in about 20 mins. What I don't like about this product is that my hair growth is thicker than normal. I've been waxing for over 8 years and my hair had become very fine, especially on my arms. I could go 3-4 weeks without waxing and my arms looking bad. After I started using this epilator, my hair grows back much thicker and is more noticeable during regrowth. Same with my underarms and legs. Another thing I didn't like, is that I seem to be getting a lot of ingrown hairs now. Which isn't a great thing. Overall its fast, easy to use, not very painful, and easy to clean. Negatives: you need to keep it corded or it wont work. Which sucks if you're not near a power source.
  1174. I purchased this product after seeing so many highly rated reviews and the price wasn't too bad of an investment either. The product does what is says and I like it very much so far. And while there is some pain when your hair is being yanked out, it goes away in a second and you are left with smooth skin. And while Ive only used it twice, Ive noticed you kinda just get use to it and the \\"pain\\" becomes expected and its more of a very small discomfort / prickle and really isn't an issue anymore. The only reason I give it 4 stars is because its not cordless and there the little hairs that get yanked out kinda fly everywhere or build up in the little gadget. So after each use, you have to take the head attachment off and clean it out with the included mini brush thingy. Just good upkeep practices to keep the lil guy running, takes like 2 minutes. It's a good investment if you are too lazy to shave/cut yourself every other day and its quick too, prob less than 10 minutes for both legs if you do a pass every 4-5 days or so. Im im pretty sure ill work into a nice routine after a few more weeks =o)
  1175. The Braun Epilator has freed me from shaving daily. I can now wear shorts everyday without having to worry about shaving first. My first experience with the epilator was a little uncomfortable but with each use it became less painful and I love that I am no longer a slave to my razor. I can now say good-bye to the irritation associated with shaving. The hair on my legs now grows in very light and barely visible. I recommend this product whole-heartedly!
  1176. From the beginning, I knew that ripping the hair out of my body would be painful. I expected that. What I didn't expect is that all those hair folicles would also get inflamed and turn into ingrown hairs (even when I followed all the directions). I stopped using this when I was getting a new scar on my legs (from deep ingrown hairs) every time I tried it. Using it on my neck and chin I looked like I had razor burn. I'm not even going to go into bikini line. For now, I'm back to shaving my legs and using [[ASIN:B000BJ1HA2 Gigi Brazilian Bikini Wax Microwave Kit]] for my neck and chin. I hoped I could use the shaver for a while, but it dulled quickly and got really back clogged with baby-fine hairs. This product barely made it 6 months in the house. Wish I hadn't wasted my money.
  1177. This is the best and least painful epilator I've ever used. The light is fantastic. I was worried because I had been using another top brand for the past 10 years, but this epilator is much better than my last, more expensive, epilator. This epilator does not accidentally catch your skin. I highly recommend it.

Someone recommended me emjoi, so I thought I'd give it a try as I'm getting a rechargeable one with the price of braun silk-epil. And its still the best in my opinion. About the pain.. any brand will cause the pain when ur hair is plucked. Trust me, there is no way you can have less pain when doing this. Only way to ease your pain is do it as many times as you can.

  1182. I've been using this product for about 4 weeks now instead of shaving my legs. It has never made my legs feel silky or smooth, the way that shaving did. It cannot remove the very short hairs that irritate me the most, but it does remove the longer, visible growth. So if tiny stubble doesn't give you problems, then this is a good product. But if you're looking for great smoothness, stick to shaving or another hair-removal method.
  1183. I purchased this for my fiancee, who tends to forget to shave. She had mentioned that she might try it so I bought it for her. Initially it was extremely painful for her and she could only do her legs. She can now do her underarms and bikini area (still hurts, but is hurting less as she uses it more). She only shaves once a week if she remembers... but her legs stay smooth. Thank god. :) She insisted that I try using it on my leg when she started using it. I didn't seem to think that it really hurt. More just a pinching sensation. I'm not sure though. I am a guy and never shave my legs so maybe the long hairs made it less painful...?
  1184. I didn't know what to expect, but if you follow the directions precisely and trim your hair short to a 1/8 stubble and exfoliate, this thing works wonders. I did my dark, coarse hair bikini line and three weeks later -- smooth and the hair that's growing back is finer and lighter! Amazing that the advertising on the box meets and exceeds expectations. Exfoliate a lot and use crushed aspirin in distilled water to soothe the bumps and visine to take the red out. It didn't hurt me much, but I really exfoliate so that might be the reason why. However, I did my underarms and that really smarted. Worth it though.
  1185. I'm writing this review for my wife and giving her impressions. I bought this for her for Christmas 2008 and we of course tested it to make sure it worked. I was a bit worried after reading the reviews, that she might not be able to tolerate the pain. But she handles full body waxing without any problems so I figured it's worth a shot. We tried the head with the little prickly rollers as well as the head with the flat piece and the flat thing works better for my wife. Her biggest thing is it tickles her. We tried it on her arm first she barely noticed it, then we tried it on her leg and she felt it was a bit ticklish and then on her back, she squirmed a lot as it tickled her. The flat head tickles her less and grabs more hair. Then we tried it on her face, well that proved a bit more painful, so it took like 5 minutes to do her face, including sideburns. I figured ok, maybe it's not working very well..... no pain, no gain, right?! So I tried it on my lower leg....... Ok, well, THAT was a bad idea! I have very hairy legs and pretty long hair besides and Yes it works, and yes if you have long thick hair it hurts. My wife has a lot of fine hair so for her it's easy to use and being used to waxing she didn't think it was working but she could sort of feel the hair being tweezed. But the hair needs to be wiped off as this just throws the hair out of the unit. So a few bats with a dry towel and surprise no hair! Yes you do have to go over a spot a few times and I now wish we had bought the Braun SE7280 instead, as it looks like it would be easier to use on her back. I myself own a Braun 9595 razor and use it daily and love it. This Braun 5270 Epilator is the same rugged quality as my $200 Braun Razor. If you have thick hair this is probably going to hurt, so the suggestions about getting the hair short and then using this seem like a good idea. But for my wife this is a breeze to use and no pain at all. Of course if you have very dark hair and light skin you can lookinto Laser Hair Removal but this is much cheaper and seems to work great and it's pretty quick except on her back. Of course I might not be doing her back right. I have a hard time waxing her back as it is. This is much much easier than waxing her back and much faster. So she loves this and now it's boxed up until Dec 25th. But my wife, a Filipina, Highly Recommends this.

  1188. As a woman with PSOS and excess facial hair, I have tried many methods of removal, but I finally found one that seems to work really well and doesn't have the downside of shaving or having to have the hair grow out for several embarassing days before it will work. I took the advice of the reviewer \\"Mark Twain\\" and I think it was excellent. Hot bath, exfoliation, shave, then beginning to use the Braun that day. Then use it daily after that (or until you don't need it daily, I presume) I exfoliate with Boraxo Hand Soap (people always freak out when I tell them this, but it is wonderful. I have used it on my face and body for over 30 years.) I use it with an exfoliating hand mitt. For afterward, I have mixed my own brew of witch hazel (with aloe or not), about 40 generic aspirins that dissolve, except for a little big of coating grain that doesn't bother me. Then, I put on 1% hydrocortisone cream for redness. I have only had two ingrown hairs (fingers are crossed). It really does hurt less and less as you go on, though my upper lip is still a bit tender. Even that is getting better. I highly recommend this product!
  1189. This is my third epilator-type product and I love it. I have been using one for several years with excellent results. The most difficult part is getting started, as it can be painful the first use especially in areas where the skin does not have much muscle underneath. Dedication to consistent use is rewarded with the best results. I would not recommend it for use where the skin is loose such as the face and underarms. Each time you remove a hair, the regrowth is softer and gradually grows back more slowly. After months of use, there is little regrowth. However, I wish it were cordless or at least had a longer cord, as I have to use an extension cord.
  1190. This is a great product, albeit uncomfortable. It is like being tweezed a hundred times over, although the more you do it, the less uncomfortable it is. I use it a couple of times per month.

I had never waxed or epilated before, and although it took a little getting used to, the pain wasn't nearly as bad as I had heard people make it out to be. Definitely worth the money. Get this.

I've been shaving for years and dealt with years of itching, ingrowns, and pimples. I have tried all the creams but shaving just doesn't cut it. At first, it took me a few days to epilate my regions. It was the most unbearable pain one can imagine. I promised myself 3 months to try the product. Now at eight months, its a breeze. It still hurts, but not bad. It takes me about 30 minutes now to epilate, as the hairs come out much easier and less painful. The hairs also do not come back as full, thus its a breeze. I epilate probably once a month now instead of shaving daily. Its the best purchase ever. If you buy an epilator, read the reviews and get an idea how to numb the pain. All I can say is give yourself 3 months before you quit.

  1227. I bought this in hopes of eliminating the bumps and pain of shaving. I have a very high tolerance for pain and this was excruciating. I would definitely recommend waxing at least once before you try this. The whole point was to save some money so I did not wax my legs before trying this. It seems to have left the same pattern of red bumps that the razor would, but I rubbed on some pure aloe gel right after using the epilator and it helps calm the skin somewhat. The epilator does not seem to take to lighter hair; it removed all the darker hairs on my legs but left behind the thinner blonde ones. I can tell that there's going to be a need for round two in a day or so to remove the rest of the hair. Bottom line, I would give this 3.5 stars, it does what it is supposed to but if you can afford waxing that is a much quicker, less painful alternative.
  1228. there's a reason there are over 200 reviewers and this product has a nearly 5-star rating. i was an epilady user for nearly 20 years before it finally died. i loved the epilady and couldn't imagine my life without it. i'd tried nads and waxing as well. but when my epilady died, i only looked for another epilady. then, my sister suggested a braun. she's on these beauty forums and users had raved about the braun epilators. i read many reviews on the 5270 and couldn't really believe what they were saying about it. it was delivered to me just last friday and i absolutely love it. it gets even the littlest hairs that i had to grow out for the epilady. and despite the slightly intimidating noise it exerts (sounds like you're really doing yard work), the heavy vibrations disguises any pain i might be feeling. well, that's what i've experienced thus far. i've used it on my legs, arms and underarms. i was a bit overzealous with the underarm area that it caused slight bruising. one word of advice, be careful in those areas. you really need to make sure your skin is stretched out and firm otherwise, it will pull and pinch the skin, in a bad way.

  1230. I have dealt with excess hair for 25 years. It started on my Chin and got worse. Then I had dark hairs on my arms as well. I was constantly shaving and very self conscience. I was always afraid of someone noticing I shaved. 8 years ago I had laser treatments and spent a small fortune which helped but by no means got rid of the hair as I was told it would. That place shut their doors one day and I was left without the promised results. All I knew to do was constantly shave and hope it wasn't very noticiable. The hair on my chin and down under was coarse and black. I decided to try the Braun even though not much was said about using it as I needed to. The first time I used it I had not shaved the hair for 30 hours. That left enough growth to grab it with tweezers so I thought this should to. I am not going to say it did not hurt because it did. Especially the first time because there is so much hair. I pulled the skin as others suggested and kept going anyway. There was some bleeding and you could see hair it pulled out on the mirror and such. When I grabbed all I could with it my face was red and a little bumpy. I used a after cream as suggested and by the next day it was just a little red. Due to my work schedule and the fact you have to let it grow more then you want to be seen at work I waited a couple days, didn't shave it that night and used it again. This time was easier but still hurt. I noticed a great improvement in being more hair free with softer skin then I had in a long time there. Since I do it every Sunday and Wednesday where each time it picks up new growth due to the stages of hair growth but now after just 2 weeks today and using it 5 times it has gotten most growth and I no longer worry about people seeing that I have a 5 O clock shadow. It is gone and for me this is a answered prayer. For the first time I am not afraid for my husband to kiss my chin or caress my face around my chin and neck. I used it today and it was pretty much pain free since there wasn't much to grab. I also do my arms and my Bikini area and it leaves the softest skin. On those areas the first time was the worst, not to bad since. I love this product and can't say enough how it has changed my life. Ladies if you have coarse hair like whiskers you have to get rid of, this is the best. Anywhere you can grab hair with a tweezer you can use the Braun. A purchase I don't think you will regret.
  1231. I've been using Braun epilators for over 5 years and thought it might be time for an upgrade. The extra tweezers on this model make doing my legs a snap (so much faster and easier!)and the light really helps me focus on the area I'm epilating. I've even used this on my upper lip and it works great! (Though this is probably not advisable for beginners, I used the Braun facial Silk Epil for many years and have no problems doing it. I think that facial model was discontinued a while back). While this is fantastic for legs, I must say I prefer my old Silk Epil Eversoft 20 tweezer model for my underarms and bikini area because it doesn't have as many tweezers and isn't as \\"grabby\\", so I'm keeping both. (Although maybe I just need more practice with the new one). I must have saved thousands of dollars on waxing over the years by using Braun epilators. I highly recommend this epilator!
  1232. I wish I would have had this years ago!!! I've tried every method of hair removal available, this is far and away the best! Far less painful than waxing, more practical than shaving. Within an hour of first getting this I had done my legs, arms and face. It is very fast and works right into my regular routine. I noticed that it worked best on 1-2 day stubble after shaving. Tip: Use a loofah sponge to reduce ingrown hairs.
  1233. I will rather take the one time pain of using this epilator, than deal daily with razors, bumps, itching and burns. Please remember, however, that the pain is relative to each person's perception and sensitivity. For a good reason I can take a lot of pain without a blink, but that is my subjective measure. On the other hand, this unit seems to produce much less discomfort than my old, spiral type, epilator. Pain issue aside, this is really the best corded epilator/trimmer/shaver I can find on the market. Does a great job from face to foot, quickly and cleanly. I even use it for a quick touch up of my head hair line. With a regular use the re-growth becomes slower and weaker. For the beginners it is important to use it several times during the first about two weeks. That is to catch up with hair re-growing after previous shavings or other treatments. Once your body is free of hair, a touch up now and then is all you will need for a long time. Each consecutive treatment is less painful and less irritating, until you come to a point when the treatment feels more like a massage than hair removal. I even did my armpits - with a lot more discomfort (pain) than any other part of the body, but oh boy!, was it worth it. Not a single ingrown hair or bump like after shaving, no chemical irritation from lotions, no pealed skin cells from waxing. Just remember to use plenty of good quality moisturizer directly after the treatment to prevent skin redness and tingling. More sensitive skin will need several hours, maybe even a day or two to \\"cool off\\" before public appearance. It is very important to clean the unit VERY often - works and feels better. The cord is plenty long and the light is very useful. All the little attachments are very handy, especially for the initial treatments. Trim longer hair before pulling it - it is more effective and less irritating. Don't shave unless you absolutely must - hair after shaving grows back stronger and darker. Enjoy!
  1234. This product gives excellent results, leaves your skin silky-smooth. But i would suggest for the stage when the hair starts to grow back, you should have a skin solution that prevents ingrown hairs.

  1241. I bought this product with the intention of using it as a replacement for shaving and am pleased with the overall results. I have fine, sparse (but dark) hair and this works well for me. The pain is quite a shock at first even for me, a person with a high pain-tolerance but as my hair has gotten finer the pain has lessened significantly. The best: it works especially well on the underarms. I find that I can go for a week and a half without seeing stubble as opposed to the next day with shaving. The good: the replaceable attachments are great for buzzing other body hair and have liked this feature for my arms and bikini area. The semi-good: works so-so for the legs. Of course, ingrowns have become more common and I haven't found an exfoliator I like yet. Per the reviews here, I will assume an exfoliator will alleviate this problem significantly. I find my legs are not so much softer as they are less \\"hairy looking\\". I usually epilate then do a good shave. The shave lasts about a week then. The bad: the pain. Get ready for it, but by no means should this deter you from purchasing this. Like I said, hands down its worth it for the underarms alone. Note: this will not come in the sparkly blue with pink on button. Mine came entirely blue. No biggie. Definitely get this. Worth the money.

So if you are a wuss don`t bother. But cmon now if a sexy lil gurl can do this why can`t you ???<br />2 Wash skin with warm water before epilating to open up your pores making the process a lil easier.<br />3 This is NOT an electric razor so don`t use it the way you would a razor.   1245. I got my epilator yesterday and used it for the first time this morning. I'm not going to lie to you...it hurt! The first few passes on my legs had me holding my breath and breaking out in a sweat. But as the remaining hairs became more sparse, the discomfort reached a much more manageable level. I truly believe that future uses will prove less painful or even painless, especially if the product is used regularly to pluck out hairs as they come in. I even got up the nerve to do my underarms and bikini area! All areas are a bit red right now (I just finished) but not a whole lot worse in the bikini area than after I shave, so I am positive it will clear up shortly. The best part...my legs are wonderfully smooth and should stay that way for a lot longer than if I had shaved them. It makes a little pain worth it in my book! As for those who think that this epilator is simply breaking off the hairs, I know for a fact that this is not the case. The hairs I found on the ground and in the machine were at least twice as long as the growth on my legs, indicating without a doubt that they were pulled by the root. So after my very first use (and a fair amount of pain) I am still going to recommend this product! I look forward to being \\"shave free\\" and yet smooth and glorious all summer long.

  1257. Thanks to my Braun, I no longer shave in the shower. This results in less wasted water and less drying out of my already dry skin.<br /><br />The light in this device is great if you are on a mission to pull out each and every visible hair.<br /><br />There are a couple of things to realize about this method of hair removal:<br /><br />1) Hairs are always growing in on different cycles. Even if you epilate to the point of silky skin, there will always be a series of new hairs ready to appear, even though the ones you just pulled out will be gone for six weeks.<br /><br />2) This product cannot work unless the hairs are grown out far enough to be grabbed and pulled out. This is not so much an issue for legs as it is for underarms.<br /><br />Of course, the Braun is not responsible for either of the above two factors.<br /><br />Overall I am happy with my Braun, largely because showering no longer seems like a chore in terms of shaving my legs.

  1259. PAIN: The product description is very misleading. Using this is by no means 'painless' nor does it feel like a 'massage' where the rolllers 'glide over the skin'. Don't be gullible, ripping out hair from the roots cannot be such a pleasant and relaxing experience. The level of pain depends on where you're using this.. I had no problem doing the lower half of my legs/arms; the upper halves hurt a little more; underarms hurt quite a bit depending on how taut my skin was (tauter hurt less); and I will probably never try the bikini area again. I'm sure it will hurt more/less depending on each person's waxing/shaving history, on the thickness/fineness of the hair, and your level of tolerance for pain. RESULTS: Unless all of your hair grows at the exact same rate, you probably won't have perfectly smooth skin for 'up to 6 weeks' as claimed. However I've found that the porcupine/cactus-like feeling that comes with stubbles growing back after 3 days, is significantly reduced. Also, fair skinned people with dark hair don't have to worry about the leftover roots showing through from under the skin after shaving. It's an added value for people whose hair color is much darker than their skin's. You may have to do a quick shave or epilate or pluck for maintaining the near perfect hairless skin; straggler hairs are bound to appear for most people. USAGE: It is pretty loud for its size and I wouldn't use this at night where there are people sleeping nearby. It's probably almost as loud as my hair dryer. Sadly there is no depository for the plucked hair so your floor/bathroom can get rather messy. Don't use this on carpeted floors. I love being able to epilate at my leisure in the comfort of my own bathroom. And if you pay to get waxed regularly, this epilator will pay for itself over a couple of months.
  1260. This Epilator is the best one I have seen and used and the light is a plus. It lets you see everything. I have been using this item for almost a year now. You have to go over the area several times to get all the hairs. Pulling hair out hurts, but you get used to it in time. What I have found out and it's very frustrating is my leg hair grows back in a week or less. My legs are NEVER smooth, they are bumpy. I get ingrown hairs that I have to get with the tweezers, which leaves red sore looking marks all over my legs. My legs looked better shaving, smooth and nice looking, though I had to shave every day. This you use once every 4 days. Some of the hair, but not many have gotten thinner, most have gotten thicker. My legs are really ugly now, with ingrown hairs, sores from digging out ingrown hairs, and I have pain every 4 days. The pain is from the ingrown hair when you wear pants and it rubs against your legs. It is very uncomfortable and I try to exfoliate before using the epilator to get the hairs out so my legs will stop hurting. Why am I still using this? I am hoping that some day my hair on my legs will stop growing if I pull them out by the roots long enough. Though my boyfriend wants me to start shaving again, so I can have smooth legs again. This product is the best epilator you can buy, but their are problems with using it like I said above. It works great for my daughter who has always been embarressed about her hairy arms. We use the shaver that cuts the hair short, not pull the hair out, and my daughter is no longer embarressed about showing her arms now. So there is other uses for this product. I just wish I could be more happy about how it is on my leg hair.

  1272. The Braun 5270 Epilator does a great job at doing what it's supposed to, pulling hairs! For everyone that complains that it hurts, well what do you expect? Honestly? It's tweezing the hairs out of your skin many at a time...is this supposed to feel good? I bought this for my wife and she loves it. At first she said it hurt, but then she took it like a champ and didn't stop until she had done both of her legs. I tried it on my chest and yes it stings a little at first, but unless you have no tolerance for pain you'll get used to it pretty quickly...and bottom line, it does its job quite well. Pros: Pulls the hairs out by the root so you have smoother skin for a longer period of time versus shaving. Less messy than waxing. Better than shaving because your hairs won't grow back as thick, which may happen if you shave often. The white LED light on it helps you see those stray hairs. Gets your skin silky smooth. Comes with the shaver head and small cleaning brush, which comes in handy. Cons: It can result in ingrown hairs, so if you are prone to ingrowns, it may not be the right product for you. It's slightly loud, but not enough to really drive you crazy. Sounds maybe a little louder than an electric razor. It stings...but that's to be expected...suck it up if you want the results. Sometimes it can pinch the skin...you have to watch how hard you press it against your skin, and be careful if using it on areas such as your toes, it can pinch enough to scrape off the top layer (I found this out the hard way). It can't be used cordless, and many say the cord is too short...for some people they may need to use an extension cord if they try to use it in a bathroom without a nearby outlet. Sometimes you'll have to go over the same area multiple times and it may miss some hairs, but for the most part it gets the majority...it's not perfect, but 9.5 out of 10 for effectiveness. Bottom Line: If you want the results of tweezed-smooth skin, get this product. It does what it's supposed to. And for those people who buy this and then complain that it hurts...don't come writing bad reviews about it just because of that...you knew that going in! The only downside to using this product is that it can sometimes (maybe only on certain people) leave that person susceptible to ingrown hairs if the hairs do not pull out smoothly.

The plus side is that using the epilator makes my hair grow back every week, shaving makes my hair grow back almost daily so that's pretty nice. Also, make sure you use this after a warm bath. I didn't and it was a lot more painful, even made my underarms bleed a little. owchie!
  1277. I hope this review saves someone from the disaster I am experiencing. I've owned this product for 8 months, and at first it seemed a great solution to spending so much on waxing. I've been waxing for years and never minded the pain. I did not find the epilator to be painful as others have, perhaps because my hair is rather fine from waxing so long. Now I have terrible, terrible ingrown hairs on my legs that are sever to the point of embarrassing. I have tough skin so I thought it was just me. I exfoliate with salt scrubs and use tend skin or vanish and was still getting hundreds (no exageration here) of ingrown hairs. I did a lot of research on-line reading reviews and chat room posts. Apparently, this is a common phenomenon. The epilady seems great for about 6 months and then causes terrible, horrific ingrown hairs. I wish I had known. I wish I had never used it. I wish my legs didn't look like an extra in a disaster movie. I won't be selling mine on ebay because I don't want anyone else to experience this. After 8 months, it is probably too late to return it. I did read several recipes to help after the fact. Most go like this: Exfoliate everyday other day with an oil salt scrub. This leaves a thin coat of oil on your legs. Then shave with a new razor or one that has been used only once before. Make sure your legs are warm. Use Aveno sensitive skin shave cream. Rinse razor in cold water (to shrink the metal and keep it sharp) between every stroke. On the days when you do not shave, use tend skin or vanish morning and night. Do not tweeze any hairs. After a full 28 day cycle, you can stop shaving but keep exfoliating and using vanish or tend skin. Then you can return to waxing. Uggh! I never, ever wanted to have to shave!

After the first time using the Braun Epiator much less pain and lasts much longer for epilating. I am very happy with the results that I have gotten with this product.
